content:
Posted: February 25, 2015
												TL,DR version : Nice graphics and great music hiding an unbalanced mess with inefficient matchmaking. Avoid!As you may noticed, I spent ample of time in this game, coming back every so often to see what changed. I played until I was max level  / prestige to ensure I was certain how I felt about this game. The last few games I played cemented it. My conclusion: Nope. Not worth it.Firstly, as you may guess, it's a MOBA-type game on a 2D gaming plane. 2 bases, 2 lanes with a “jungle” somewhere. Thus it's normal there isn't a single player mode. Yes you can play vs bots and you can make them as hard as real people. But the main meat of this game is the multiplayer. You will unlock the 16 characters on 5 maps (4 of them are on a paid DLC)  Unlocking them all is just a matter of playing and acquiring solar, the in-game currency / experience. Gaining solar is easy as it's both in-match currency and experience out of it. Levels are quick and more often than not you will gain 2-4 levels per reasonably normal match. After unlocking characters and maps, you will unlock items to change how your skills are in-game. At 133 levels plus 10 prestige levels, it takes a long time to max out.The characters themselves are cool  in and of themselves. Each has a backstory into how and why they joined the Awesomenauts and their own personality often reflected in the game. All of them spout off random memes and typical nerd references here and there. Some of the (purchasable) skins they have even refer to other games, movies and tv series. Pretty cool overall.Graphics, voice over and music are quite good. Several famous youtubers voiced some of the characters, adding a nice familiar touch for those that are fans of said youtubers. The music also does explain why I kept returning : achieving a rampage (3 kills without death) gives you a rampage background song of your character's theme. Only you hear this remixed song and it adds a nice touch of encouragement for your accomplishement. Should your team really steamroll the other, you are awarded with "You are awesome!" text and the intro music will start playing instead. Often I would find myself listening to such and such character's songs on youtube, Skolldir theme being a personal favorite of mine. Now for the bad : first the characters feel unbalanced. Some were nerfed to near uselessness and others never properly balanced and retain their unfair advantages. And don't expect patches to balance them... They come every 4-6 months. The reason why so long? MOAR SKINS DLC!  Enjoy seeing the same characters winning constantly.Matchmaking feels completely arbitrary : you often play against or with people that outclass the others (i.e. out of the "league" you play) which leads to steamrolled games. Of course one can explain this as the player base slowly moving on but still hard for new players to even start off. Quitting has no real penalty so players do it left and right. What penalties you ask? No win bonus on your next victory and a "loss of ranking". Read the first phrase of this paragraph if you don't understand how ironic it is.For the player base, it's a mixed bag. Most of the games, the chat will be unused short of the GGs at the end. In rare occurrences, you might have a bit of a conversation and some laughs when all players chat up. In others, some "player" (I refuse to acknowledge someone that willingly abuses of a system in a game a player)  will decide that spamming all the voice commands is required to fully control the game. 3 out of 4 are team based and the last is a taunt to the opposing team. But said taunt can also be heard by the playing team thus adding more to the spam. As one person starts, others will also start and continue forth resulting into a spam-o-thon. Unfortunately, there are no squelching in this game. Hope you like hearing that audio spam! Oh wait quitting out of the match is still a viable solution. Thank goodness!All in all,  don't. There are better games both within Steam and even out of it that can satisfy both a MOBA-type of gamers and platformer gamers without resorting to this one. This one looks nice but it's inner layers hide such frustrating flaws that ruin the overall coolness.Final silly thoughs : I sometimes imagine this game as a Saturday morning cartoon. The settings does make it viable and will the menagerie of quirky characters...

content:
Posted: November 16, 2015
First of all - if you are another fanboy who get butthurt by all negative reviews - make your own with your opinion about this game, instead of thumb down. Or welcome to commentaries with criticism. Thanks------------------------Okay, its my 4 review for this game, first 2 was positive, then ronimo broke few things and its changed to negative. So...Obliviosly its sidescrolling MOBA. If you dont like dota (me too), but fan of action platformers - its may be your cup of tea. But 1st - few things you must know about it:Pros:- Graphics. Its rlly stylish 2d game with lots of EXPLOSIONS (not like in broforce, but anyways :D). Every naut has its own design (also few different skins, you can buy (changes only visuals), if you dont like default one), two different types of each skins (for blue and red teams), other things looks cool too.- Sound. Every naut has its own voice, sfxes and ost. Lone will pew-pew-pew, derpl - mew-mew-mew :D- Action. Its actually one of mostly action games I've ever played. If you think "yay, its casual moba with only 2 skills and 2 moves! I ll beat them all easy!" - you wont be right. Its WONT works after 6 league and you needs to use your hands and brains to win. Sadly, you wont win, using these things only, cuz of...Cons:- Lags. At 1st - its p2p game (like dota). But its netcode sux and matchmaking searching too. For example - you cant set "maximum ping to search" - only regions. Second thing is none cares about your settings - you can set "same region only", but if you will be host - latinos with 600ms will connect to you anyways.- Disbalance. Second thing, why lot of players left. Some nauts are easier to play, some harder... Balance, for me = simple formula "skills+build". But some nauts requires 0 skills to play and win as them. For example - Ayla. I seen lots of Aylas, who feeds until mid game, then got enough solar to buy all they need and starts to kill everyone, cuz mid-game ayla = very fast + life stealing + deals over 9k dmg/s by self-aoe skill, sized as 1/3 of screen.- Matchmaking. I said about lags, but its not only problem. Situations, when you have 2 league 8 guys in your team vs 3 league 4 guys in opposite arent rare. Also none cares about rating, so - you may be on 3k+ vs guy with 500 rate in other team. Also - you cant uncheck connection to started matches, so - your butt will burn 2 much, when you ll connect to matches on last seconds of them.- Premades. Thing, you will meet in league 4+. Guys, who plays with skype/teamspeak - there are almost no ways to♥♥♥♥♥♥them with randoms.- Splitscreens. Opposite side of teamwork - guys, who plays with splitscreen. If you have them in your team, you can insta-leave - this game is almost unplayable with controller and splitscreen players will care only about their mates irl, so - no teamwork too.I also could say about adv-like messages every 1 min on full window, if you plays multiplayer with bots, warping guys and 2.5 cheaters, but I wont. This game is fun for first 100 hours. Then you will drop it or play with pain in your butt. Sadly ronimo doesnt care about balance, servers and better matchmaking, so - I, for example, ll finish all achievements (7 left) and then drop it, like 70% of community.------------UPD 03 Dec:New update is terrible. In fact - Ronimo did things, nobody asked for - broke exists system with new unbalanced XP (right now you can insta-leave, if someone in your team died at least once, cuz its almost impossible to win vs higher lvl team. Bonuses for leveling are extremely high and its very fast) and turned balance to more horrorible one (simply killed all nauts with "safe" style). Also, new UI looks like drawn by someone, who never played video games before.After years of trying, Ronimo did it - Im moved this game to "trash" folder into my library.RIP Awesomenauts

Posted: November 25, 2013
												Enjoy the idea of MOBAs but just aren't any good at RTS games? No problem. Ronimo got your back. By fusing the MOBA concept with a 2D platformer, they made a game that's quite simply: Awesome!There are some issues of course, mainly the matchmaking system. But just like LoL before it, it has improved a lot since it launched. Like most MOBAs, it's still preferable to be played with friends but at least the community isn't as nasty as most other online games. From my personal experience anyway. On the more technical side, the game is really pretty. The animation is really smooth, and the art direction is top notch, provided you like the idea of playing a game that satires 80s saturday morning cartoons. I definitely recommend this game to anyone with an interest in MOBAs or online multiplayer games.

heal and slow bubble whilst flying and laying 10plus mines everywhere that might be a start. also the stealth characters need a change as permament stealth is a game breaker, even more so when u factor in that there is no direct counter to stealth play, not a singe character or perk is available to counter stealth.finally this is apparantly  a recent change, the xp levlling system, what a joke , if your team is identical but behind in levels you will do less damage and have less health. so what do people do early on rush out and try to get kills cause they beleive that this will give them an advatage. so invariably people die a lot, feed get fed up and then leave ruining the game for everyone else. if the levelling bonus was not implemented until level 5  so that no increase to stats was available till level 5 i could understand , it might stop the intial reckles push early game as not all nauts scale the same way early on, some are very slow to build up and take time and money (in game) so a few early deaths mean that it cna be over very soon. this is apparantly wht the devs wanted to speed games up, but essentially it becomes a white wash with very few comebacks at being made if even possible. my opinion if the developers actually want a game that plays well and is popular they might want to start looking at character versatility.ps look at some of the older chars, raelyn has to be the weakest naut in the game now, absolutely no real abililty to counter anyone successfuly, shes a glass cannon which can be easily shut down or down right avoided, my own personal opinion is that she of all other chars needs a complete re work to the way she should be played, less damage maybe and more skills to employ, like a choice on snipe to break stealth, or a rift that goes both up and down or damage over time on succsesful hit. or hell maybe even the ablilty to clear a lane of droids like she used to be able to do but now her damage is so weak and pathetic against driods she can barely clear unles she uses rift and then she is defensless. what about a choice of penetration or a better sniping sheild, maybe a shield that only expose the back of the character, or one that is made of the same stuff as skrees turret god knows that when that is dropped it takes an eternity to destroy it single handedleyher blaster has the option for penetration but does not do so for turrets this ought to change too if its got penetration then it should do exaclty thatawful awful game avoid, unless its on offer at 90pence or something silly like thatps the new map they have made is bloody awful too, not much right with awful nauts these days and ive only done 300 hours or so, probly wont be doing much more im glad to sayalso the number of disconnects which cause your rank to decrease are all unforgivable , if they had this game with a proper server instead of peer to peer that might  help but they cannot have dedicated servers apparantly,. if there was a button that was worse than not recommend i would have selected that as the "no" does not seem to convey the awful feeling you will get playing this game post 2.13 patch avoid unless very very cheap

content:
Posted: March 8, 2016
												This game has many problems ranging from lack of maps that are playable on online multiplayer, lack of options to kick people from your game, long waits for the matches to start (there is not even a room for people to wait the matches at like many other games have), late joins with the game basically over, force starts, patches that throw the game completely out of balance, lack of commitment of the developers with the gameplay aspects of the game (they prefer to develop skins again and again and again instead of making their product better, in a business model inspired in EA Sports - in their ultimate team BS that adds nothing to the game), lack of options of restricting you conection region in a clear way (as "same region only" means not same country, apparently, so that HAD to be clear), tendency of ignoring beta testing and lack of consistent or even acceptable QA testing (even if streamers or any conscient player could - and do - tell them what will work and what won't) to constant inconsistent tweaking in the available characters. Besides that the community that buys the game is quite toxic and there is no incentive into making it less so. The game has an interesting gameplay, even with the developers disregard and lack care  about the most important aspect of the game. Overall, a bad experience and neglected (but good) gameplay. After sinking 1000+ hours in the game and after each patch I feel less inclined to believe the promises of fixes, to believe the developers' honesty, or to even play the game.This game is the perfect example, for me, of poor development. I'm sorry, but while I had fun in the beginning, now I just feel frustration, distrust and betrayal. This game is a sad excuse of a game, and I do not feel I'm overstating my case when I say so. I can't recover the time wasted or the money anymore, so I wrote this in hopes that other people do not fall for this trap.EDIT1: After a month and a half I went back to see how the game was. In my opinion nothing significant changed. The characters continue to be unbalanced, the matchmaking got worse (!) and a lot of the needed fixes are still in need. As it has always been with this game, there are promises of fixes in the next patch (it is always the next patch). They still use the same trick: vain promises. I ask myself if they REALLY think they'll expand the player base like that... At least there is a new map. Maybe they think they can compete with DOTA... I think Ronimo needs to make another game. They are small, but they need fresh air in their minds. If they don't they won't be able to evolve; they'll be stuck with only this game forever, and I'm sure they do not want that.EDIT2: The only way to save this game is if it starts being free to play. With an average of less than 500 players playing, the game has become fairly difficult of playing. I always play solo, and I always face teams. And of course they do not quit. It is always a guy from my team that quits. So one can see why I lose a lot lately. Besides that I haven't seen the great ♥♥♥♥ing evolution so many (either naive or dumb) players advertised me would happen. Instead they gave us a very unbalanced and broken map. I'm not playing this game until the next patch - I am not having fun and I wait an hour just to play 4 matches. Also I only play with one character with an old build that was nerfed, and it is really sad I can't play how I used to. As a consolation prize at least I know that I have better games in my library to which I'll dedicate more time. Thanks for that Awesomenauts.

content:
Posted: May 4, 2016
												I can safely recommend dont touch this game with a 10 foot pole. The matchmaking has been broken since day one. Ive owned this game for roughly 3 years now. I used to play avidly now i play on and off with a good friend who plays all the time. My friend plays all the time because its become "their game" its what they do, do they enjoy it? No. Its like dropping 300 dollars in dota cosmetics. After you put all that time in why quit now?The matchmaking in this game and the community itself is absolutely horrible. In no other game have i seen such a visible line the community. Either someone cares deeply about the game and is nice and interactive and fun to play with or chat. Or they are a toxic troll who will ruin your game. Whoever you get stuck with, totaly random.The matchmaking itself is somthing ive seen no other game do and those games have been succesful for it. In awesomenauts its 3v3 when you start a match. Boom someone leaves your game. You have a bot now. "Oh like csgo so i can control it if i die." Well no you cant control it. I havent expereinced the bot AI recently but when i last had to play many-a matches with them they have the AI of a child from a turkey and a potato. Oh you just qued for a game? Lets put you in one thats already going on to replace a bot. This is awesomenauts. 9 times out of 10 you will be qued into a game that is already going on. "Who wants to start fresh from the beggining of a game? Not me." -Game DevsIf you own the game dont touch the dlc either. I bought the starstorm dlc in early acess for my friend and me wanting to help the game maybe get better. It didnt. The map they promise in the pack has come out A YEAR LATER. The heros also came out very slowly. You can critize me for buying in to early acess dlc but this is a game that had recieved quite the publicity and funding. Including the likes of the yogscast and totalbiscuit off the top of my head. You recieved maybe 3-4 heros and a map. I dont even know if the map is specific to dlc owners or dlc owners funded it. Theres a new dlc out with new heros. This game used to be great because you had a large hero pool to play from. Now its locking things behind a 10 dollar paywall.The gameplay is alright down to its core. Its a 2d moba or Dota game. With different heros with differnet skill sets that are fairly customizeable, as you level up. Which is strange to lock undeniably better unlocks for different playstyles behind a leveling up system, which you then loose all these levels if you decide to prestige. Prestige is there idea of end game for people that have played it out enough. Personaly ive never enjoyed prestiging and loosing my progress. In COD you would loose your guns and gernades, etc and receive the basics agian. The same stands true for this and there truely are some undeniably better upgrades for heros later on.Edit: After reading a couple other reviews i forgot about the new system. In game team levels. A concept ripped straight from heros of the storm (a horrible game doing poorly) your team shares "xp" gotten from being around creeps that are dieing, this includes heros. Well if your team starts to fall behind, this level system gives the team more damage and health. If your behind look at you, you start loosing more and more, suddenly the levels are 5 to 9. The damage and health is minimal. Say 2% more each level. But why? What is the real purpose? If its so small why add it? And it doesnt even help the team thats behind in anyway it just makes it wose. And its already challenging enough to come back as it is.TLDR: Community bad. Matchmaking bad. Gameplay Ok/ DLC is overpriced and ruining the core game

content:
Posted: March 23, 2014
												You are probably saying to yourself "why would I buy this game when clearly there are better MOBA's like LOL or Dota 2? Why would I go through the trouble of paying for this game when I could play them?" Well if you have found yourself asking that I have plenty of reasons why Awesomenauts is far greater than any MOBA I have played before.To begin with I find the community absolutely great. There is the occasional ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ who will scream "Lol you suck" in chat but apart from that I find that Awesomenauts attracts a great deal of funny and good sportsmanship players. I don't really have too many MOBA's I have played to compare communities with but I played one game of Dota and it had me being called a ♥♥♥♥ing noob and... yeah so I never played again. I'm not too sure if I just got unlucky but it didn't seem like a great community of people to be playing with. Everyone (well most) in Awesomenauts just want to have fun!Then there is the way the game looks detail wise. This may just be me but I find myself looking in wonder at all the detail the developers put into the game, no cartoon games should look this good. All the little things that I just can't help but really apreciate. How the background is animated, how in one of the maps you can see sunlight flaring through the trees. The way the water captures your characters reflection seems so awesome compared to other games I have played with water. Also something I really like about the character selection screen is how the characters animate and shine.Ronimo has done an amazing job creating so many characters all with completely different attack skills and ways to help out your team. I often find that people will always complain in chat about how overpowered a character is and yet I have seen every character be played so well. It really matters on how you use a certain character however some have a huge variation to how you can use them. This gives it a ginormous strategy aspect to the game (as most MOBA's do).So to sum it all up if you want to get that warm fuzzy feeling you get after killing someone in a video game try this game because every time I kill someone I feel like I have just gotten a cookie. And if you have given up on playing MOBA's because of how people treat you over the internet give this game a go, it will surprise you.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												Fun for a game now and again. But if you want to play a moba where the devs pay attention to what the players want, how the game should be balanced, or I don't know, care. This is not the moba for you. With the only thing resembling a competititve scene being dominated by 99c, and the "Prestigious League 1 for the 250 best players" is a total joke. The game isn't hard, the queues and matchmaking are awful to put it lightly. Combine that with very few characters to play, let alone are viable. One of the 'draws' of the game is that it has a very low skill ceiling and a high skill floor, and is supposedly easy for new players to enjoy and play. Again, this is not true. The difference between a good team and a bad team is noticable immediately into the game, and has very little to keep the player playing. The unlock system is completely arbirtary. See, while other mobas like League or SMITE force you to play the game for a while to unlock the things you want, you get to choose what things you want. In Awesomenauts, you have no choice whatsoever about what you unlock. Are you a frog player? Do you see all of these fancy items and great builds that other frogs have? Do you want those items? Well you're going to have to play about 30-35 hours of the game before you can get to that point, oh and I should mention that you can unlock these things faster for winning games, which is near impossible with the disgustingly bad stock items. As for the matchmaking, it's total trash. The matchmaking servers matches you with player within 2 leagues above and below you. Let's take the average League 3 player, not outstandingly good, but still good enough to be about top 8000. You can get matches with anyone from League 5 (roughly top 20000) to League 1 (top 250). If the game can't find anyone within those 5 leagues you can be matched in, it will take literally anyone and put them in your game, for better or for worse. Now this wouldn't be an issue with the game, if it had draws to keep players playing (which it doesnt) achieving League 1 wouldn't be hard if it weren't for the outright broken matchmaking, and even then so few tournaments are held with so small prizes almost always dominated by the same 3 or 4 teams. The devs have absolutely no direction and little involvement with the community, the game is easy with little to no reward for being good, matchmaking and soloqueueing is cancerous beyond description, I haven't even touched on the DLC which for $10 awards players with 4 characters who are absolutely dominant in the current meta (if this game could even be considered as having a meta), the balance is constantly changing with every patch and the devs are putting time into things noone cares about, games are near impossible to win if you're on your backfoot in even the first 5 minutes, everything about this game is maddening to say the least. If you want a good F2P moba, go play Dota 2. If you want a moba thats easy to get into, go back to Call of Duty.

content:
Posted: March 21, 2016
												The game is incredibly fun. It is a cross between a Platformer and a Moba. Two of my favourite genres.The characters feel unique and the in-game music is fantastic. You can never get tired of the killing spree music.Compared to other Mobas this feels easier and more fun to pick up. The item builds are more straightforward, so I never felt the need to look up any guides or anything. If anything figuring stuff out on my own has made me a better player.This is a bit more twitch reflex, fast paced Moba.Since the matchmaking update, you get better matches and less ping  between players. Though be warned that if you live in an area where there aren't a lot of players matchmaking might match you with bots as there are no suitable players for you to be matched with. I haven't had issues with this my self. But had a couple of friends who couldn't get a match after the matchmaking update. Mainly people outside EU and US have been having such issues. Also as any other moba, people are pretty childish and will not hesitate to waste their energy to insult you. If you feel affercted by toxicity, there is an option to disable the chat altogether.Ronimo is, in my experience, a very transparent company and has continued to improve the game through years. Sometimes it means they make a big change and it might upset some people, but overall they have continued to improve and support the game for years. Which is more than I can say about a lot of other more major developers who have abandoned their games and communities.I would recommend anyone who enjoys Moba or Platformer genre to give this game a try. Base game is often on sale, so I would recommend  putting it on your wishlist and trying it out.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												A fun twist on the MOBA genre, adding platforming skills to the set of skills required in the genre. While lacking as big of a roster as other MOBAs, each individual character is unique and offers an approach for almost every player. The gameplay is also more geared towards a wider audience, with there being only two lanes to attack/defend and only 3 types of attacks for each character to use. Setting up a controller is a bit of a pain, but for the most part the controls work fine if you desire to use a controller.Overall, it's a really well-polished game! Almost everything has a distinct outline to it, most notably the colourful character sprites. The polish patch adds a few extra shiny things as well, updating some particle effects and more visual confirmations on damage and solar (the in-game currency) picked up. Each map is well-designed, each offering enough variety to set them apart. All of them are a blast to play on.And the sounds of the game are also top-notch. To add to the already stylised look of the game, each character has his/her own theme song, which does a good job at giving them more of a personality. These theme songs are then given remixes (for the most part) that play whenever that character goes on a killing spree, rewarding the player for playing well and making them feel awesome! The stages also have their own themes, matching how they look very well, and the theme song of the game itself is nothing short of spectacular!My verdict would be a 'Yes, totally worth buying'. The game especially enderes to those who may not be that familiar with the MOBA genre and want to start familiarising themselves with it, so if that is you then I'd highly recommend checking Awesomenauts out. Even more advanced players can find enjoyment from the game, with the ability to team up with two other friends and offer a tough co-ordinated fight to the other teams.

content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												A few things to expect if you buy Awesomenauts:The matchmaking issues have never been fixed.  There is no unranked play.  You frequently get matched in to ongoing games.  When the community is at its usual height (meaning not during a sale) you will very frequently get dropped in to matches that are well beyond lost.  Quitting out and re-queuing will often get you dropped right back in to the same FUBAR match.  You'll find yourself playing with bots against a premade team more often than 'naut.  When there is not a sale, a majority of the active players are very experienced.  They will let you know that power creep has made many of the base characters pretty useless.  Without Starstorm, you'll find yourself on the receiving end of a lot of beatings.  There are a couple of base characters that see a good amount of high-end play, but ask yourself if you really plan to commit that much time to this game.  The pool of honestly useful characters is pretty limited.There are no dedicated servers. There are no region settings.   This results in a lot of games where ping will be 200 or greater.  You'll be stuttering around slowly while the other team ruins your day.  And it will happen a lot.I've not played with the Overdrive expansion, but I don't see any of its characters topping any leaderboards.I've seen plenty of rumblings that the new XP system causes some real matchmaking inequality.  Remember, there is no unranked play.  The learning curve of any MOBA is pretty steep, and it gets much worse when you're stuck in a constant stream of losing matches with only bots on your team to teach you.If you can overlook these faults, the game is mechanically sound and visually appealing.  The original music is mostly pretty great.

content:
Posted: July 11, 2013
												Straight out of the marsh pond ghetto's of planet Ribit IV comes the amphibious B.I.G., also known as Nate Frogg, but mostly known as Froggy G. Growing up in the baddest part of town, struggle and incarceration surrounded Froggy from an early age. Taking part in his first swim-by shoot out as a tadpole, Froggy seemed destined for a life of crime and prison. After a bloody gangwar with the neighbouring Toad-unit posse ended in a 5 year jail sentence, Froggy G vowed to end his gangsta ways. Instead, Froggy G started earning his keep as a beatboxing streetdancer and rapper, hoping to be picked up by a major record label. Unfortunately, his tracks, titled "Pond Pimpin'", "Froggin' dirty" and "Motherfrogger bounce!" didn't earn him much.In order to make some money, and then make some mo', Froggy G became a hired gun. Combining his shoot-out experiences with lethal watery dance-moves and beatboxing techniques, Froggy G now spins and dashes across intergalactic battlefields, droppin foo's left and right with his fishgun, hoping to make some money to take his momma out of the hood.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2016
												DO NOT LET THE PLAYERS DICTATE YOUR DECISION ON PURCHASING/PLAYING THIS GAME! ALSO, THIS IS, AT ITS CORE,  A PVP GAME! WHICH IS ONE OF THE BEST OF ITS KIND ON STEAM IN MY OPINION! ITS PRIMARY FLAW IS LACK OF PLAYERS. PLEASE PLAY!! EACH NEW PLAYER IMPROVES THE GAME!Disclaimers.In truth, this game is incredibly, addictingly fun. A very well thought out game. The develop team works very hard to maintain a balance in the game (Even though sajd team gets heckled way too much by its community). The visuals are bright, poppy, nostaligic, and fun. If you are around my age (29), then you remember the Saturday morning cartoons we watched while growing up --the chatacters really resemble that. The concept and execution of the game is also impressive. There are too many PvP games on the market, so much so, its confusing and annoying. AWESOMENAUTS remains to be unique among them all --freshness exudes from this title (If you have never played - PLAY!). Now: Once you break through the game's lucid learning curve, combat and manuevering opens up in a new way. Your emotions become involved. Patience is the essence of Awesomenauts. This can be a curse and a boon for all players. The frustration - the desire to win - keeps you playing, however, you feel a distinct anger dyring the interaction (Depending on how deep you get into the game/how well your team is doing).PVP: Player versus Player.PVP is actually a young concept in the video game society, which has recently (Past 5 years), become prominent in online mutliplayer gaming. Long story short, the FPS (First Person Shooter) genre was dominated by the likes of Counterstrike, Call of Duty, Gears of War, Halo, etc. which brought upon a staple in online gaming.Awesomenauts is special because of the balanced utiliazation of its pletora of characters through the PvP gaming concept. Coupled with the nostaligic majesty of its side scrolling, old school, you ain't a woman/man till you done played this s%!t demanor, it's a "worth it" buy. I won't lie to you, the game is desperate for more players, and as a gamer, I too share that sentiment. But this game deserves that privilege, because of its constant updates (to make the game balanced), addition of characters (Yes, you have to buy the DLC, which is lame, but most of you have paid 60 bucks for a game), Replayability (No, that isn't a word, but this game has it. Gravity wasn't a word/thing/concept at one point), the bittnerness from opposition when your team is domination, and the nostalgia you recieve from prowling though a 2D, side scrolling environment (Makes me think of Mega-man when I was a kid).The learning curve isn't very large. In fact, all characters there are available to play have abilities that are easy to understand and wurks, thus you can figure your role quickly. The way I see this game is a turret defense MOBA (Which is probably what the develpers categorized its as). It's a 3 v 3 battle. The object is to destroy the opoosing turrets to break through to the base. when your team destroys the base, the game is won.Seriously, if you have a fetish for 90s culture, or even remembered the culture fondly, pick the game up.If you love multiplayer --competitive game play, pick it upThink you have what it takes to beat me? Pick it up.This game comes with no gimmicks. Beyond its expansions, you get what you pay for --that is how it sounds.Long  story short - Get the Game-You will be assimilated

												The balance is not right. DLC characters are more powerful than base characters. For example, Yoolip as a mid-range stun-silence-do damage-snare skill. Clunk (a base character) has a skill that do less damage, had to buy the snare upgrade and is close-range. Yes, riskier and closer. That's so balanced.It costs 8€. Yes, we are in 2016 and you have to pay a whole "expansion" that contains 3 characters... and only that. That's less content than the previous "expansion" which costs 7€ but has overpowered characters and a map (we waited 2 years for the map, 2 years). I will not list all the balance problems but when you have beta at each character release and you are not capable to see a problem like that, it is unacceptable.The matchmaking is worse than a cigaret is for the health. It is expected that an update will change that... it is expected since the dawn of time. The league system is obsolete since it doesn't reflect the real skill of the player, it reflects his victories. Premades have a HUGE advantage even in the ranking.They add skins each 2 weeks (exageration here) but they can't do a map in 2 years (that's not an exageration). Howerer, they did another game for the WiiU (a lost console from 2012 with only Mario games - it's a joke, there is ZombiU-) in the mean time. I have been fooled once with Starstorm, Overdrive will not fool me. I'm pretty sure in the year 3587, Awesomenauts will not be balanced in gameplay or in monetization. And I'm not sure I will see that happening.

Posted: February 1
												The Game in itself is fun for the first couple of hours. It makes for a decent time killer for me and my girlfriend although for any serious player out there this game is not for you. The Balance between the heros is nearly inexistent and the matchmaking system is plain terrible. Pretty much every games we played was a stomp on either side. the very few time we actually had a fair game it would end up in us defending until the end angaist some invisible hero that would just ship at the generator. Ho yeah there nothing to really counter invisibility. Unless you get lucky with couple of skill that leave some effect on the guy to trace him before he goes invisible, you're ♥♥♥♥ed. No sentry wards like in dota 2 or any ability to reveal heroes. Anyway that would be pointless since you don't see the enemy team comp until it's time to play. That actually kills most of the strategy that we could use in the game. Yet again the game is kinda fun if you take it super casually and you don't mind broken mathmaking that is forced on you. But the second you consider it anything more than a casual unbalanced game it sucks.

												What used to be a fun casual game with a chill as hell community has turned into your bog standard eSports wannabe MOBA where more time is spent on making the next shiny "lol meme" skin over actually making the game better to play. The game's slowly gone downhill over multiple patches, with each patch making the game progressively more frustrating to play, while not also solving any of the issues in the game. Now it's like wading into the cesspools of the rest of the MOBA community, where it's constant non stop betaring over potention faults that may occur because you didn't follow the top rated guide your teammate read the day prior.Also if you lag, you are straight up better at the game than everyone else. So boot up them torrents and download gigs of literally nothing if you decide to throw your money away.Better yet, just throw your money in the god damned trashcan, it's a better investment.

Posted: August 30, 2016
												Great 2D MOBA (3 vs 3) with frantic action that keeps you on your toes to the last second of the game. Great character design, well thought-out powers and powerups. Characters feel very different from each other and it takes different tactics to win with each one. I love the local co-op / split screen aspect because it lets me play with my daughter (who's already better than me at this game, sadly for me) and a few friends/family when they pay us a visit.They increased the AI difficulty in one of the latest releases, which makes fighting bots much more interesting (and harder). You can select the AI level in the parameters of the game. It will take you some time to win against the bot on hardest difficulties and before you can contend with real players (and win).

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Let me start off by saying that this game in essence is really good and the concepts in play have the potential to be awesome (just like the title), but thats pretty much the end of line. When you first start out in the game you are required to play a tutorial and custom bot game. These two gamemodes (if you could call it that) are actually fun and show off the games potential (potential is the key word). However, the fun of the game is immediatly drained out when you start playing multiplayer for the first time. Everytime I tried to ask questions to my teammates they would ignore me even when they could spare the time in spawn. Then later in the game they accused me of feeding and being a "noob" until it became obnoxious even though they couldn't take the time to give even a hint on how to use my character well with theirs. As if they couldn't get to be more cancerous, they then took their ♥♥♥♥♥ing to the general chat (which I assume reaches most of the already dead player base) in which they were able to make everyone leave my team when I attempted to play another game. In conclusion the game is a decent 6/10 that I would have loved to take the time to learn and sink many hours into but it becomes unplayable for new players with the community. Even though the game is cheaper then dog♥♥♥♥♥♥right now DON'T BOTHER, because you would probably want to save your money up for dog♥♥♥♥♥♥instead...In conclusion, if your going to get the game get it for the slightly unbalanced game, but definetly not for the cancerous community.Edit:The game is no longer on sale so it is DEFINITELY NOT WORTH IT!

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
												For people looking to play this game, I highly suggest looking at other MOBAs. This one is OK for gameplay and fun, but when it comes to the community, it is absolutely horrible. There are people who purposely de-league themselves so they can play on lower league games and pretty much guarantee themselves wins. It is nealy impossible to get anywhere unless you absolutely pour hours upon hours into this game because you want to get better. Chances are, you might not get any better because you're fighting people who are highly advanced in skill level in a low skill-level game. You will not believe how many times you will go up a league, only to immediately drop one because you fought against ex-league 2s or bottom-line 1s. I can never seem to get above rank 8. I reach rank 7, and the next match, I lose and am de-leagued again.Pros? Fun gameplay, graphics are cartoony and nice, the controls are rather smooth, and it makes for a good action platform-jumping, run-n-gun MOBA.Cons? You won't get anywhere with the cheap community it has.. People are not ashamed to admit that they purposely de-league themselves to play lower ranked games. It's rather distasteful and it made me remember why I stopped playing it.Stay away from this game, you won't have any fun because you'll constantly get rolled.Thank you.-Alpha Gamma

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 16, 2016
												This is yet another game that I have returned to long after release only to be pleasantly surprised.  I wasn't interested in playing this game whatsoever after trying it on release, as everything seemed extremely unbalanced.  Although the mechanics and ideas behind most of the characters were interesting, there were only a few characters.  This caused the OP characters to be really, really OP.  There wasn't a ranking system yet, so very skilled players would be mixed in with brand new players, making gameplay frustrating for those just entering into Awesomenauts PvP.  They have refined this game into a jewel.  As a long time MOBA player (I have played Smite and LoL extensively, and sampled DOTA, Newearth, and a few others), this MOBA holds a special place in my heart.  The fact that you can modify the base skills to do different things is really a joy - it makes it so that you can tailor your favorite character to counter whatever team you are playing against.  Although the same can be accomplished with items in other MOBAs, the way they approach items in Awesomenauts makes the choices easy and good for a casual, enjoyable experience.  The community seems very welcoming, and the UI is clean and modern.  I love the way the profiles are set up, and am always interested in checking up on my own stats.  The side scrolling aspect will at first pose a challenge for other long time MOBA players, but the new perspective is easily mastered and adds another dimension to gameplay.The variety of maps and the different "traps" and features of each is really awesome.  The fact that your spawn timer mostly consists of flying to earth in a rocket ship while picking up solar is badass, and makes staying engaged in the game easy and fun.  I'd definitely suggest this game to anyone looking to pick up a simple, fun MOBA - there's something for both new players looking to learn the ropes of MOBAS, and experienced players looking to just have a bit of relaxing fun.I look forward to playing this game for a long time to come, and purchasing the expansions when I get the chance.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2014
												The short version of this game is that you join a team consisting of 3 characters, and begin trying to kill the hell out of each other until one team gets a big enough advantage to push through a couple massive turrets and destroy their opponents base. The longer version involves a throwback to when cartoons were good (late 80s and most of the early-mid 90s), with silly themes and backtories on all of the characters. Each character has their own unique set of skills and abilities. Each character excells in one way or another. For example, Ayla (the psychotic little alien girl) can create a rage bubble around her which damages enemies nearby while healing her. On the other hand, Derpl Zork (the dumber-than-plankton heir to one of the biggest fortunes in the galexy) can transform his walking desk/secretary/death machine into a turret which can lay down a lot of firepower, including nukes.The games themselves are quick and fun, although the ranking system is imperfect due to a playerbase not large enough to support the higher rank players.

number of helpful: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 19, 2016
												As someone who has been playing this game ever since it was released on PS3/XBOX 360 back in May 2012, I REALLY want to recommend people to play this game. There is a lot of fun in this game due to the 2D side-scrolling gameplay, which I find very interesting for a MOBA game back in 2012, and the fun characters including new ones (most of which is free) that roll out overtime. The maps can be challenging as cetain characters can take advantage of it. For example, when Ayla's Rage can damage driods under the area of top turrents (which I find BS sometimes) at Ribbit IV. Sentry's Black Hole Sun applies too as this ability can drag and hold players when placed under them despite some form of ground inbetween the players and the hole. Another thing I like is that matches are pretty fast compared to popular MOBAs like League of Legends, DOTA 2, etc. You don't have to spend almost an hour on ONE match. In Awesomenauts, the average match is about 15-20 minutes with the longest I've experienced is about 40 minutes (this is before the XP system).But as I outweigh the pros and cons of this game, I find that the cons are slightly higher than the pros, especially with the new XP system. As some people mention it before, the purpose of the XP is to make matches go faster by creating a snowball effect. Any kills, whether it is creeps, driods, or other players, will raise their team level. On paper, the idea is great since in the past, there were some matches that drag out too long. As for execution, this is debatable. People who win a lot with this system will likely say there's little to no problems with it. People who lose a lot with this system will likely say the XP system is broken and unplayable. Personably, as someone who used to win a lot of games before, I can agree to the fact that this can be a problem. The XP system requires to have little to no mistakes when playing because every kill is exp points for the other team. Pair this up with the WONDERFUL matchmaking, those claims that this is unplayable may have some truth in it. The old system makes you work hard to gain a victory. The new system is on drugs as anybody, no matter what rank/league you are in, can simply win if one team is screwing up. It's subjective to how everyone feels about the XP system, but everyone can agree that this can be frustrating when you are paired up with team members who are either new to the game, new to the character they are playing as, or has no sense of teamwork or coordination. And honestly, I suffered way too much with that. Other things to note is that there are no ranked matches, there is no surrender option, and there are matchmaking issues. For ranked matches, I don't understand why this does not exist since we have leagues/tiers, ranked points, and such. I want to play with experienced people without the need to go over to community and organize games. Not all of us has the time to go over to the fourms and ask if people wany to play. For me, I play it like a lot of multiplayer games: hit the matchmaking button and hope the team you are in is actually good. For surrenders, why isn't this a thing? If a game is going very bad to the point where you and your teammates cannot do anything but feed the enemy team, why can't we be given the option to surrender instead waiting for the enemy team to destroy almost every turrent and finally destroy the base. This happens way too often even though I tried to carry my team. I think we can prevent a good amount of people ragequiting and going AFK instead of waiting for the match to be over. If time is the issue (like people wanting to surrender less than five minutes in the game), then set the limit to activate surrunder at the 8-10 minute mark. For these two issues, it has been almost four years and Ronimo still haven't resolved this, or rather walked around it. Lastly on the AMAZING matchmaking, we can all agree that we had experienced being with bad teammates against very good players or being placed into a match where the team you are in has only one turrent left a handful of times. I understand that Ronimo is trying their best, especially since they are just indie developers, but why not just give us the option to choose a game instead of the matchmaking be random. Why not give us the option to prevent us from joining mid to late games randomly? This is infuriating because I have experienced this crap for so long.It is also note that you lose more rank points if you leave a game versus losing a game (for those of you who care about your rank). While this encourages people to stay in their match and finish it (or wait till you lose), any disconnect is considered a leave. To be clear, leaving a game means losing half the experience points towards your league and unlockable skills (especially if you prestige) when you win a match. It may seem like an annoyance, but this is a warning for people who is tempted to leave a match just to find a game you can win in.I know this is a very long review, but this is a game I have put so much time in since its original release, and only to feel like being stepped on due to these problems. And the thing is, I want this game to succeed. This game has a lot of potential to be a unique MOBA game that is diferent than the typical and popular MOBA games out there. If anything, I want to say that Awesomenauts is my favorite MOBA, but I can't. The game had undergone a lot of changes, for better or worse, over the years, and while it is not as bad as most people who didn't recommend this game says it is, this game still need a lot of tuning, epecially ever since the new XP system. I know the Overdrive expansion is coming soon with it promising better matchmaking. But as it stands right now, be very, very wary when considering to buy this game along with the Starstorm expansion. Wait for a sale if anything.TL;DR: The game is mixed IMO due to frustrating issues, both common and personal, that has not been resolved or has been walked around. Wait for a sale.

content:
Posted: January 9
												Leaving a review for awesomenauts is tricky... In short, it's a 2D platformer MOBA with a 3v3 setup.This game has a couple of obvious downsides:- The matchmaking is unstable during low hours.- The netcode is peer-to-peer, which means that there are no dedicated servers. This leads to advantages for laggers.- Apart from unlocking new characters, there is no late game content.- Because of all these things, the playerbase has been shrinking. This has led to experienced players remaining with the influx of new players being too small to close the gap.So, before buying the game you should consider these points. Nevertheless, I would recommend the game:(- Let it be clear that this game is often on sale for -80% or -90%, which makes the cost ridiculously low.)- The devs have done a very good job at balancing the game. Hear me out. Yes, some nauts feel completely overpowered. The problem with a 3v3 game is that there needs to be a balanced between how powerful the characters are and how slow the game can be. If the nauts are too weak, then nothing would happen. So, each naut carries a lot of power. To newcomers, this may be confusing, especially since they cannot practice with the nauts from the DLC. However, a lot of the OP-ness arises from inexperience with MOBAs. Once you get the hang of the general strategy (don't overextend, push droids, etc.), then no naut will be OP. Yes, some are better than others, but Ronimo has done a terrific job balancing all the nauts.- The game is still fun during peak hours. - The game offers games versus AI, which can be challenging and fun.- The game offers custom game modes, which can definitely be fun (and also good practice). - The game has a strong replay system, which allows you to look at players who were better and then better understand how they played so well.One big problem with the game is the community. It has obtained a nasty way of fatalism. Some veterans are suggesting newbies to get a refund while they can, despite having bought the game during sale (i.e. it being 2 euros/dollars). If you think the game you play isn't worth 2 dollars, then just leave. All in all, this game has given me plenty of fun moments. Like any MOBA, try to accept the fact that you can't always win. Mute players that you don't like, or just turn off the chat. There is so much to enjoy within Awesomenauts; it has given me fun for over a 1000 hours (smurfs combined), and I have gifted the game to many people who went on to invest hundreds of hours in it as well.

number of helpful: 11 of 18 people (61%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												This game is unique. There has never been a game similar to this one.Yes, it follows the basic MOBA formula of creeps/towers/"heroes"/loadout builds/base, but past that everything changes.Mechanically speaking, the game uses a 2D platforming free-side-scrolling approach. You move using the keyboard, and aim/attack using your mouse. Controllers can be used as well, if that's more your style.There are 4 main maps, each with an entirely different layout. Generally, 2 lanes exist, though most maps have open areas and choke-points.The "heroes" (nauts) are incredibly different from each other, in terms of abilities and playstyle. There's a chameleon assassin that goes invisible, a russian monkey that flies using a jetpack, a squid that anchors you in place, an overweight viking that hurls you into the air, an all-eating creature that spawns stationary minions, a floating brain that controls a swarm of drones, etc. for a total of 16 nauts, plus an additional 5 in the still growing expansion (the expansion marked a first step towards a continuous development effort, which I mention further ahead, and is not in any way pay-to-win). Each naut has its own learning curve. This makes the game spectacularly varied, as not only are the nauts unique from each other, the 3 naut teams mean there are a huge number of possible combinations, which in turn mean a huge number of approaches to a single match. Not to mention that many nauts can steer their own style in very diverse directions depending on which items they go for in their build.Last, but not least, the game is fun. As the intro makes quite clear, the underlying design theme surrounding the game is not fantasy or sci-fi, but instead a sort of nostalgic-childhood-saturday-morning-cartoon-fun.Competitive? Yes. But also a game in which you can kill a flying monkey by having a fat viking throw an exploding gnome at its face.It is also essential to point out that the developers are still very much working on the game. Yes, it was released back in 2012, but it has evolved immensely throughout the past three years. As you will find if you snoop around the game's website, the developers, who frequently post in the forums, intend to keep working and adding features to the game, while polishing and improving the ones already present. This is a project with long-term goals, and the players are having a blast watching the game grow and having their feedback taken seriously. (this is not early access in any way)All in all, a very fun game, with a great community, a unique design, and surprising strategic and tactical complexity.Grab it. Play it. Love it.tl;dr: fun, unique, surprisingly complex

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Great game, really is. Just a few issues here and there, and one gamebreaker.PROS:    - Large character selection (especially if you own all of the DLCs)    - Matches can last fairly longCONS:    - Matchmaking. Nobody plays the game anymore (not since a few months after Yogscast reviewed it), so you get matched with gold ranked players when you just play the game casually.    - Hosting. Not sure why they don't have dedicated servers for this, but it causes real issues with lag, disconnects, etc.    - Along the same lines, DISCONNECTS. No matter what I do, more than 50% of the time I spend in a game is spent in the "Reconnecting" state. This is a large issue on its own, but it gets worse. When in the "Reconnecting" state, YOU CAN STILL TAKE DAMAGE. This has caused my ranking to drop tens of thousands (used to be ranked in the 30,000s, now im in the 50,000s after 3 games.)    - RONIMO. No matter what you do, what the issue is, anything, Ronimo doesn't care. There have been many complaints about many things, and none of them have been acknowledged by Ronimo, meaning they haven't been fixed.If you can get past these issues, its truly a fun game (I know from experience, before my disconnecting issue as well as before the matchmaking unbalanced issue). If you never had these issues, you're one of the lucky ones. Hope you get lucky, cause otherwise, this game ain't worth $0.01, let alone $10. Any review from someone who has more than 100 hours in this game, because those are the kinds of people who no life this game and play "competetive," which shouldn't even be an aspect of this game, as it's not so much competetive as it is raging all the time.

number of helpful: 13 of 22 people (59%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 15, 2014
												Okay, I will admit at first I HATED this game... But I will also admit I was bad at it. Really bad. The game has a bit of a learning curve. But now, I like it. I wouldn't quite say I love it, but I'd say it's worth the $10.. even though I got it for 99 cents. :DIt's basically a base/tower defense game with 2D cartoon aliens. I think there's like 20 different characters now, and that's exactly what they all are, different. Each and every character is unique. There are no 2 characters where you think "Hmm, this one is kinda like that one" They all look different, and they all have their own special abilities. Pick up solar(games currency) or gain it by killing, and you get to upgrade those abilities.It definately helps to either read up on all the characters abilities, or have an experienced friend to play with you. What you don't know, kills you... Over and over and over.Overall, it's really a good game. I only have one problem with it. Leon. Leon makes me sad. No matter what character I am, no matter how upgraded I am, he finds me, pops out of nowhere, and out-DPMs me no matter what I do. Of all the deaths I have in the game, I'd say 90% are Leon related.Get the game, it's worth it. Not sure? Wait until it goes on sale. But before you make your judgement on whether or not you like it, play every character. That's the secret, you have to find the character that you like and do okay with, then continue to learn and progress from there. Don't just try 1 character and say you hate it, because that's what I did. Learn from my mistakes.P.S. Leon OP, please nerf. 9/10

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2012
												If you think this is a watered-down DOTA-like, then you're sadly mistaken. Awesomenauts makes the MOBA (side-note: I hate that term, but it's what everyone calls it, so meh) genre accessible to first time players whilst being hard to master. And on top of the wonderfully deep gameplay, the artwork is absolutely gorgeous-- hand-painted textures galore and a killer soundtrack (each Awesomenaut has their own theme song music that plays when they go on a Kill Streak!). You should get Awesomenauts if any of these apply: 1) You're a MOBA fan, 2) You enjoy games that encourage good teamwork, 3) You want a game with tons of replay-value, and/or 4) You want a game that gets balanced and gets new content added on a regular basis. I couldn't recommend Awesomenauts enough; it's really *that* good-- I've already put in over 100 hours of gametime over the 3 months or so that I've had it, and I plan on pouring many more into it over the coming years. GET IT. PLAY IT. LOVE IT.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 16, 2014
												I can't realy be considered a "hardcore" MOBA player. I recently started playing League of Legends and am enjoying it. But Awesomenauts is something else. It's a MOBA, yes. There are turrets, and minions and you level up over the course of a game. But the way it blends side-scrolling action shooting into the mix really makes it something more. If you've been turned off by LoL or DOTA by the large number of items, jargon and steep learning curve, this game sucessfully removes all of that while still retaining a nice level of depth. The lower number of playable characters makes it so that it's easier to learn them all, though they really play very differently from one another. There is a level of strategy that starts as soon as character selection and building your team. Battles are a lot of fun, and end up being decided more on your skill than your knowledge of the mechanics. While there are interesting combos to perform, and mechanics to master, skill remains the determining factor. There is a leveling system, but you seldom feel at a disadvantage for being a lower level. That being said, the transition from the traditional MOBA stage to a 2D environment is not perfect. The skirmishes often get chaotic quickly, and it can become difficult to see and understand what's going on. Having your character always remain in the center of the screen is helpful, but the visual style can still remain very busy.There has been some critisism that some characters are only available through paid DLC. These cahracters are not too powerful to ruin the game in the slightest. It is a decent way to get funding to expand the game. It in no way ruins the experience if you don't decide to pay. The player base is a lot friendlier than most MOBAs, though there are still some guys who sour the experience. The best way to play the game (like any game, in my opinion) is with friends, preferably with voice chat. Then it becomes a truly fun game to play with people of all skill levels. In playing with a friend for their first time ever, we were sitll able to have a fun time and play competitively against other teams. Plus being well-coordinated as a team really gives an advantage.It's a good enough game that I possibly will gift copies to friends next time it goes on a big sale just so they can enjoy it as well. To my friends: Why aren't you playing this already?

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												For the better part of two years, I watched this title on the steam market, maybe like you are doing now. Being a pretty enthusiastic videogame consumer, this title seemed to sink into the background for me even when it appeared on the front page after an update. The thing that tripped me up was my conception of what actually constitutes a a "MOBA" game. Lateley people seem to think of MOBA games as stemming from some starcraft or warcraft mod with a tedious learning curve, an awful playerbase, and very slow-paced strategic combat.THIS IS NOT THE CASE HERE.Awesomenauts is a Multiplayer Online Battle Arena which pits two teams of three agains one another. Each player may choose a character from an evolving list of "Nauts" catering to their own unique playstyle. Throughout the match, players are able to purchase upgrades for their characters moveset. Upgrade by killing enemy "creeps" (enemy AI units which give gold, aka 'Solar') and kill the ever-loving crap out of the enemy team.As opposed to a conventional MOBA like DoTa 2, there is no long farming phases, the shop system is easily understood, the mechanics are fast and tight direct controls, as opposed to clicking for movement, and the upgrade combinations provide the reletively easy-to-learn movesets with a huge bag of varied playstyles for each character.The action in any given match is literally nonstop from the moment you rocket down in your jetpod. Immediately the teams rush at one another trying to get an early kill for a leg up early on, and everyone brawls making risky chase attempts and desparate retaliations. With every trip to the shop the scales get tipped, and it becomes very easy for a team to go from underdog to victor if teamwork is utilized.As for the features of the game, there are several that set this game apart from an others I've playedLocal Co-op is always a big thing for me. In my opinion, gaming is about  experiencing cool events and challenges as a social event involving more than one person. The fact that I can play this game on the couch -conveniently, even- with my roommate who has never even touched the typical MOBA game is really cool!The Art Style and character concepts are so totally unique, I can't say I've come across anything quite like it. This makes for a fresh new continuity with lots to discover and master!All I can advise for those on the edge about purchasing Awesomenauts is to throw out your conception of an Isometric, slow, boring, grind-fest MOBA and imagine a gale-speed battle of force, reflexes and wits. Awesomenauts is truly the ultimate test of platforming, fighting, and skill.

content:

												Recipe for Awesomenauts:Take 1 MOBA (I'm using DOTA, but you can use LOL if you like!). First, boil away that nasty control scheme, if we were making at RTS that'd be fine, but we want to get rid of that here until we're left with a tasty 2D platformer, but with that unmistakable MOBA flavour. Turn that hour long simmer up to a high heat of 15-20 minutes. Make sure you remove the denying and bizarre item scheme, you can choke on those easily. Add a dash of pop culture, but not too much! Finally, garnish with some delishious 80s cartoon goodness. Delicious!Serves 1 - 6.

content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
												What can I saw about Awesomenauts? It's awesome duh!All kidding aside though, I have had so much fun with this game since it released on console and when it released onto PC. It started off as a small fun 2D brawler smash bros/moba hybrib for me, but it grew into something much bigger. It became almost like a home. This game holds one of the best gaming communities I have ever seen, both casual and competitive players are always down for a couple laughs, heck even the developers (Ronimo Games) join in from time to time. I started playing PC when it came out (xbox before that) and remember playing Gnaw because at the time he was new, and he was sooooo cool. Let's face it, biting people's face off and pooping out plants is just this sh*t. From playing I met a bunch of cool people that I still talk with to this day. A few people we even went into business with eachother so to speak form the APL. Although I had to leave the organization and have not been playing 'nauts very much, I still see my time playing as the most fun I have ever had with a game and some of the best people I have met through online gaming. If you are thinking of picking this game up... Just do it. Don't wait. It will be the best 10 bucks you ever spend. Last of all I want to give some shoutouts:First of all Metamist for helping me create the APL, and running the website for me.Naaza, Evan, and Wolfy for helping take the APL to the next level and also allowing me to carry you guys in Dota from time to time. Kewn and all the guys over at Ronimo Games. You guys put up with all my crap and for that I thank you, the APL and 'nauts in general could not of been possible without the support from all of you.The Awesomenauts community for just being kick♥♥♥♥♥overall. P.s - R.I.P Double Cat shot Derpl. You were the best build in the game <3.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
Rating: ★★☆☆☆      ☐ Worth full-price      ☐ Only on sale+ Unique side-scroll/platformer MOBA concept.+ Original and awesomely designed characters come complete with their own theme songs!.+ Fluid and fast-paced action.+ Friggin' theme songs! + And killing spree remixes!- The combination of P2P, poor matchmaking, and TrueSkill rank system.- Shoddy balance.- Nonexistent playerbase.- Rectal cancer. An 80s/90s Saturday morning cartoon themed 2D MOBA. Gameplay-wise it's a lot of fun. In fact, If you couldn't care less about ranked or climbing the ladder and just want to have a good time PvPing with friends in a game with all the MOBA elements then, by all means, go right ahead. But then, why not ditch the laning & jungling and grab any one of the 261 vastly superior Super Smash Bros. games. I honestly can't recommend this to anyone looking for a serious MOBA. Especially when it doesn't nail the 'massively online' bit. The matchmaking system on ranked (the only mode that matters) is utter balls. The overall online experience is a laggy pile of feces 72% of the time due to the netcode and lack of dedicated servers, and is in desperate need of an overhaul! The TrueSkill rank system is the proverbial cherry on top of it all, ensuring that when you  do  lose because of either of the aforementioned (or both) you'll be severely punished for it. That being said, the game itself can be a ton of fun when played casually either in split-screen or privately with people in the same region.Here's an example of what a session of Awesomenauts is like at the very start of a new season: You solo queue and manage to roflstomp a few games and get placed in the Awesomantium league (league 1). A lag spike here and there, no biggie. You proceed to faceroll some more games, miraculously, without any major issues. Ranking-up a few more spots at a time. But then, inevitably, you get dropped into either:A) the end of a game that's mere seconds away from ending,5) one that's utterly one-sided with absolutely no chance of mounting a comeback,31) lagcity,9) a straight up instant disconnection as soon as you connect due to the host's dial-up Internet access,Q) All the above,resulting in your first loss and (here's the kicker) get set back anywhere from fifty to  HUNDREDS  upon  HUNDREDS  of ranks depending on how much lower the enemy team's players were rank-wise. DCing from a game with a big enough rank gap and you can even throw in a demotion to a league or two down. At this point, re-queueing and attempting to crawl your way back up is not an option. It's very likely that you'd just end up getting shafted again by any/all of the above. Plus, the difference between points earned and points lost is too great to offset anyway.Queueing with friends? Great! Attempting to reconnect back into your game can more often than not result in yet  another  <insert BS here>, which (you guessed it!) sets you back even further. Hours invested down the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ all in the span of seconds. A setback from which you have no hope of remedying for the remainder of that season (60 days). Needless to say, this happens every.. single.. season...Now, surely you'd think the devs are aware and on top of the situation. Well, what do they have to say you ask? “Umm.. here's some more $5 skins!! :D”Being a huge MOBA fan since the days of the original DotA and all the hero-based mods on Warcraft III (Hero Wars players where you at), I really loved Awesomenaut's unique 2D spin on the genre, along with its style and music. It's original af and a nice breath of fresh air in a stagnating genre. It really sets itself apart from the current “top” MOBAs like DotA2 and League of Legends which are just blatant knock offs and re-skins of all the mods that kicked off the genre (and that I played to death) and ultimately have nothing new to contribute. So, when I discovered Awesomenauts I overlooked the issues and really tried being patient with the devs in the hopes that they'd sort it all out and get the game out there in a big way. I supported them and even backed their Kickstarter. But, after having been on board for no less than ten seasons, and after countless posts on the forums by the community and their most dedicated players, Ronimo have, and indeed continue to, ignore these glaring issues and treat the game like a pos cash cow. They prioritize working on♥♥♥♥♥♥like an AI editor, a map editor, creating new skins, releasing different in-game announcers, redesigning the UI, and  talking  about the 5th map-- the fabled “Starstorm” map instead. That's when they're not busy further breaking the joke that the game's balance is. During their Kickstarter campaign, they managed to raise over $500,000 and there wasn't so much as a  single  attempt at addressing these issues.So, unless you intend on playing this game with friends, either locally or in private matches online, spare yourself the buttdamage and skip it. Your cash is better spent elsewhere, if at all- there are much,  much  better  free  alternatives out there made by devs that actually give half a♥♥♥♥♥♥(*cough* Heroes of the Storm *cough*).GGs Ronimo! Game had a ton of potential but, sadly, Awesome not.
