content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												While I can say it's overall a really neat concept with a 2d MOBA, this game has a bit more focus on slightly more casual play. Along with quite a bit of humour thrown in there.  This would seem like a quite ideal time sink if you want to play between 15+ minutes to whenever really.It is however dragged down quite a lot with it's peer to peer and ranking system... as some games are literally unplayable due to the lag. For example: One character has the ability to make a forward dash, and become immune to damage for a split second. This can be used to counter other characters abilites, such as nukes, mines or even direct hits if you trigger it right. So in other terms: Something that required timing and skill. With the latency, skill doesn't matter. As you can stand next to a mine, just out of reach. Dash clean through it, end up out of reach, then 1-2 seconds later die, because "you touche a mine, we totes swear.". This lag also can cause no-clips, teleportation or a very common thing: making a blatant miss to hit, whether you dodged it, or are way out of reach. Because you either were in range according to the other player, or you were stuck outside for the others in a "loading" state. I don't know much about programming, but it feels like... having a system that checked "where is character x at 15:42:6 in the game? Back in their base healing? Where did character y's nuke hit at 15:42:6? at the other side of the map? When then it missed." instead of  the current "Hey y, did you hit on your screen? Well then, you died x. Kktnxbye!" So yeah, could definately see some improvements in that sytstem.Otherwise, it is somewhat balanced game. Mechanic wise, they really ought to fix the recovery issues though. The currency loss on death is just pointless, and only is a punishment on a penalty. Only really promoting hostility towards teammates, and making it literally impossible for certain players to catch up, or get a fair chance. As their enemies will have x2-x4 their health, deal about tripple damage, and have plenty more sustain and support. Sorta encouraging "bullying", as a team can get a huge advantage by picking out a player in the opposite team, and solely focusing all effort on killing them. As then it's basically a 3v2 game, with one team just being way better than the other. Because they have all the currency. It's not helped that "try-hards" or the professional players are in the same bracket. I know this is due to limited amount of players. Especially at certain times. But it utterly ruins the game if you have a casual intent, and run into a maximum cheese, on teamspeak cordinated game, where their team is soelly build to win within 5 mintues, along with making it literally impossible to for your team to do anything about it, as if you even get close to your turret, you die. It doesn't help that cheap, "I win" button tactics exist with certain characer combinations.That said, the game is only somewhat balanced as said. As you really have a "rock, papper, scissor" system for their characters at times. As some games you can just start, and tell from just looking at what characters both teams have, and conclude that "yeah, we lost/won". As regardless of skill, (unless it's waaay much difference, or unless lag is in your favour) those matches will play out like expected. As there's nothing you can do.I know most games got imbalance or issues in one way or another. But Awesomenauts could really do with some sort of handicap, or balancing thing. Along with some better way of dealing with the hosting and PtP. As of now, it's really annoying to see a character use an ability towards you, you clearly dodge it, and then you die, becuse it hit you where you were 1-2 seconds ago. Or when you pick up healing, get the +hp, then die, because according to the other person, you haden't healed for them yet, so their damage was fatal on their side, so the game orders your character to die anyway. This is especially not helped by that many people are either gloating, or rude about this. Always claiming it's "skill" when it's positive to them, but suddenly when it's negative for them, it's hax, luck or lag. Becase you know, what's hypocrisy?Know it's mayhaps been a bit seemingly negative view. But I do really like the game. It just has some glaring issues that could do with being addressed. Also wouldn't hurt to impliment the "Official, unofficial, gg qualifications" as an actual thing. I know some are against it, but overall, it promotes a fun/good game, and demotes cheap tactics. For those that don't know of it: It's basically that everyone gets at least one kill, one death, and one turret down for both sides. While it can be a bit tricky to pull of "authentically". I'd want to suggest making it an archivement to have like, 50-100 games like that, that might could have negative effects... so I can't suggest a good fix to encourage it. But so far, the only good, and really great matches have had these statistics. That, and no gloaters xD Those that had lag in them, at least had the people acknowledge it.But yeah, overall, good game. But comes with a lot of issues.

												Man, this game does not get enough attention. Awesomanuts is an incredibly addicting MOBA style cartoony platformer. It's easy to learn, and easier to get good at. number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												Awesomenauts is a 2D 3v3 platforming MOBA with the style of 80s cartoon. I've sunk alot of time into this game and I've had a blast with it, and still do.Pros:-15 Unique characters with thier own upgrades that you can customize to fit your unique playstyle,-Each character has thier own theme music as well as killing spree music-Split screen capable up to 3 players-Controller support, but plays just as awesome with keyboard and mouse-Competitive Community (via the Awesomenauts Pro League)-4 maps with unique platforming and terrian obstacles-AI Modding support to make better bots-Easy to learn, hard to master-Quick matches normally taking 20-30 minutes per match.Cons:-Some of the community can be toxic-A couple of maps favor some nauts better than others-The "drop-in, drop out" system of the game which many have faults with because Awesomenauts was originally a "casual" MOBA styled game.-Unable to coordinate with your teams before a match begins to see what characters they may be playing as or what map you are playing on next (The first part can be fixed by using a voice comms [Skype, Mumble, TS3, etc])-Some people don't like how you have to obtain XP from completing matches to unlock new characters and loadout items for each character.Notes:There is also an expansion which is in development but will be bringing things like:-Spectator Mode-Replays (Released)-5 characters (4 released)-New map-Custom games to play different modes such as Team Deathmatch-Many other featuresI would also like to add one more note that even if you don't have the expansion, you can join a friend's custom game to play on the new map as well as play custom game modes through joining your friend.Overall rating: 9.5/10

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												Over-looking a "glitch" where Teammates wearing Michael Vick Jerseys named Gary wont shut the hell up, (The mute is available in game by hitting Tab by the way) the game is really darn fun. Every patch introduces new wrinkles and matches are usually competitive. Playing from a 2D side scrolling perspective adds a lot to the genre. The chases and escapes are exhilarating. The team work required to set up kills is especially fun because of the direct control over your characters. The community is okay except for my jerk friend Gary but his parents are divorced so I suppose its to be expected. I have played enough MOBA games in my life to know I really dont care for them. This one is just deep enough with out being boring. If you have cool friends, unlike "I-smell-like-the-inside-of-a-hockey-skate Gary" then I cannot recommend enough. Especially if they are familiar with how MOBA style games work.

This is why I keep playing, just to experience these moments again and again. Howere, if you are going to buy this game, play it with friends. It is way more fun to experience those moments with your friend.

content:
Posted: January 7
												It's a fun game to play for a while, but it has very obvious flaws that seem like they would be easily fixable if the devs actually cared.No dedicated servers means that lag or poor connection is a huge issue. About 1/3 of games end with a player disconnecting or just suffering through the game in a region that isn't remotely close to them. I consistently find myself (an East Coast player) playing against Europeans or South Americans regardless of what time I play at. The lag often benefits certain characters, especially Clunk. Additionally, the leveling system is just horrendous. There is no way to get a nice build on most characters without putting a significant amount of time into the game. I would be fine with it if it hardly changed anything but A lot of characters are just god awful without the last two slots in a row being added to a build. I just don't see any reason for it.The game definitely has potential but in its current state it is pretty frustrating.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2015
tl;dr -> "A anemy has been killed. A anemy has been killed. A anemy has been killed." If you are too noob to play real MOBAs, then this game is for you. 11/10 great gameplay.I had been eyeing this game for a long while, and finally decided to get it during the Winter 2014 sale for myself and a couple of friends. I have been thoroughly impressed and satisfied by Awesomenauts. If you like 2D, platformer-style combat, multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) games, 3-versus-3 combat, and a great character selection, then you will really enjoy this game. I STRONGLY recommend this game for anyone interested in diving into the MOBA genre, as it a great starter to begin your education. The game supports local multiplayer, and I plan to play this with my gf to give her a lighter introduction. The aesthetics are fantastic - the amount of detail in the different character models, levels, and skill animations is very well-done. I was very impressed with the music - each character has their own unique theme song that plays during the loading screen and for a short time if you manage to get a decent killing spree going (I am pretty sure it plays for everyone in the game, but I am not 100% certain). The character taunts, sound assets, and announcer dialogue is good, however, whenever an enemy dies it really sounds like the announcer is saying: "A anemy has been killed," and I find this very annoying - especially when he clearly says "An ally has been killed." This is most likely a personal experience though, and not a big deal. Each different level offers a different enough layout that your play strategy can change significantly, and this is a huge plus for the game.The controls are simple and easy to familiarize yourself with, however, understanding how each character works may take a bit of practice and time. I strongly suggest you use a controller to play, but the keyboard+mouse combo is sufficient as well. The learning curve is minimal to moderate depending on your experience with MOBA games. Although the tutorial is fairly lengthy - you must do a tutorial, play a bot match, and kill an opponent (bot or real player) in order to unlock your full account (ranks, leaderboards, etc). I approve of this design because it will get new players to the genre better oriented to the unique playstyle, however, it can be very annoying for MOBA veterans (honestly, a single bot match would have sufficed). During gameplay, the goal is to destroy the opponent's drill core, which is located near the opposite end of the map. To reach the core, you must destroy gun towers that block your path. These towers, however, are very powerful against Awesomenauts, so you must wait for your periodically-spawning minions to soak up the damage while you attack. The maps have 2 "lanes," or routes that minions travel through (compared to the typical 3-lane design in most 3D MOBAs). This fits with MOBAS that have a 2v2 or 3v3 match variant, which usually compensate by having only 2 lanes to defend/attack. When you destroy a gun tower, a special, stronger minion will spawn for you and follow the lane where the destroyed tower used to be, allowing you to push (attack) more aggressively.When you spawn, you will take a drop pod from your ship down toward the battlefield. During this interesting segment, you can collect "solar" (Awesomenaut currency) along the way. The pattern of solar placement differs by map, but seems to be consistent, so you can memorize the patterns per map. Solar is dropped when enemies are killed, and "last hitting" (delivering the death blow) will cause you to automatically pick up any dropped solar. When an Awesomenaut is killed, the killer gets a large amount of solar (70 if memory servers correctly), while all allies get 30 solar. Dying will cause you to lose a small amount of solar. There is no real "jungling" option, which is nice because it does not add that complication to this mostly introductory title to the MOBA genre. There is usually a separate portion on each map where neutral minions walk around, and killing them will grant you a quick, small health restoration and a bit of solar. Visiting this area regularly to keep your health up will ensure that you can sustain your lane, allowing you to stay there to continue farming solar. In Awesomenauts, you will not want to return to base to heal unless you have enough solar to buy a new upgrade. The different characters have unique movement - specifically, jump - styles. For example, one character can hover, another can triple jump, and another can fly/hover. You start off with your basic attack, which will be either ranged or melee-based. At the store, you can upgrade your basic attack, as well as skills relevant to your character - like increased health, movement speed, health regeneration, etc. You can also unlock 2 more usable abilities (on the controller, unlocking all abilities will give you an X, Y, and B attack {or square, triangle, circle for you non-microsoft users - like me}). You can only select 3 upgrades per skill, and you initially have 4 upgrades to select from per skill.As you gain account experience (given post-match; more xp is given if you win, naturally), you will unlock more characters to use, as well as more possible upgrades to use. I especially like this design-choice, because it allows people to familiarize themselves with a smaller pool of upgrades before providing them with too many - it also helps people get used to how each character is supposed to be played. The lack of items in this game is good because it allows new players to only have to worry about skills and upgrades. Again, Awesomenauts is a great introductory game to the MOBA genre.Overall, the game plays very, very well and should be played by anyone interested in the MOBA genre. You will not be disappointed.Definitely recommend! Cheers,DJSF @DJSF's Rogue Reviews

Most are easy to grasp but difficult to master. I've seen players completely suck as, say, Leon, while others rack up the kills.The developers also constantly update the game, such as the latest update that includes new skins and voices. The developers clearly care about their fanbase by giving  them a great product and constantly working on it. Be forewarned, though, that your favourite character might be changed - or worse, nerfed - in some of these updates.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												Awesomenauts is a 3-on-3 2D MOBA game. You start out with a limited selection of ‘Nauts, but unlocking the other ones is done rather quickly.Eventually, you’ll have a selection of 15 heroes to choose from (19 if you also purchased “Starstorm”) each with 2 special skills and a regular attack. Further levelling up of your profile will unlock special features for your skills, like lower cooldowns or larger range. So people who have played longer will have a wider variety of features in their skills.Awesomenauts also doesn’t have a steep learning curve like other MOBA games, so it’s fairly easy to jump into the game and get playing. However, it’s still varied enough to not grow stale quickly and the skill ceiling is high enough to keep you playing and trying to improve.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2014
												My opinionated breakdown review of: AwesomenautsGameplay: Awesomenauts is a MOBA set in the future where there is an ongoing war between the Ones and the Zeroes. In order to bring the war to a conclusion, mercenaries called "Awesomenauts" have been hired to help aid the two factions. The main objective is to destroy the other team's solar drill. (solar being a precious liquid metal) You will have to go through turrents  and droids blocking your path, as with typical MOBA fashion, but this game does something different. It is set on a 2D plane. This adds another dimension to skill shots and abilities. I would describe it as a run and gun MOBA, and combat plays like so. As you complete objectives, you will gain solar, which you will ironically spend on upgrades to get an edge over the other team. Your base will constantly spew droids to help you push and destroy the turrents so you can eventually make it to the base and destoroy the drill. There are a wide range of characters to choose from, even without its paid expansion.They all add a nice variety of dual abilities and keep combat fresh. Besides some balancing issues with characters, the most strategic will always prevail. If you happen to die, you get to enjoy the very fun respawn system. You will blast from some sort of ship and fly through a field of solar, and crash land onto the planet where you will resume play. I have noticed this game tends to get more chaotic than most MOBAs, especially with all six players in one spot, it gets difficult to see what you are doing. Besides many minor gripes, the game works well and is one of the most enjoyable and frustrating games I have ever played.Art: The game is in 2D and the characters and enviroments are animated nicely.Teams are easy to recognize with their simple blue and red color scheme. Each animation is easy to recognize and it helps you determine what you should do to defend against a certain attack, besides characters being unique in looks, you can also buy skin packs which will give your "Awesomenauts" a newly themed costume. The effects of characters are nicely done as well, it is hard to look at an effect and not know what it does. Other than characters having exclusive animations (looking up and down) any gripes with the art would be purely subjective.Music/Sound: As soon as you start the game, it has a very enjoyable Saturday morning cartoon intro with a catchy theme song, after that the main menu music is very outerspace and fits the game perfectly. Music in game starts after you land your rocket which adds a special kick that helps get you back in game. Gameplay has a playlist of great tunes that add to the comedic battle them. Speaking of comedy, this game is full of one liners, it is not unusual to get taunted about how smelly you are or how fat your mother is. Each character has a voice that fits them well, and helps add to their profile. The game's soundtrack is also availiable for purchase.Entertainment: If you enjoy a simple, but competitive multiplayer game, you will have many hours of fun. Me and my friend constantly play this game together and have good and bad times. I cannot come up with a situation where you will get tired of this game. The updates are frequent and exciting enough and the community is a small, but very loyal and active playerbase. This game runs on the community, as they help fund updates and expansions. Score: Besides network and balancing issues (which will probably be fixed) the game is enjoyable on all fronts. Simple but complex gameplay, simple but fluent art style, and simple but groovy music, it doesn't do too much wrong, but almost does everything right.4/5Thank you for reading.

Oh my.., game has indeed changed but unfortunately it's extremely well thought out balance is gone. Difference to the old system is in my opinion quite small but big enough -> Once one team early on gets an advantage that advantage stays to the end. I have now played a couple of games where our team right from the bat lost some encounters early on. after that it was a loosing game. We nearly managed to get the advantage but the other team lead from start to finnish. Differences are subtle but tighter the match the more you can see it.  This far i have not yet seen much of the old back and forth tug of war. Now tell me why should i play this? even with the added content? or buy the expansion? the motivation does not exist right now. And the worst part: in the games i played i was the noob that probably made the team loose. Everyone else had higher levels. Now who the **** would want to play this as a newbie? (after a long break it is like being a newbie again - have no idea of what builds to do now)

content:
Posted: January 24, 2015
												As you probably might guess by the Awesomnauts' cutesy artstyle and wacky character design this game was built around the idea of creating a casual and arcady 2D MOBA. The idea was executed well: gameplay is indeed largely twitch skill based, yet most of the mechanics familiar from DOTA clones were preserved. Learning curve is pretty mild and the game is satisfying to play right off the bat. There is a sufficient degree of complexity in terms of metagame, so it's not entirely meaningless, but superior platforming skill can definitely elevate even the crappiest of builds to a point where you might be an asset to the team. There is also a pretty varied roster of characters, all with their own style and personality. On top of that, devs are still adding new content, which gives you incentive to come back regularly, as it almost guaranteed to feel fresh again. The few gripes I have with it are not related to the core gameplay as much as they're basically inevitable problems that this game has to face as a multiplayer game run by a small indie studio and a (sort of) MOBA. One of them would be the occasional toxicity you might encounter in the game. It can be upsetting and annoying, but it's still slightly better than in LOLs and DOTAs. Matchmaking is another problem. The issue here lies in the basic reality that there simply aren't enough concurrent players at any given time  to make the algorithm work well so the result is oftentimes you end up in very lopsided  matches and unequal team members. The best remedium for this is to play with friends, that way it won't affect you nearly as much.  There is also a huge chasm between what the most dedicated part of the community, those who play in League 1 and 2, wants and what all the rest wants  and  sometimes it seems like the devs don't quite know how to deal with these conflicting demands which sometimes leads to some balancing issues. But that's rather a minor complaint as this state never lasts for very long and eventually returns to equilibrium.  With all that said, Awesomenauts still has me going back to it and despite my frustrations I can still say that it's still ton of fun and I recommend it without any hesitation.

content:
Posted: September 7, 2014
												This is not like your Standard MOBA, its a 2D MOBA.There are 'Nauts' (basically just character) Each character has its own special ability. Its 3 v 3 so that makes it alot of harder to control the map. Of course are there Minions, towers and a shop :). Just like LoL DotA 2. But its not easy to get in the game, it takes alot of skills to master, since this is a 2D moba. You'll need a different play style cause the maps are not big. No jungles. So this is big change.The multiplayer is decent, cause there is Lag and someone can leave the server and join again and pick another character (no punish. And there's one thing that annoys me alot is the DLC. You have to pay REAL money for 'Nauts', skins. Like if i play online i see no one with a skin. And Yes i bought the Starstorm dlc, i think thats the best DLC they made. Cause there are new characters AI options and more! And yes the controller works really good on this game actually had no problems with the controller. Splitscreens is actually well done :).The game is really fun!If you are going to buy this game i recommend you to buy the Starstorm DLC for the extra 'nauts' and Options.And yes there are AI options if you buy Starstorm. Cause the AI is not the best in this game without it. Not alot of maps. Rating: 8,5/10 donuts.Nice price, nice game

content:
Posted: September 29, 2015
												Don't buy this game.  It could be great but as it stands the matchmaking is THE WORST, and there's no single player mode.  The learning curve is really high, plan on getting destroyed as a newbie.  Once you get experienced you will get dominated by premades, lose games that you should win because people constantly leave/latejoin, get harassed by the toxic playerbase, and get disconnected from P2P matchmaking as you are about to win.  Oh, and players get a buff when they join late.  This game could be amazing but Ronimo just keeps cranking out DLC to fatten their pockets.  They have been saying they're going to fix matchmaking for over a year but have changed nothing, meanwhile churning our new characters and skins till there's no tomorrow.  Laggy matches, flawed matchmaking, and no valuable single player mode.  Trust me, I have spent 100s of dollars on this game and have over 2000 hours.Don't buy this game.  Go play Heroes of the Storm(what I switched to), DOTA, or LOL.  You've been warned.

content:
Posted: March 8
												The current version of the game it's broken and not worth playing. After almost 900 hours playing over the last years, I've seen its highs and lows with nauts balancing. They keep trying to find a point in wich all of them are equally used and usefull, but still you will encounter the same pack of nauts chosen over and over again, with some of them completely out of the game. This happens due to some DPS being extremely easy to control and OP, and support being useless unless you're doing a premade, and also having skilled team mates (And still you'd have probably won still if you had chosen another naut to paly with).And that speaking of when you actually GET to play a match. The matchmaking is utterly broken and discfuntional. First at all, it's divided in 5 minutes segments, wich make you have a fixed time to wait for a match. Besides of that, most of times it won't find players with similar ping or skill near you, wich will make you wait for another 5 minutes. Even then, sometimes it will just put you in a game with bots because it's not able to find you a proper match (Hello? If i'd ever want to play with bots I'd have choosen that, don't you think, Galactron?) And when it finally works a match for you, you end up with both skilled and new players all scrambled, proving all the waits and supposed "improvements" of the matchmaking lead to the same problems we had before the Galactron patch. I can stand a lame 10 minutes game with a league 7 and a bot against two league 2 and a league 4, but no way I'm waiting 8 minutes to play the same time.This game brought me plenty of fun in the old times, but I can't recommend anyone to play it right now, not even for a gimme achievement the developers put on trying to force the player's hand into bringing friends. Stay away from this until it gets A LOT of fixes.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												Though it's hard to choose a favorite game, Awesomenauts is up there for me. It is somehow casual while being competitive, using it's bright and silly graphics to keep a light tone to it. It is incredibly fun, and the most replayable game I have ever played. Each team having 3 players makes for a great time with 2 of your friends. However, this can also be a source of irritation for solo players, as teams with communication have a giant advantage. This can turn into a bigger problem as the Awesomenauts community is very small, making it impossible to match pre-made teams with solely other pre-mades. As a result of this, many players are turned away from the game early on, especially due to poor matchmaking at some less busy times of day. Through all of this, I urge everyone to try this game and to not give up during the first few matches. The fun only increases with your experience.9/10

content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												Awesomenauts is one of those games you will either like or not. I had a couple hours of fun with this game, but that is pretty much it, much like DOTA (which is quite different than this, yes), it plays out in the sense that two teams duke it out against eachother. Each player (human or bot) gains levels and more skills as the game progresses, and finally either team has pushed far enough to destroy the other team's main objective, and that is it. The game features dozens of characters to play and you will certainly find a couple favorites that you will have fun playing, moreso than others. I am pretty confident that a group of people (2-6) playing together (and against eachother) can have a lot of fun with Awesomenauts, and I would definitely recommend it for that.

number of helpful: 10 of 17 people (59%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 15, 2015
												I remember when I first saw this game for sale on the XBLA years ago (I was still a scrubby console gamer back then, please forgive me!), and my initial reaction was ‘Wow, this game looks absolutely dreadful’, I just didn’t get it! Luckily, I played this game on a whim, and I have to say, it blew me away!But first, a bit about the game, it’s a 2D, 3v3 MOBA, currently consisting of a modest roster of 20 ‘Awesomenauts’ (20 is including the Expansion pack ‘Nauts, of which there are 4), where the goal is to destroy the enemies’ damage dealing, high health turrets, thankfully with the help of small damage absorbing droids, in order to destroy the enemies’ drill core, leading to a victory. Each player picks one of the aforementioned ‘Nauts to play as during the match, each with His/her own unique Autoattack and abilities. There is also a currency in this game called ‘Solar’ which allows you to upgrade your abilities. All of this is in the style of an 80’s Saturday morning cartoon show. Boom.I love this concept (despite hating it initially :s), the 2D aspect of the game means that it requires a lot of platforming ability in order for you to be good at it, and honestly, it’s a very clever twist to the typical MOBA, and it’s made the game very refreshing for me. The graphics and soundtrack are equally invigorating, with some of my favourites being the character themes and killing sprees.Additionally, this game isn’t short of diversity. Each ‘Naut brings something new to the table in the form of the aforementioned abilities, so, when you get bored of one character, you can play another for a short while, it never feels like you’re playing the same game twice! Furthermore, upgrades add to this diversity. There are 4 rows of upgrades for your abilities, with 6 of them per row, moreover, only 3 upgrades can be chosen in a match. This means that you can upgrade your character to suit your playstyle, adding a lot of strategic depth into the game.The ‘Nauts themselves all have relatively interesting backstories and quirks, which is evident in their voice-acted lines when you play them. Granted, a few of the voices of the ‘Nauts are a bit hit-and-miss, sometimes leaving me questioning why ‘Naut X has Voice Y because it doesn’t suit them, and some of the voice lines are blatant attempts to badly cram a few well known memes and references into the game because apparently ‘It’s funny’ (Some of the references are well done and funny in my opinion, but I would like to see SOME original dialogue as opposed to a sea of memes).However, my major problem with this game lies in its’ online aspect, Ronimo execute this poorly, from the god-awful matchmaking which will leave you in a 1v3 against a full L1 premade, to the matches against players with over 400 ping, making it near impossible to dodge them, let alone win against them, ‘Awesomenauts’ knows how to make you rage online. In balance terms, the game is O.K at the moment, there are OP and UP ‘Nauts at the moment, which is only natural, but there are none which I currently consider stupidly unbalanced, despite the massive ‘Coco Nebulon’ Meta at the moment. The community, I feel, has also been gaining a lot of toxicity recently, but there isn’t much we can do, people have become more experienced and competitive since its’ release, and as a result, players become a lot angrier at new or inexperienced players who play the game for fun, which is a worrying and saddening trend in the once calm and collected community.The paragraph above makes it sound like this game is absolutely awful. It makes me want to hate it, but I simply can’t. For every rage-inducing game, there is a genuinely fun game that draws you back in, and that makes this game fun and addictive as hell (Granted, I have had to take a break from it twice for about a month because I was sick of all the Bull). This is without a doubt my favourite game, and I think my hours show that, and I would recommend this to anyone interested in getting into MOBA's. But I would recommend that you bring a couple of friends along for the ride, it’s so much easier to deal with its’ BS together. If you want to go into it by yourself, fine. But trust me, you will need a lot of patience with it in order to see past its’ shortcomings, and appreciate it for what it is.TL;DR: Love the ‘Saturday morning’ cartoon style, as well as the soundtrack. Very diverse roster of Nauts with interesting backstories. Balancing is a bit meh. Voice acting can be a bit uninspired. Bad matchmaking and network coding may result in rage inducing matches, but the rest of the game is good enough to help you see past its’ flaws.Final score: 8/10

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												This was a hard game to get people into, especially if one has a bad taste from the MOBA-genre in general, but now it's damn near impossible to get newer folks to play. I love the characters, abilities, graphic style, and the flow of the fight especially in a team of friends, but some recent updates have marred the former image of Awesomenauts.For players from the pre-XP system era, like myself, some are able to work past the changes but almost all of us dislike the system for a number of reasons. Notice though how I said "work." The shorter game span and snowballing was really not necessary since there already was a leveling system in place before (Solar currency and maxing items on a character).But now that system is still in effect... with an additional layer of HP and damage % upgrades doled out instantly for player kills and droid/creep kills. There's no strategy involved with that; it's merely a grind to see who is a better farmer. Making this not only like "other MOBA games" but also causing players to play more selfishly, stealing health creeps for XP instead saving for a heal, or ignoring a push and focusing on kills.I still recommend this game because it's near and dear to me - but it has a steeper learning curve than it previously had without any real value added, unfortunately.

H I T GAME.中文版本：    有一句话是这么说的：“陪伴是最长情的告白”，关于这个游戏，我差不多玩了有3000+小时，作为及其少数从1.0版本一直走到现在的玩家，我只能说，我尽力了，真的。    当初寥寥无几的那些人，大部分人还是盗版。但是我依然在为这个游戏的推广而努力。在看到巴西玩家一起写信给Ronimo然后出了巴西语言之后，我们以华人玩家的身份给游戏公司写信希望能出官方的汉化，游戏公司回复我们也许会在未来考虑这一点，但是现在由于技术问题我们做不到。我们表示理解，毕竟是一个小公司，不能强求太多。甚至我们有想过能不能和3DM合作一起出一个外挂汉化发给游戏公司，然后我就去和3DM的版主去联系了，如果有心人还记得的话，那个版主叫杀中杀，虽然后来我们闹崩了。然后为了争取在国内普及这个游戏，对于制约最大的语言问题，我赶在我某个假期的最后放弃了其他所有的事情在三天内做出了第一版的翻译，我一点一点做的英雄的详细资料，包括背景故事，基础的信息，各种技能以及升级的的解释 。并且在每次版本更新的时候都要去自己一个人去维护他，只能说我耗费了30%的精力投入到这个游戏上面，我真的尽力了。我不想抱怨什么，因为所有的语言在事实面前都是苍白无力的。    然后关于星爆，当时群里的人特别兴奋，毕竟按照官方的说明，应该是一个会让人为之振奋的版本，在线观战，回放，大厅，Workshop，5个英雄2张地图，但是直到现在Starstrom还没有完成，但是在这种情况下，Ronimo选择的是出新的英雄出新的DLC，出新的皮肤播音员。Ronimo你可曾考虑过玩家的感受？    我不想提游戏关于英雄的平衡是这样的：哪个英雄这段时间玩的人特别多胜率也不错，那么好，这个英雄太强了我们需要砍一下。对于那些没怎么有人玩，胜率低的英雄，那么好，这个英雄太垃圾了，我们要增强一下。你们就是这么平衡英雄的？？不过看了Ronimo的直播之后我觉得，他们也只能这样平衡了，因为他们实在是菜的一笔。根本不知道怎么样去平衡英雄。为了让超频OverdriveDLC买的人更多，不惜一切来加强超频里的三个英雄，我也真的是服气了。    在Ronimo的官网上曾经有这样的一张计划图，评测没法贴图我就直接复制了。• Custom games browser• Third batch of Custom Games options• Online replays• Infinite spectator mode• Level editor• Steam Workshop integration• Starstorm map + song• Digital artbook• Backer mentions in the droppod area• New Matchmaking    大厅已经被他们放弃了。连一个简简单单的在降落区对捐款玩家的感谢，以及雕塑到现在都没有做出来。还有一张星爆地图也没有做出来，就更不用说观战模式，Workshop，在线录像。    之前想举办一个比赛，我去给官方写信问能不能给我们几个Roboscoop皮肤来当做奖品，我们想尽可能的在中国推广这个游戏，官方是这样回复我的，抱歉不能给你皮肤，但是我们正在弄简体中文，希望这样能帮你推广这个游戏，并且有可能后续需要你们的帮助来维护。当时听到之后很振奋，真的。在有生之年说不能定见到简体中文也不枉我这么多年的心血。但是随着第一次Beta的测试，心碎了一半。这垃圾汉化，一个大写的服气。再加上新的匹配机制的垃圾到不能再垃圾而且对于中国玩家强烈的不友好。我仿佛已经能看到这个游戏的终点了。    今天和Sauce老师一起测试了一下新匹配，我们俩150ping，但是2s一次红三角，然后一次红三角10s。这很王牌真的。    用一句话来形容，有心杀贼，无力回天。    我累了，仅此而已。    抱歉。

content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
												Time for yet another update. Firstly, I'm quite excited about the new Starstorm Map. Let's see what the Devs cooked up for us. Secondly, I have the impression that the almighty Matchmaking got both, better and worse. Why both you might ask? Well, 'better' because I have the impression skill levels among teams are not so damn skewed anymore. Seems more even. I have to admit I am enjoying a lot more matches recently. Also, I noticed an increase in crazy comebacks. Boy, did we wreck that one team last night after our base got down to one bar of HP :)Actually, I am close to changing this review into "Thumbs up". BUT (Don't be discouraged by the long text below, stay with me here):'Worse' has gotten the amount of RQs (Rage Quitters). Understandably so. You (not me of course ^^) join a match, 15 minutes in against a "premade team", 3 turrets down. Why waste time on that, right? Just leave, or go afk or feed, it usually won't matter. You'll lose anyway, get your ranking decreased etc. This is the stuff Rage is made of. Don't get me wrong, I've been there, done that. But that just seems weird. Somebody RQs, he gets punished. Then you take his place. Whether you RQ or stay, it is very likely that you also get punished and lose ranking anyway. And the infinte loop of RQ - late join - RQ continues. And now it gets even worse: Imagine, if you so will, the following: You and your team harmonize, you dominate or simply put: YOU PWN YOUR ENEMIES. Now, somebody decides to RQ, is temporarily replaced by a bot, then by another players. Good so far. BUT: remember that "late-join" bonus? Yeah, it's insane. Now lets continue that train of thought: One RQ: no problem. Two: meh, I can handle it. Three or more (and believe me it's more common than you might think): YOU WILL PROBABLY LOSE. All of a sudden, all the late-joiners accumulate a MASSIVE amount of bonusses. Seriosuly, its not even funny. They will simply out-bonus you. Even if you dominated earlier, RQs result in a massive shift in resources. And that♥♥♥♥♥♥is simply broken.Short version of the above: RQs beget RQs, leading to Bonus town, USA.Minor stuff I'd also like to nag about:Premade vs. solo : C'mon devs, still? At least show me that I am playing againt pres.Lag: pew pew .......................................death            Don't get me wrong here, I like this game (got a couple of in-game hours). But would I recommend it to new players? Probably only to those who are willing to live with minor and major flaws. Then, go ahead, grab the game and hop in, it is fun. If you are prone to anger? Look elsewhere.Have a good day, everybody.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2016
 The StoryTwo sides are at war, choose your awesomenaut and ship out and defeat the other team! As you would expect from a game based completely on battling there isn't much to explain about the story, there is a nice opening cinematic that has a hilarious similar to a Power Rangers episode, but other than that the game is mostly an exchange of going back and forward fighting indefinitely. The Game PlayThe controls are best explained while playing the game. the movement is ASDW, you can use W or space to jump, some characters have a double jump, some fly. You use both mouse buttons and the scroll lock click to use various abilities. The button configuration is very toned down, you're limited on what abilities you can use, and before you start the game you select the abilities you want to unlock as you play the game.Okay, now I should say something about the various characters, there are A LOT of characters which might compliment your play style. I tried them all while playing "offline practice mode", I found my favorite character and then intended to play as that character until I became very familiar with the game.As you play through the game (even playing offline practice mode) you will received experience that will unlock new awesomenauts and abilities for your awesomenauts. This element in the game gives me a very strong sense of progression throughout the game. (coupled with getting a lot of easy-to-earn-achievements that I earned while playing offline! (Thank you for that Awesomenauts!)I keep talking about "offline practice mode", the reason I do is because I spent a lot of time playing in this mode before starting the game. When I first played this game I tried to play it with my friend, we were both equally noobish at what was going on, I didn't even know this was a MOBA! So naturally we got ourselves massacred. :( Left a bad taste in my mouth.But! after I discovered offline practice mode, I learned on my own without looking up guides how I wanted to play the game. Naturally if I wanted to get better guides would help, but I like to think I'm a fairly competent gamer, playing offline let me try out various characters and strategies without dragging down my team. You can adjust the AI to make practice easier or more difficult depending on your confidence.A final note about playing through the game, you start the game out with "solar" or "coins", you collect more of these from killing various npc / players, as you collect more, you return to your base to purchase upgrades for your awesomenaut making him/her stronger. knowing which ones to upgrade and which ones to select take practice, guides, or strategy. Once again, if you want to actually learn the game, try out offline practice mode to see what I mean! All in All Awesomenauts	 is a 2D MOBA (Multiplayer online battle arena), with a strong sense of progression, and a lot of different dynamics that can be taken into account. I don't really have anything negative to say about the game, read on if you want to know more specifics!8/10 From Me Sweep

content:
Posted: January 5, 2013
												Awesomenauts is one of my most played games in 2013 and I believe it will continue to be one of my most played games in 2014. Why?Just by the looks you can tell the amount of work and love that's been put into the game. It's pretty obvious that Awesomenauts is a game that its developers care about and not just some money chest that gets opened one time and then will be burried. Updates are rolling in regularly and the first Kickstarter-powered expansion pack is on its way as well.What really makes this game so good though is its core gameplay. It takes the MOBA concept, takes away every unnecessary complex addition and adds some action driven 2D arcade gameplay. The resulting game is addictive but also works well in short bursts. Games rarely last longer than 15-20 minutes and the game introduces new characters carefully so you will get to learn their strenghts and weaknesses.Just be warned that Awesomenauts' fun factor increases exponentially to the friends you're playing this game with. It can be rather frustrating if you're on your own and at mercy of inexperienced or downright dumb people. But setting up a team with two friends and communicating via Skype or Teamspeak will result in one of the best multiplayer experiences on Steam.This game is worth every penny they're asking for and if you've got the chance to get this cheaper from a Steam Sale or Humble Bundle then give it a shot.

content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												Awesomenauts is an amazing side scrolling MOBA game by Romino. The artstyle for this game is absolutly wonderful, and described as "Saturday Morning Cartoon" style, similar to TF2 but more cartoon-ey, I guess. Anyway, this game takes place way into the future in a galaxy unknown where this team of mercenaries, the "Awesomenauts" fight each other for galactic power. Each class is unique and has their own strengths and weaknesses. My favorite character is Voltar, a brain in a jar that can heal friendly awesomenauts and do small amounts of damage to the enemy. Definitely worth the money, so go ahead and pick up this game and give it a try, I'm sure you'll love it!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2013
												Awesomenauts is one of my most played games in 2013 and I believe it will continue to be one of my most played games in 2014. Why?Just by the looks you can tell the amount of work and love that's been put into the game. It's pretty obvious that Awesomenauts is a game that its developers care about and not just some money chest that gets opened one time and then will be burried. Updates are rolling in regularly and the first Kickstarter-powered expansion pack is on its way as well.What really makes this game so good though is its core gameplay. It takes the MOBA concept, takes away every unnecessary complex addition and adds some action driven 2D arcade gameplay. The resulting game is addictive but also works well in short bursts. Games rarely last longer than 15-20 minutes and the game introduces new characters carefully so you will get to learn their strenghts and weaknesses.Just be warned that Awesomenauts' fun factor increases exponentially to the friends you're playing this game with. It can be rather frustrating if you're on your own and at mercy of inexperienced or downright dumb people. But setting up a team with two friends and communicating via Skype or Teamspeak will result in one of the best multiplayer experiences on Steam.This game is worth every penny they're asking for and if you've got the chance to get this cheaper from a Steam Sale or Humble Bundle then give it a shot.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												A really good 2D Platformer game to play. It has many characters to choose from and each character is unique in it's own way with plenty of moves that can make your character different from another person's. This game can closely be related to Super Smash Bros in a way. I would recommend this game for playing with your friends as it is quite fun. Only downside is, Awesomenauts have very poor dedicated servers and almost every game will have lag. For example, I already got back to my base where they can't kill me but I suddenly take damage and die from robot 0.o. Also, if you have poor internet (Under 300KB per second) I would really tell you to stay away. If you have slow internet you just end up frozen in the game letting the enemy kill you while you can do nothing about it.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 23, 2013
												A fantastic collaberation of the Side-Scrolling Platformer and Moba genres crossed with some fighting game elements.  And while it certainly has it's problems, such as various glitches which the devs are working on fixing at this very moment and a few balance problems, this game is well worth looking in to.  Much like any other Moba-style games, or competitive games for that matter, Awesomenauts is very difficult to master.  I personally have thrown 1000+ hours into the game and I'm still not that great.  However unlike quite a few games out there which I will not name, it is very easy to get into the game and have a fantastic time.  Rather than spending the first fifteen or so minutes doing nothing but killing the creep waves and maybe some minor poke, it is completely possible to engage in a team fight within the first few minutes of a match, keeping it exciting for everyone participating.If I were to rate Awesomenauts, I would give it a 7/10.  The score should be higher, however there are some outstanding issues which I just cannot pass over, such as a Peer to Peer connection system which quite often matches you against players with insane ping levels, or the fact that certain characters can't make jumps that other characters can.  However it is still an immense amount of fun and I have found that after 1000+ hours I'm still not bored of the game, do check it out!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												A really good Game, i would REALLY like to see it as a new ESL MOBA.BUT, and here comes the but:- Many Characters are unbalanced and still too strong- You shouldn't add buyable Characters. That destroys a competitive Game, focus on Skins, that doesn't destroys the Gameplay. Its just unfair to pay real Money so that you are ALLOWED to play Nauts that are in this game.- Map Balance. Some Maps like the ''jungle'' Map are good balanced, with many Creeps to restore your health, and bosses to fight against to earn more money. But Maps like the Space Stations are unbalanced as hell, because once you hold the middle, where the only creeps are, you get constant health while the enemy team has to go back to base.- Gameplay Balance. AGAIN the Balance. If you got 3 people who are good at this game, just push 1 lane, and to 90% you always win. The turrets should be MUCH stronger and shouldn't have a consistent life bar. So its basically just [hit, run away, hit again, run away] until the turret is down plus, there are no servers. Peer2Peer and you get killed behind turrets. Great.Also, the ranking system is not existing. You, with 5 hours get easily connected to people with 2000 hours. So the ranks are making no sense at all.- And the biggest problem of all: The base. Once all turrets are down, i guarantee you to 99% you will lose this game.The nauts can attack the base, while droids can spawn without problems, helping them. YOUR droids cant do anything, because they all spawn infront of the base, so theres almost NO chance to turn the game around, because you don't have turrets anymore. People just hit the base until it has 1-10% of life, then they just wait for you to push, and they go alone in there and finish it. That is certainly damn stupid and you can easily destroy the base, without ANY chance of pushing back. The base should regenerate itself and should have a little undestroyable turret. That would make it MUCH harder to attack the base without Mercy.And of course the Community: You ever played COD, LoL or any other Multiplayer Game? Yes?Well forget all of it. NO community in the world is as worse, as the Awesomenauts Community.People play 1-10 destroy the base and write ''eZ noobs''You barely lost a game because a teammate disconnects? ''Deinstall game you f.aggot''You died because an enemy has the perfect counter naut for you? ''Learn how to play m.otherf.ucker''You died because an enemy is lagging around and you cant hit him? ''You are so bad, eZ''You destroyed the enemy base? ''LoL you guys suck eZ''You destroyed a turret? ''Play fair you noob''If Ronimo would work more on the gameplay, instead of putting new buyable annoying nauts in the game, it would actually be REALLY good.But until then, we just have to wait.7/10. Would recommend, if you can ignore the community.

												A lot of people might think it's just a flashy and happy game, but there's more to that in it. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 21, 2013
												This is a very good game for people of all skill levels, and play styles. Awesomenauts offers a unique variety of characters, all with their own unique play style. I don't like comparing games, but after getting about 30 hours in on Awesomenauts, I played a game called "Smite" a similar game with a 3D art style, Awesomenauts was FAR superior over that game, by having a long and growing list of unique characters with unique abilities. Awesomenauts will offer hours of fun, and unique combat along with a lot of strategizing. Being a highly competitive game, you will be matched with competitive people.  But like I said, with strategizing, and smart gameplay you will be able to win.  And if not you will learn from the superior players, and grow your knowledge of the game -- You aren't just automatically good at this game, practice is required. So if you have the $10 to spare, I highly suggest purchasing it, and if its on sale I HIGHLY suggest purchasing this game.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
												Before you read onwards, this is coming from someone who was ranked world number one for a few weeks when I was playing this every day, I got really, really into the meta so keep in mind my review is based on high level play. Casual players may have a different experience.This game could be fun but it's a rage fest and waste of money for several reasons:- It's a lag fest. You will die, and lose a lot to inferior teams that have a lagger- If someone rage quits on the opposite team, when someone else takes their place they are given a huge point bonus and this results in you losing 9 out of 10 times, it's very broken.- Certain combinations are just unbeatable. There are a lot of characters that have huge burst damage, if luck has it that you are up against 3 burst damage characters, game over you lose don't pass go don't collect 200.- There's a healing naut called voltar who offers indefinate sustain healing for the team, if he's on the opposing team see above comment.Don't waste your time and money. I have played this game... a lot. Seen it go through a lot of patches and updates, currently it's just ♥♥♥♥in' broken.

  Category RatingBrief Comment   Plot 7.5/10While simplistic, the plot is short and gets to the point. Basically, you're a mercanary being hired by somebody trying to collect an intergalactic currency known as 'solar'. You never know whether you'll be working for the red or the blue team next time, but only time will tell.   Gameplay 10/10Fun, fun and more fun! You can play this game for hours and not get bored! Play as a variety of characters, and use your moves to your advantage to annihilate the enemies! Work together with your team in this multiplayer action-packed platform. Very, very nicely done.   Graphics 9/10The graphics have a simple yet futuristic feel to them. They look very well done, and there's a lot of detail in them, while not having too much. This game is great! Awesome graphics, simple plot avoiding complications, and very fun gameplay. This game truely is awesome!Thanks for taking the time to read my review! Please check out my other reviews. content:
Posted: July 28, 2013
												Awesomenauts is a very addictive, actionpacked and fun 3 vs. 3, 2D platform MOBA featuring:+ lovely cartoon graphics+ 16 Awesomenauts with 2 unique skills and 24 upgrades for each (+5 extra nauts with expansion)+ 5 maps with special gameplay mechanics+ custom games options for individual games+ offline games (against bots), local and online multiplayer+ high replay value due to the easy to learn, but hard to master fighting system+ an active developer team that is still adding new content (even after more than 2 years after release)- not perfect, but moderate balancing- occasional lags caused by the peer-to-peer network structure - moderate matchmaking (which should be fixed in a couple of months)Best game I've played yet! Highly recommended!:)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2016
												This game is incredibly fun. The sidescroller aspect to a MOBA is one I hadn't considered before and it really works well. Learning the game is a much easier task than in other MOBAs and the character builds are varied but simple enough that newbies can get them quickly without having to look them up. Games usually take anywhere from 1/6-1/4 the time a match of DOTA2 would take. The music is excellent and ridiculous, which perfectly sets the tone for the environments, characters, and pace of the game. Awe of the fun factor can, unfortunately, turn into frustration after several days of gameplay. The meta game is very unbalanced at the moment which is not a huge problem for most MOBAs considering the large roster of choices most have. Awesomenauts doesn't have that luxury and it becomes an issue when at least 5 of the characters aren't worth playing at higher levels. The game clearly needs fairly constant tweaking as with most MOBAs but it's a great way to pass the time and to take a break from work.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Awesomenauts is a 2D MOBA set in space! You'll be playing 3 VS 3 and trying to destroy the opposing teams 'Nauts, Towers and Core, which will results in you winning. Hopefully. That's the plan anyway.Due to it's unique cartoony art style as well as it's complex elements of strategy Awesomenauts is a great way to get into the MOBA genre. It has a very diverse range of characters to play as (which have all been very well voice acted and have their own theme tunes) and several maps which differ greatly due to one feature in each that shake up the gameplay hugely.Do remember that as a MOBA, this game still does has a fairly steep learning curve due to other players not sucking as much as you do. But if you persevere and learn the game, it can get incredibly fun! Awesome game!

content:
Posted: January 18, 2015
												This cartoony, beautiful, hilarious, enraging MOBA is definately one of the most addicting games I've ever played. Even if you normally despise MOBAs like League of Legends (which I'm not very fond of), you'll still have a blast playing as the space heroes otherwise known as the Awesomenauts.The Steam page and trailer makes it seem so much more idiotic than the game actually is (even though the music is freaking awesome) and it doesn't show all that the game is about. It's a 2D platformer with many different characters to choose from (and more are on the way), where your team of 3 has one goal, to destroy the enemy's base. Every character has their main attack and three special abilities, and you can upgrade these abilities by collecting the currency, solar, from destroying turrets, killing enemy Awesomenauts, killing creeps or minions, or by finding and collecting the ones on the map. Its a ton of fun with a lot of variety and will keep you entertained for hours.Overall, I think that anyone who is interested in this game should go out and buy it, and tell two of your friends to do the same, because its a lot more fun when you have other people to play with.

content:
Posted: October 8, 2013
												Awesomenauts will always be very special to me, played this game over the last 4 years and now I am proud to say I can recommend this game more than ever, with the addition of the Level-Editor.Before the recent Patch 3.5, Awesomenauts used to just be a great, but also very niche game. Not many players were interested in sticking around with a fun, but casual 2D 3v3 MOBA. And while a much older patch brought us custom matches, you were still very limited to just a MOBA mode & Team Death Match on a semi-custom map. But now with an awesome Level-Editor, which is easy to get started and has enough complexity to be very creative with, plus additional wacky custom games settings; You can now play Smash-Brothers, Horde Mode, single player maps, or just a custom made map for the default MOBA mode. Links to most unique mods & maps are at the bottom of the review Mind you the Level-Editor only has been released a few weeks ago in beta. It has since than been improved and we already saw a wide range of mods, so we will see more and better stuff coming, which is very exciting.Although the default multiplayer isn't the main attraction of this game anymore, it is worth mentioning that this is the only game I know, which is a 2D MOBA. Since its launch on Steam in 2012, 21 new characters were added to the game (29 total), 9 of them being distributed over 2 DLCs. There is no other pay2win aspect to the game. Currently 4 maps are in an online rotation, accessible by every player and matches that are 10 to 20 minutes long. It's stillv ery simular to a MOBA, you destroy turrents on 2 lanes and fight for map control. But the fighting dynamic is much more different as it is very easy to escape a fight as it is equally easy to burst down a player, with combined forces. Plattforming feels good, and with various different jumps per naut adds another layer of deapth. However, with not too many people playing, getting into Awesomenauts can be rather frustrating, as most people playing online have at least 100 hours under their belt.For old players coming back this MOBA mode has been changed a lot over the past years, so here is a quick rundown of all major changes in no particular order:-> XP system; In 2015 Ronimo decided to include the XP-system from Blizzard's ‘Heroes of the Storm’, while there were a good number of outspoken people hating on the change, it was mostly because it wasn't very balanced at launch. After fixing unbalances, the overall multiplayer experience hasn't changed negatively at all though. In fact, damage and health upgrade got a major nerf resulting in making versatile upgrade more viable and improving the game flow. Additionally, stalling games to be 10 minutes longer than they should have been, vanish since XP-system's inception. -> Galactron matchmaking update; The current matchmaking we have now is made by Ronimo themselves and replaced a default matchmaking service from Valve, improving the match quality overall, but sadly the effect was limited due to the size of the player base.  -> Late- join & Quick-start were removed; These two options were in the game originally, due to the game being seen very casually by the developers. As time passed by, the community wanted the multiplayer to be more serious and competitive. So now you can't join a game in progress anymore or quick-start an online game with anything but 6 playersThere is no doubt I am very biased at this point, with this many hours, investing in the Kickstarter and sticking with the game for so long. But do consider that these developers, Ronimo, have stuck with the game for nearly 5 years now and that all of these cool features can be yours for $10 or even less. Take care and remember if you ever in need of fun, just call the Awesomenauts. ;)As promised four maps & mods:Fun TDM map: 


The Sorona Express 
A Workshop Item for Awesomenauts
By: Ralphinator

			All aboard! This dangerous Deathmatch map is set on a run-away train crossing the deadly Sorona deserts! Only venture away from the train's relative safety at your own risk, as strong crosswinds might turn you into...		


Smash-Brothers Inspired map: 


No Items, Fox Only, Final Destination 
A Workshop Item for Awesomenauts
By: Blatoy

			 UPDATE: CONTAINS 3 MAP  This mod contains the 4 following maps:  Final destination  A basic deathmatch map based on Final Destination from SSB.		


Short single player experience: 


[Adventure map] The breach of omicron 
A Workshop Item for Awesomenauts
By: Blatoy

			In this 1 player adventure map you will discover many small planets that will prepare you for a final fight against a boss! The average duration of this adventure is 5 minutes.		


Single player, Co-op and 1v1 challenge map: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=866620852

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 11, 2015
												TL;DR is TOO LONG!Game fun. Bad grammar/writing. Should buy. Not convinced? Do research. And for crying out loud, the DLC characters are not over powered, they just require less skill to be good at. TL;DRAwesomenauts is a fantastic game, and worth a try.  Most of the reviews from 1,000+ hour guys that are bad are probably because they are salty about a nerf or the game "isn't like it used to be".  If something seems unfair, it's probably lack of knowledge or  lack of teamwork. (there are still moments that are unfair, but that usually isn't because of the game)A lot of the reviews complain about high ping having an advantage, but from my experience it can be either. Some matches  the high ping player just can't be touched, and other matches the lowest ping player is impossible to dodge, but most matches it's all just fine. Like any MOBA, most of the bad reviews from high hour players is probably from salt because their favorite character was nerfed, or the game, "Just isn't the same anymore".  I've rarely noticed being put into matches against people that are way better than me, but it usually comes down to the other team working as a team (not as well as a premade. There is quite a noticeable difference) while my team is doing whatever they want instead of working together. However, when a new season starts, you might run into the issue of super good players for a few days, but it is usually fine the rest of the season.MOBA community so there is that toxic "YOU GUYS SUCK I QUIT, NOOBS PLEASE KILL SELF." guy in about 25% of matches (he's the guy that runs into a 3v1 and then complains about his team sucking when everyone else is pushing a turret), but I usually encounter friendly people.  A lot of people I've come across are willing to teach people how to be better.I will say that some moments can  be unfair, but I haven't played a multiplayer game in my life that is 100% fair 100% of the time.  There will definitely be moments where you will say, "Dang, if we had this character on our team, this character on the other team wouldn't be 11-0 right now." but that encourages you to think of a solution with what you have.  There are some strategies that seem ridiculously broken at first, but if you can convince your team to work together, those strategies (from what I've encountered) will not hold up.Awesomenauts is a fantastic game and is my favorite MOBA.  I don't know if it has something to do with my childhood growing up with platformers, and my interest in strategy games, but I have a blast even when I go 0-6 on a day (I still rage, but I still have fun).  It has its flaws, some of which have existed for too long without cause, but like with life: If you focus on all the bad, you'll never have time to see the good and you'll end up in despair (except in this case missing out on a great game).

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Awesomenauts is a 2D-perspective MOBA with a lot of interesting character combinations and effective playstyles.  This game is best enjoyed with a team that is of similar skill level, although you can also join random teams for online battles.  Like all MOBAs, certain characters always seem to have balance issues, but overall the gameplay is fun and the team dynamics provide many hours of enjoyment.If you want to play any of the 4 expansion characters, I recommend buying the Power Pack, as it can usually be found at a better discount than buying the game and the expansion separately.  Costumes are purely cosmetic, but add some nice variety if you play a lot of Awesomenauts.

content:
Posted: January 28, 2015
												I have put many hours into this and purchased a lot of DLC. I supported the kickstarter Starstorm campaign also. It's just fantastic for a MOBA/PLATFORM/TURRET DFENCE game. Although that is what people call it I would ignore that description and say it's a multiplayer platform game. It reminds me of playing Smash Bros Mele many years ago on the gamecube. There is a learning curve, but it can be worked through. I'm league 3 now and it is challenging against other players, the main thing is to work as a team, even if the are strangers, knowing where you should be and where to defend or when to push is the key to winning. There's 4 levels (one more to come in the dlc), there's so many characters I've lost count. Each character has a jump/mele or shoot attack, and then two specials. Each can be upgraded to give either more damage or slowing effects etc. You can only pick three upgrades for each skill so you do have to think about it, although usually you'll find you stick to the same pattern that works for you. You have the light characters and heavy support types, something for everyones play style. The only criticisim is the matchmaking can sometimes be unfair, and put you against a team of three people, and are in higher league so the game ends quickly. The developers are however patching the matchmaking soon apparently.... They are very good and do live streams to reveal the patchs and what to be expected. I think this is a great game and no 'paywall' the dlc's that you buy are purely cosmetic, but I like to support the game so I do buy a lot of them (steam sales, get them for pennies). Anyway, I could go on but you should really just get the game now! Also go to their homepage and buy it via humble bundle you save a few penny and support them directly.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												This is a very fun and addicting game, but some things definetly need fixed. The 2 main ones are the connection problems from player to player and the penalty for leaving a game. Starting with the connction problems, even playing a custom game with friends, the connection cut out on a signal that we have no problemwith in any other game and it is much worse online. This takes me into the second problem, the penalty for "leaving a game". THis is a great feature to stop people from rage quitting or purposely trying to screw over teammates, but the problm is you also get the penalty for when you lose connection to a host, which makes you leave the game even if you don't want to. There have been games where i have gone 7/0 but lost connction so i got the penalty. Now I don't know about you, but that doesn't seem like something i would urposely leave. Overall, even with these problems i still reccomend the game and give it a 7/10. Just hope these problems are fixed.

												The more I seem to play this game the more I can no longer endure the beatiful mask it wears. Underneath seems to be slowly but surley seeping through showing all of it's disgusting true form. Here are a few of the facts you need to know:•	No dedicated servers, so prepare that bungus for lag.•	The skill based matchmaking system is almost non-existent as you can VS pros one game and potatoes another regardless of what league you’re in. •	Hitboxes? LOL what Hitboxes.•	Your “Team” is only as strong as your weakest link, and when they’re upset and quit, well say goodbye to any chance of you winning a 2 vs 3 battle. •	Teamwork , because you know it’s a team based game right? Well unless you have friends…. Go Zork yourself. •	So many characters so few maps BECAUSE THERES ONLY 4!!! I’m not sure what else to say, it used to be such a majestic little gem that I found and enjoyed playing. I now find myself not even getting frustrated by all the B.S anymore, all I feel now is disappointment.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2015
												A great concept, good sense of humor and an awesome diversity of characters... only too bad their online matching algorithm blows.I like this game, trust me, I do. Only every second match I try to play online our league 5-7 team gets matched against league 2-3 opponents, which results in us getting completely steamrolled. We can beat bots easily, have fun playing against each other, but we cannot seem to improve enough to close this huge skillgap.This makes every online match a gamble: will we get matched against (roughly) equally capable opponents? Or will the teams be so badly matched one of the sides gets inevitably steamrolled?If the second happens, prepare for a 10-20 minute waiting/suffering simulator where every strategy you try and every time you slip up even the slightest is immediately punished by much more experienced opponents who slowly make their way towards your base. In my opinion, not fun in the slightest.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2015
												If you're looking for something more casual than DOTA or LoL but along the same lines, then Awesomenauts is for you. Instead of 100+ "heroes", there are only 22 (with the new addition of Rocco). The game contains charming, 2D-animated artwork and some catchy music, though it might get repetitive after a while. It's alright though since you can turn the music off to play to your own beats. The community is relatively small, and that can be a good thing because making friends as future teammates occurs fairly often... if you're good lol. Try out a lot of the characters and one just might 'click' with you - others you have to look up guides (*coughAylacough*). Also, it's quite addicting once you get the hang of it. Now I understand how sports fans feel. Downsides: Since Ronimo is a small company, there are no dedicated servers. Every game is hosted by an individual player. A disconnect on your end counts as 'abandoning' a game which affects your leaderboard ranking, but to be honest I don't care at all about that. I'm all about casual fun. Leon's range is ridiculous, and the AI Station 404 is the least fun map to play (<- opinion). If you're into skins and such, you might be spending pretty pennies to look snazzy. I love my Bumble Gnaw skin though, it amuses me and was worth it when I bought it in a sale.All in all, I highly recommend this game.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2013
												So, I really like this game but I'll try to approach this from a reasonably neutral point of view.Awesomenauts is a crazy 2D MOBA where you must push the enemy back and destroy their base (Guarded by turrets). Pros:-There are a lot of characters to choose from, all varying in abilities. -Characters each have cute or funny little backstories, varying, strange, and quirky personalities Ex:       A gangster breakdancer frog who grew up in the ghetto.-Almost all the abilities are all extremely different and interact together in so many different ways. -Very well done balancing, and although you may think things are unbalanced when you start playing nauts, there is so much strategy involved in the game. -There are a bunch of unlockable sidegrades that may fit your playstyle perfectly. -There is a prestige system, once you get max level you have the option to reset your level and get a shiny medal beside your name. You'll keep all the characters you unlocked but all the sidegrades for them get relocked.-The music in this game is amazing and fits the theme perfectly. Theres special music for each character.Cons:-Although earlier I said balancing seems awesome the more you play, its absolutely crazy when you start out! Things'll be doing what seems like an insane amount of damage! You'll be screaming for nerfs (Probably)!-The community. There are some AMAZING people in the Awesomenauts community but thats like 3/10 people. Then maybe 5/10 people are batshit crazy and get angry super easily, troll, and basically take a dump on the sanctity of the game. 2/10 people though, are pretty apathetic to the whole thing. Silent mutes, the lot of them.-No dedicated servers. The servers use steam, so if steam crashes you wont be able to play. They're working on it.-Lag. A whole lot. You can minimize the lag by setting the matchmaking search to NOT worldwide, and then it becomes not too bad. Its usually not crazy rubberbanding or melee attacks hitting from across the map, just things like "I was behind that turret!" or "No way she has that much range!" or "THIS GAME IS ♥♥♥♥ING ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T!!!!11!11!".  -Requires teamwork. Some games (If you soloQ) you will get absolutely demolished by the enemy premade team, OR your team will just blow.-You have to put around 10-30 minutes per game, depending on whether its a total stomp or both teams are evenly matched. Awesomenauts is an awesome take on the MOBA genre (IMO) and should be enjoyed by everyone. If you think you might maybe enjoy Awesomenauts a tiny little bit, you should probably buy it. Its only $10.99 Candian, so if you have the money to buy this, you should. Remember to never rage, its just a game.NOTE: Its amazing fun to play solo, but a team makes this much more fun.

												This game is currently one of my favorite Steam games, it's very fun and addicting. Each character has their own unique abilities, strong-points, weaknesses, and personalities! content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												If you were to ask me my opinion of Awesomenauts before patch 2.13, I would have told you it is a fun game and I would give it a positive review. Now that patch 2.13 is here, Awesomenauts has a negative review. The main reason patch 2.13 is so awful is because it changes the game in a way that is not for the better. Before patch 2.13 games were won with teamwork, communication, strategy, and strategy. It was a completely legitimate strategy to farm creeps and not focus on kills if the other team is passive. Just out push the lane. Patch 2.13 changed all of that with the XP system. Because the XP system is about leveling up the whole team, the early game is no longer about pushing and out farming the opposition, it is now about early game team composition and trying to get kills before the other team kills you. Most of the games I have lost in this patch have been games where my team did not get the first kill. Early kills are more important now than ever before. They boost maximum health and maximum damage. Before patch 2.13, the other team could get kills but not all was lost, because you still had the same amount of health as they did, and you still did the same damage per skill based on their upgrades and your upgrades. Patch 2.13 tore away with those ideas because now the team has 1) more solar and 2) more health/base damage. This all leads to a snowball effect. The other team has even a less chance of winning against that team than before. If a player has a teammate that is not as strong of a player, the team is pretty much doomed. The snowball effect doesn't give players a reason to stay in the game either. There is still no penalty for leaving a game and players really don't have a reason to stay once the other team is a couple levels + above them. I've seen people feed and ragequit more than I have ever before. Please rethink the XP system. Don't just make this game free to play because of a decreased flow of players.
