content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												If you were to ask me my opinion of Awesomenauts before patch 2.13, I would have told you it is a fun game and I would give it a positive review. Now that patch 2.13 is here, Awesomenauts has a negative review. The main reason patch 2.13 is so awful is because it changes the game in a way that is not for the better. Before patch 2.13 games were won with teamwork, communication, strategy, and strategy. It was a completely legitimate strategy to farm creeps and not focus on kills if the other team is passive. Just out push the lane. Patch 2.13 changed all of that with the XP system. Because the XP system is about leveling up the whole team, the early game is no longer about pushing and out farming the opposition, it is now about early game team composition and trying to get kills before the other team kills you. Most of the games I have lost in this patch have been games where my team did not get the first kill. Early kills are more important now than ever before. They boost maximum health and maximum damage. Before patch 2.13, the other team could get kills but not all was lost, because you still had the same amount of health as they did, and you still did the same damage per skill based on their upgrades and your upgrades. Patch 2.13 tore away with those ideas because now the team has 1) more solar and 2) more health/base damage. This all leads to a snowball effect. The other team has even a less chance of winning against that team than before. If a player has a teammate that is not as strong of a player, the team is pretty much doomed. The snowball effect doesn't give players a reason to stay in the game either. There is still no penalty for leaving a game and players really don't have a reason to stay once the other team is a couple levels + above them. I've seen people feed and ragequit more than I have ever before. Please rethink the XP system. Don't just make this game free to play because of a decreased flow of players.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 7, 2015
												Awesomenauts is less of a game than it is a chat platform for angry pseudo role players. You'll see obnoxious quirky banter from players when they're winning and childish, racism infused fury when they're losing. So in any given game you get to watch both sides of this insufferable drama play out. Does this game attract these people, or does it create them? These are the mysteries of our time.Gameplay itself is ruined by laughable character balance made worse by the fact that there's no character draft. Your team chooses blind, the opposition chooses blind, and then whichever team has the better matchups takes the win. Great system for a MOBA, devs!

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												Here we go guys, awesomenauts, a fairly priced Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) , the game is quite simple, so a couple of coop vs. AI is enough for you to get the mechanics of the game. It has a REALLY memorable soundtrack, and the graphics are quite good, for a game of it's budget, I mean. As other MOBAs, it IS NOT pay to win.PROS+Really Great Soundtrack, seriously guys!+Pretty cheap, you can get it for sale for, like, 50 cents...+Fun to play with Friends+Up to 3 Local players (Same Machine, using controllers)CONS- DLC characters are kinda OP in my opinion- No dedicated server, the game is hosted by a random player who may have a low internet access or be playing on a toaster.- As there is no Dedicated Server, there is not a dedicated "Matchmaking system" similar to those on  League of legends and DOTA 2, since some players start losing on purpose after every season to get low ranks and pwn noobs and are left unharmed, it can make you really angry, but does not affect the overall game experience (Credits to the user: "Asparagus?")-It is really fun to play with friends vs. foes, but not quite so to play solo online, matchmaked with 2 othersOVERALL THOUGHTSThe Game is quite funny and Cheap.Price: 100Soundtrack: 100Offline Play: 95Online play 80Graphics: 90Gameplay: 95Wich brings us a total of: 93,3/100I hope this review will be helpfull, so please feedback me for errors and stuff, but be nice, since it is my first review on steam :v,   Don't Forget to upvote it if you liked this and wants me to review other games.

content:
Posted: July 10, 2016
												A 80s cartoon vibe made Awesomenauts feel different and unique from all of the other MOBAs on Steam. That used to be the case. Patch after patch modified and stripped the game of its charm, leaving it a shell of its former self. The developers don't care about the fans and haven't for over a year. They fail to listen to complaints. Original characters were patched, nerfed and modified to the point that they are now unplayable. Everything has been cast aside in favor of adding new characters. The match system unfairly pairs players and prevents them from enjoying a match with people similarly leveled. Through all of this change, the only people left playing this game are ones who started playing in the past year. They don't know what the game was once like.Save your money and buy something else.

Posted: October 1, 2015
												I played this game when it first came out. It was a bit of fun and a slightly different concept. Online games were good as long as the lag wasn't too bad. They kept adding new characters which made it interesting.Recently I started playing it again after not playing for some time. I have to say the game seems incredibly imbalanced now, which is really frustrating. It does not make for a good experience. There are more characters to play, which is a positive, but there are also too many changes from the original version that make some characters really weak compared to others such that it is an imbalanced game.Additionally, you don't know what characters the other team will play in an online match; so if you happen to end up playing against a team with a tank and a healer, you're virtually doomed (and cannot counter by choosing a healer or tank for your own team in advance).Overall it's a bit of a fun game, but just recently the imbalanced aspects have really gotten to me that I have lost enjoyment in it. It's a fun game, but I have to say: be prepared for easy deaths.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2015
I used to play this game a lot before, but not so much anymore. I'll give you a few pros and cons. - Pros - 1. Funny/comical game. In-game quotes and lines are well-made and just by playing a couple of different characters like for example Leon Chameleon with his serious but still funny lines and then playing Froggy G and hearing him talk about "your mama" makes you very statisfied.2. Ranking system not too advanced, and works quite well. The ranking system is easy to understand from 1-9 and basicaly anyone in the world would understand it by just looking at it. - Cons - 1. Not very fun without friends. I had tons of fun with my friends playing this game, but after them playing it less and less, it kinda faded out for me too, I was bored of matching up with others and would rather just enjoy playing with friends, maybe it's just me. But I feel like this game factors a lot by if you got friends or na.2. Depends more on co-operative play, and not individual skill. Now don't get me wrong, I love co-operative games, I play tons of them, from CS:GO to League of Legends, but this game isn't the same I feel.I feel the way that games like these should depends more on individual skill and less on team-play because it's harder to communicate properly in this game (with no voice chat/good team chat).Thank you for reading this review, please give it a thumbs up or thumbs down depending on how you felt about the review, you can always comment down below and tell me what I can do better in the future! ^^

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2014
												This is a dota-like 3v3 2d-side scroller. Only game of the genre, and it is also well executed.The good:The styling and theming is incredibly top-notch. The character theming is good enough to rival pre-hatfest TF2.All the different Awesomenauts are quite different from eachother, and while the balancing is never perfect, it is alright, considering the nature of the genre.Seriously, this is a 2d arena game where you have different moves at your disposal, and due to the size of the character pool, very few fights are ever going to be the same.High skill ceiling. You will see many people with many hundreds of hours put in this game. They are continuing to improve.The neutral:It is highly recommended that you get a friend or two to play with. Solo queueing is still completely viable and you can do great things, but friends will absolutely improve your experience. Lone wolves will get less enjoyment out of this game, social gamers will get more.The bad:No dedicated servers. Laggy hitboxes are a problem. If you hit somebody on your screen, it's pretty much guaranteed to be a hit, which also means that on the person's screen who is 120ms away from you means that it looks like they dodged it but they didn't. With skill, you can just try to anticipate 120ms away with your dodging, but this is just coming to terms with a real problem.Matchmaking can be fairly tricky. It has significantly improved in 2014, since I last played in 2012. At its worst, it's usually a stomp fest of a premade-3 vs a team of scrubby solo's, but as of late, I've had more fair matchups than not.Summary: A low-cost multiplayer arena title that is revolutionary and cool, but has a couple large mountains to climb that prevent it from being great.

I don't think it even matters if it's flawed or missing a thing or two, since devs so far delivered most of their promises and I know they'll keep delivering - at least till new matchmaking will come out.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												Fun while it lasts.Suffers the same problem most team based moba games, you either need to play it with friends or pray that you get into a decent team that knows how not to feed the enemy team. However, unlike most moba games, there is little to do with builds, item buying and order of things and more with pure skill and with just having two lanes at most, it's hard not to play as a part of the team even when you are "lone wolfing".I do wish ronimo did more maintenance on the game rather than just keep giving new characters, there are a lot of performance, server and matchmaking issues that need to be resolved. The fact that there is no pre-game lobby is also quite annoying and again makes careful strategising, preparation and team work pointless as most people go for carry characters rather than support making almost 70% of matches with random people have a whole team of lone wolfs.Simplicity of this game will draw in more people into more competitive scene of DOTA and LOL as most people do not get overwhelmed by the amount of things, items, characters, strategies they need to learn but instead learn basics of moba games and prepare for those bigger ones.Toxicity in awesomenauts still exists like in all other competitive games, but most of the times it's either trolling or easy to ignore as it is so hard to play this game and not be somewhat helpful. No one will be yelling at you for playing support and not placing wards, or not staying on your lane, or not joining in on a gank. You will however get flak for feeding and going afk, but if you do you probably deserve it :DAll in all the game is not without its problems, technical and mechanical, but because it's easy to learn, easy to jump into (as if you dc you get replaced by bots until someone takes up your space), you will get a guaranteed kill or 10 every game almost which gives you massive amounts of satisfaction. Big fights happen constantly, always keeping you on your toes and not making you feel like you are just a gear in a mechanism for the first 10 minutes like in games like DOTA - farm creeps, get to tower, retreat, farm creeps, get to tower... In conclusion the game has colourful graphics, great voice acting from some of the biggest youtube celebrities  and fluid controls (wouldn't recommend playing using controller though)

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
 Awesomenauts Awesomenauts is probably the first Platformer MOBA. Visual: 9/10 Awesomenauts is a beautiful game with a cool cartoon art-style. You kind of forget how beautiful the art-style is after playing for a number of hours, which is the sole reason I didn't give it a 10/10. Sound 9/10 Awesomenauts has a great soundtrack. The reason for this is the fact that every character ( currently 21 characters.) has a theme song, and a song for getting a killing spree with them. This keeps the game fresh by surprising you with new music for the first 20 hours of gametime. Gameplay: 10/10 Awesomenauts is a MOBA at heart, but has drastically changed the gameplay by switching the games viewpoint to a sidescrolling perspective as well as cutting down on the amount of players in-game (from 5v5 to 3v3.). The game also has 21 characters (as of the sixth of may 2015.) that you can play.The shop system has also been changed from the traditional system to a loadout system. The loadout system lets you choose 9 items before the game starts. They will be available for purchase once the game starts. This system makes it easier for players to determine what they want to do, and makes it impossible to counter people by buying what you need for a specific problem.This game is by no means a hardcore game, but it will still give you many hours of enjoyment if you aren't a tryhard winner. DLC: 8/10 The game has quite alot of skins which I won't go into detail about since it's purely cosmetic, however there is one DLC pack called Starstorm that introduces five new characters. This is usually not a problem, however they are still updating the DLC with characters which could lead to some balancing issues. The DLC is by no means gamebreaking at the moment, but the possibility of it becoming gamebreaking is there so be weary of it. Time/Money: 10/10 If you are interested in the MOBA genre but find it to hostile to join, then this is your game. I have put down over 100 hours of gameplay on this game, without feeling the need to spend a single penny (beside buying the game ofcourse.).

content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												When I bought this game, I honestly didn't expect to enjoy it as much as I have. Awesomenauts combines light MOBA mechanics and action platforming nicely. The entire feel of the game is less hostile than other games that incorporate MOBA mechanics, simply because it plays much differently and has very few meta-game aspects. The gameplay is responsive, skill based, and the characters are designed so that they all have their own unique playstyle. Awesomenauts delivers a unique experience regarding the action platformer genre, plus an incredible art style and hilarious voiceovers.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												When you have a good connection, and no-one quits, this is an amazing game, genuinely one of my favourite games ever; great music, unique characters, fairly easy to pick up (easier than traditional MOBAs) yet very challenging at higher leagues. When the teams are balanced (which when you have a good connection, it is not uncommon) you can have a lot of fun, and it gets very competitive but usually still light-hearted. However. Lag can make it almost unplayable, with enemy abilitys hitting you out of no-where and you dying after you clearly got out, and this happens more often than it should. The game does not have a very large player base, so it struggles to match you up, and you will often join games half way through because someone rage quit.In conclusion, if you get annoyed quickly with bad matchmaking, this game probably isn't for you. However if you can soldier through the bad games, this game  is definitely worth it.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												I am really impressed with the direction ubisoft took with this game. Being the first game developed in Minsk, Belarus by a Eastern Orthodox female orphanage in 1913, the graphics exceeded the standard of its time.  Some astronomers consider this game to have been the reason for the economic boom in West Africa for the following 40 years.  The gameplay is very intricate.  This game is historically recognized as the first 2nd person hack-and-slash dungeon crawler taking place during the Shang dynasty in ancient Australia to incorporate 7-player split screen gameplay.  Unfortunately, the games sales plummeted due to Howard Taft's embargo of 1772, where the shipping of the game was banned in Latin America, Hong Kong and the Zambian empire.  Hopefully our generation and game review websites such as Zynga will recognize the innovation this game provided.  10/10.

number of helpful: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 27, 2015
												This game has quite a number of issues. First there’s the lag. Because there are no dedicated servers, you can very easily manipulate your ping for in game advantage. I have a ping of 100 with only awesomenauts open, but when I open chrome and listen to music off YouTube, my ping jumps to around 300. Many players will manipulate their ping off and on throughout a match, changing it for when they need it. It doesn’t matter why the lag occurs, all that matters is that it destroys the gaming experience. Second, the game has a broken late join and abandoning system. Leaving a match incurs a penalty in the games leader board system, and you don’t gain as much experience from the next match. This has never discouraged anyone from ragequitting. If a match is not full (3v3) the game will hot seat someone in wherever they are needed. While that seems great, it’s a completely ineffective system of preventing people from leaving and an unbalancing effect of late joins. Almost every match I have ever played in this game has had at least one disconnect. When a new player joins, they get the average amount of ingame money (solar) to buy upgrades, so even if you’re stomping the other team they will join in with as much as the winning team. When a new person joins in with as much solar as you, they get the chance to build their upgrades around your team, while you have already picked your general build. I have played a good number of games where the other team is losing badly so they all ragequit, only to be replaced by a full team of new players who all have as much solar as us, as well as the advantage of being able to build to counter our players, while we’re all set up for a different match entirely. Furthermore, if you’re the host of match, you can force everyone in match to quit by shutting off your internet. This happens almost every time the host is doing badly. And yes, you lose “league points” when the host forces you to disconnect. You may even join a game that a player has quit seconds before the base is destroyed and the game is over with a defeat for you (which you will lose ranking for).The developers of this game are truly evil. You can purchase skins for the game, which are overpriced. Most games charge more than a dollar for skins, because they’re incredibly easy to design and they don’t change game play. Most of Ronimo’s skins are between 2.99 and 7.99.  Two skins are as much as the game was originally. A pack of skins is 15 dollars, which is 5 dollars more then the game. That is simply not ok. They also came out with an expansion for the game almost two years ago, for around 7 dollars. It unlocked (at the time) one character. Now it provides more characters, and they’re by far the  best characters in the game. However they sit behind a pay wall for almost the same price as the original game. This is disheartening to consumer, but forgivable if the game was balanced and had dedicated servers. But the final piece of the pie is that the expansion was crowd funded. They crowd funded an expansion, that when released only included one character.  They said quote “We want to take Awesomenauts to the next level, with characters, features, a new map, and more! Join us to make this happen!” Many of these features are yet to arrive. 7,496 backers pledged $345,835 to help bring this project to life. That’s more money than many people make in 5 years of work. For an expansion. Of a game that already came out. The expansion added features that should have been free and come with updates. I don’t recommend this game, and I loathe myself for giving it 400+ hours, and even writing review.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2016
												I truly love this game, and I think if it looks appealing to you then you should give a try. It's pretty disheartening to see people with 1k+ hours throwing out bad reviews. They complain about the toxicity like its not to be expected from any online game then cry about it dying when they're the ones actively killing it. Most of these players probably lost to some toxic player who called them a doodoo head and rushed here to wring out their tears in a steam review. Ronimo is a very interactive company which is a great thing, but they've inadvertently created the most entitled, crybaby communities out there.Awesomenauts is a wonderful game. Everything about it is incredibly charming from the top tier art to the godlike music. There's a big cast of characters each with their own unique abilities, upgrades, and a baller theme song. The gameplay is neat-o. Smashing nerds with a giant anchor weilded by an armored squid never gets less satisfying.Listing any flaws would be redundant considering there are plenty of other reviews that exist for nothing more than to tell you all about them. However I will say that a lot of them can be avoided by doing the following:-getting good.-growing the f*** up. (Remember... it's just a game!!!)the peer to peer thing is an undeniable problem but nothing is going to be done about that unless this game somehow hits it big.  In my experience it's not a 24/7 issue like people make it out to be.Anywho, I love this game and I sincerely appreciate the work that ronimo has put into it for all these years. I would really hate to see it die so I HIGHLY encourage anyone who is interested to give it a go.yeh.

I still enjoy it with all these problems and hopefully someday it wll reach its full potential. 8/10 Vive la Chameleon.

												9/10!Awesomenauts is Awesome!3v3 side scroll Moba game with great 2D graphics and effects, perfect for old-school side scrolling battle fans!you control 1 character that have unique skills for each of them, then you collect solar coins which is in-game currency to upgrade that skills to be more damaging, more power, less cooldowns, etc, you can setup your build before each battles to suit what playstyle you wants, nuker? support? or Tanks... and you battles with 2 more allies on your side, which have different abilities characters, you fight with other 3 characters that have different skills, and playstyles.the objective of this game is to destroy enemy's Drillcore which is in the deepest part of their base, and defended by turrets, droids spawns each couples of second to help you destroy those turrets, and don't forget that the enemies also have people to defend their turrets, so you have to balance between defending and attacking to win the gamethe only downside of this game is its connection-based server, if the host have bad connection, you'll get massive lag in the battles, but the mechanics of the game can migrate server based on the best connection player in-game, so it doesnt really matters much on the long rundefinitely must have!! :)

content:

												Really fun game. You'll need to know what type of skills to bring to the field. As you become more experienced with the game, you'll eventually know what type of skills are most effective for your specific character. This game also tests your skill in platforming like how to dodge enemy attacks, escape from them or chase after them. When you're playing online, a lot of teamwork is required to beat the other team. If you're looking for a fun online experience, Awesomenauts is definitely worth checking out.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 25, 2013
												Awesomenauts is a cheap, good value and very enjoyable game. Definitely made for cross platform, playing it in big screen with a controller or with a mouse and keyboard feels just as intuitive, while it is a MOBA (Multiplayer online battle arena) game, a single game session doesn't feel as lengthy as for example DOTA2. I have had both short and long game play sessions. The format of game play is 3 versus 3 of either 'bots' (AI controlled) and humans or all human players. For any DOTA player's; there is no real jungling or item shop concept; however, ganking and stealthy play or killing an occasional stronger critter for a decent reward is possible on some maps. Players level up automatically by obtaining currency rather then experience and can use said experience to buy 'skills'.Gameplay feels intuitive, quick to grasp and the game is quick off the bat with some action. It may not always feel perfectly balanced, but if you are playing without friends in random games you may be in a group of hero's that overlap in roles, thus underperforming against well balanced groups. I've never found it really troublesome, you can always switch your hero in the midst of a game if you i.e. need a more damage oriented hero instead of support.With it's drop in and drop out game play you aren''t a permanent man down like in DOTA 2 when a player leaves, AI will replace a player until a new one joins. From my experience the game's online experience has been stable; however, online play sessions are hosted via another player so if your experiecing lag its a good bet it is on the host's end rather then the game's or the developer's end.Mix some RPG , action, side scrolling platform elements with moba game play wrapped in a neatly looking 2D graphical engine and you get Awesomenauts, a humor packed arcade-MOBA game.Try it yourself, definitely worth the 10'er and if you can pick it up on sale, even better.Lastly I'd like to say it is very doable to play it on split screen at home with a friend if you have multiple controllers to hook up to your PC. Of course; lan and multiplayer works too!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2012
												Awesomenauts is a suitably awesome DotA style game but with 2 major differences, it is also a 2D platformer and is very easy to get into.Most DotA style games available at the moment are incredibly similar, with the exception of Smite which is taken from a 3rd person perspective. Awesomenauts is a side-scrolling game which allows for new ways to play the genre. Platforming feels great and gives new opportunities for escape and ambush situations which add to the intensity of the game.I also love the art style, which is very important to me because it can decide whether or not I play a game. It's cartoony, clear and fun and the characters are original and hilarious. The soundtrack is amazing and vast with each character in the game getting it's own theme and killing spree music.Awesomenauts is also easy to start playing. It isn't as complicated as other DotA games but still manages to have a high skill-ceiling which can be seen in the games competitive scene.Not only is it great fun but it is still growing! Since it's release on PC, Awesomenauts has recieved frequent updates with new characters, maps and features and as a result of its successful Kickstarter campaign, the game will be getting an expansion which will see even more stuff coming out throughout next year.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2013
												I've decided I should update my review with my feelings as time has progressed.Maybe it is unfair to compare this to DotA, but the competitive moba nature lends to it well.  While the game is a lot more casual in nature, such that I feel like I can quit in the middle of the game if I need to, and that I do not need to invest as much energy or time to be competent in it, I find myself enjoying the game less.  In fact, as time has progressed, I feel I get much more frustrated with my games in Awesomenauts.  This is often due to matchmaking, or what I perceived as questionable balance.The matchmaking of the game is quit frustrating.  I don't know if there' s anything that can be done to improve this, as the player base is relatively small.  But as it is, when you get matched up against a premade team of excellent players, it can often feel like there's nothing you can do to combat the opposition.  And due to the small player base, this can happen often, and multiple times in a row, especially once you start getting to around tier 3.  I question the balance and design decisions of some characters.  The only character I feel with certainty is unbalanced is Lonestar, for his ability to take out towers singlehandedly, and with relatively little farm.  His bull gives him ridiculous pushing power, and his dynamite and high dps means he can pick at a tower more efficiently than most.  I feel like if my team is not completely dominating or the opposing Lonestar is not incompetent, then we'll stand to lose simply due to his pushing and anti-pushing power.  Even with a kill advantage this can be a problem.  That being said, a lot of other characters can be very frustrating to deal with, even if they are balanced.  Gnaws plants have a lot of hit points and regenerate health.  Skolldir can get an almost guaranteed kill if he manages to get within throwing range on some maps.  Froggy G can deal crap loads of damage, has quick mobility, escape mechanisms, and an ability that can make him deadly to attack.All in all, I want the community to grow, and I hope the developers consider revisiting the skills heroes and the mechanics of the game.  They do make balancing changes, so I do hope the game improves, especially with the Starstorm expansion in development.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2012
												Awesomenauts is a 2D MOBA (like League of Legends or DOTA 2, where you have to destroy turrets and a base) that focuses heavily on platforming (for escaping and attacking). There's a wide range of characters (with more being added) and each character has the choice of upgrades they can buy in-game, opening up plenty of builds to try out. And unlike other MOBAs, there's little to no learning curve. As you play more, you level up, unlocking more characters and upgrades. Even though only being able to start with three characters seems limiting, it makes it easy to jump in without having to do character/mechanic research (the short tutorial is enough) or be intimidated by choices. I'd say the only bad thing about this game is the fact that there are limited maps (four at the moment), but they're varied enough that I often don't think about it. Overall, it's a MOBA that isn't too complicated but still fun to play, appealing to both casual and hardcore gamers of the genre alike. I'd buy it if you're interested in the genre but too afraid to devote yourself to learning it. And if you're a familiar, you'll feel right at home while still having different characters and mechanics to learn.

content:

												This game is amazing. Great graphics, amazing soundtrack, unique characters, full player input. I admit, the lag and matchmaking are a problem but you have to accept lag as it is since the playerbase is small and if you're losing badly just quit. Ragequiting isn't a shameful act. It's there for a reason. This game has fast paced action, loads of humour and has a lot of character. It also stands out from other mobas because it takes place in space so all the characters don't have to be mages, knights, archers and anthros. Extremly fun game with a great community. A must buy.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 14, 2014
												It's a pretty awesome dota-style game, and one of the few 2-D games of this type. Normally you will have 3 turrets to defend, and one base to defend from enemy attacks. The respawn time is pretty fast, and feeding doesn't seem to be as much of a big deal as it is in other games of this type, making this game fairly new-player friendly. The other team may be way better at player kills, but the winning team seems to usually be the one that isn't afraid to die now and then to target enemy turrets. The game itself is fun to play, but it can get complicated with a plethora of upgrade options, three of which for each category you will need to pick before the match starts in a limited amount of time. To get good at this game, you will want to be familiar with the characters and upgrades that you want to use long before the match starts, adding a layer of depth to the game that may be a bit daunting to new players. Overall, I'd recommend playing this game with friends. Splitscreen mode actually allows you to play on the same computer if you want to, which is rare in the world of PC gaming. The game is mostly balanced after many hours of hardwork from the developers. I do think that some characters are better than others, but the game is constantly being improved. I have yet to see a win-lose record in the game, and the game focuses more on your overall rank than anything else, which somehow makes you feel less pressure if you don't really care about being the top rank. This game is fun, and definitely worth playing with friends.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												Awesomenauts is a curious mix of MOBA / DOTA-like and platformer. Requiring more twitch skill than last-hitting ability or proper build order, this is a game in two worlds.The art style is cartoony, specifically designed to invoke the feelings of old saturday morning cartoons like Ren & Stimpy or Tom & Jerry. Slapstick humor is certainly prevalent all around and many of the character's lines are referrential; they even have a few big name internet celebrities doing character voices (TB, Jess Cox, dodger, and Myndflame are the ones i know of). Overall the game is fairly pretty with interesting variations between the maps.The game is very easy to get into as you level up incredibly quickly and early on most people don't know what they're doing, so you won't need anything but some good ol' Mario skill and common sense to get started, though i do reccommend playing practice mode first.The gameplay is tight and responsive, though it could be a teeny bit quicker on the uptake. There is a drastic problem though; the game De-syncs ALL THE TIME. I have had numerous games where I was kicked due to severe lag and sync problems due to low ping. EDIT: the game is hosted peer-to-peer. Do not play without serious antivirus software and firewalls or you could possibly get hacked. The game also has no games lobby of any sort, automatically searching for a game to get you in. This exacerbates the low-ping problem as you have no idea how god the host of the game is, and it's very reluctant to switch hosts. This problem will get you unfair kills and unfairly killed time and time again. Ronimo, if I have any reccomendation, fix this issue BEFORE releasing starstorm fully. However, if you can get past that, there's a surprising amount of depth to the game. Each character plays very differently despite having only 2 abilities and a special jump. The characters all also have their own items, and you get to customize which items are available to buy at the shop, which is where a great deal of the non-twitch skill comes in. Setting up proper builds is daunting, so i suggest taking an online build to begin with, then working on your own from the principles you see there.EDIT:A lot of people hav e complaints about the community in the game. For me and my under 20 hours at low levels, I have seen a few complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s and one feeder, but overall people are quiet and react as you'd expect a normal person to; upset when losing (but not blaming the team except for the feeder, who was literally doing nothing so i don't blame him.), happy when winning (but only a few♥♥♥♥♥♥♥who spam the taunt button or act all superior when they win at league 9 [of 9]) and talking to the team only to ask for help defending a turret or something. I give it a community toxicity rating (with 1 being friendly and helpful while 10 being DOTA 2 or the youtube comments section.) of 6. More bad than good, but acceptable if you're patient and level-headed.Overall, the game is funny, can be challenging, has great depth, but at the same time still feels like a beta test sometimes. As for starstorm, I don't have it and am reluctant to pay money for extra characters in any game, despite it being a pretty cheap character pack. One final thing; this is a paid game with microtransactions. On the other hand, it's only cosmetic (unless you count starstorm which also has an extra map coming and AI editor) so you decide if that's fair.If you like platformers and competitive games and don't mind a bit of glitchiness and don't have a problem with the fact that if you want totalbiscuit Vinne you've gotta shell out extra real cash, The game comes recommended. I play it a ton and have enjoyed my time immensely. Using Nerdcubed's 1-3 rating system; I give awesomenauts a 2. This is without a doubt not a shining recommendation; the game has a laundry list of problems some of which can be fixed while others are the result of the good ol' internet community. I personally picked it up for 99 cents but I wouldn't have paid much more for it. Certainly not 10 dollars.

content:
Posted: March 17, 2014
												Note the date of this review before reading it: March 17, 2014.A lot of people have complained about problems in this game, which primarily include matchmaking, lag, and balance issues.Matchmaking - Yes, matchmaking is an enormous problem. You could very easily be queued up against people that have logged 200+ hours your first game. You could also be thrown into a one-sided game where the enemy is already sitting in your base. Why this is, not a lot of people know. You are ranked leagues in this game, and matchmaking tries to find a game that has people in it that average out to be in a league that is the same as yours or adjacent to it. Now this seems ideal, but if you were league 6, and league 1 player could queue up with a league 9 player and you could face them in a match. This does happen sometimes, and the problem certainly needs to be addressed.Lag - Some hosts are very bad, and it makes competitive play obsolete in some cases. People overexaggerate this issue, however. All it normally does is result in an ability hitting you just barely outside of the range that it normally would.Balance - Patches, however infrequent, have made the whole balance issue a lot better. Some characters are a lot easier to master and are better on some maps than others, but it all really does come down to skill. I've seen some of the "worst characters" carry teams.These problems aside, I think the game is really fun. Excellent soundtrack, mostly a good community, and a neat gimmick to thrown into the MOBA genre. There aren't many characters yet, and none have been added in the 5 months I've been playing. If you get bored in MOBAs playing the same character, this game is NOT for you. However, if you want a relaxing little Saturday afternoon brawler MOBA to play with your friends, pick it up. It's addicting and fresh.

												This is a great game! But it’s a hard one to recommend. Let me explain. It’s a 2-D MOBA. Yeah, you know, a MOBA like Dota or League of Legends. 												This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2D platformer and an MOBA, and does it with style.  I found myself enjoying characters that I wouldn't enjoy in other MOBA games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, I now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game. As for the audio, the voice acting is grin-worthy, with music and effects adding to the 80's cartoon vibe.

content:
Posted: March 27, 2016
												This game is certainly not what it used to be. I took a long hiatus from this game (I stopped some time after Starstorm came out, likely before 2.13) but I was very impressed at the time with it. It was essentially a MOBA for dummies, and I liked it. I really did. Once I returned, though, things had changed. Drastically. And certainly not for the better. Many others have said this, but I can corroborate that this game punishes you on a ridiculous level if you don't do exactly what you're supposed to. Premade groups demolish pretty much anybody against them, making solo play near impossible. Some of the characters snowball way too fast and are just plain broken (I don't think I've ever played in a game that didn't have someone playing Rocco). Because of this, you essentially can't play most of the characters. Slower build characters are impossible to play, because by the time you're ready to get going, the other team's finished with their items. Poor team comps don't even come close to standing a chance. There's also no real comeback ability, due the the snowballing characteristic I've mentioned earlier. The game's basically over just a few minutes in because someone died a couple times already. Poor balancing, impossible solo play, and horrible punishing earns this game a very disgruntled dislike. Pre-2.13, this game was a blast. Now, I can't recommend it at all. Ronimo, you had a good thing going, and you blew it. You really did.

												You control a single “AwesomeNaut” online in a team of 3 against 3. The level is a side-scrolling platformer where you have to bust through enemy turrets and eventually destroy the base, taking out many minions and other AwesomeNauts along the way. As you play a single game your character levels up and you can upgrade their abilities. Each AwesomeNaut has a unique series of abilities and as you level up your profile, you unlock more AwesomeNauts, abilities and features. It was a fun experience, and I would definitely buy it on special if it weren’t for the single fact that I would forget about it after a week. Though if I had any friends (at all) to play with, I’m sure it would be more fun, especially when you devise particular winning strategies and combinations.Definitely worth a gander and if you're into DOTA, HONE or LOL. It's also worth the price.For full review, visit:http://icarusreviews.net/2012/11/18/bwbf-awesomenauts/

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 11, 2013
												Awesomenauts is a very interesting and new take on the MOBA genre. Instead of going into a mythical/fantasy setting, the game is set into the very very distant future, where robots have anger issues, aliens surf around and stab you in the back and talk in pop culture references and '80s movie quotes and technology is so advanced that it became sentient and created two factions to fight each other for the rarest material in the universe, little sparkly cubes called "Solar".The art style and music is inspired by the american cartoons of the '80s.The game currently features a cast of 16 (more to come soon) very interesting characters, each with their own unique abilities and ways of play and 4 maps to show off your skills in 3v3 battle arena mode (take down the turrets, take down the base, ????, profit).It's worth noting that currently, there are a lot of balance issues, poor matchmaking that might put veteran players and new player in the same game (eventually leading to the rage quit of some players and leaving you with AI controlled bots, which are pretty good, most of the time), eventual laggy games and the leaderboards are a bit broken.Unlike other MOBAs, Awesomenauts is a more casual game, with fast paced gameplay, the focus of the game being teamwork and fast reflexes. The majority of the community is pretty good and you'll be called mean things and asked to commit suicide way less then any other MOBA out there.The game has very different mechanics from other MOBAs, players having to combine strategy with lots of jumping/platforming and shooting. I highly recommend watching a few tutorials first or trying out Practice Mode on highest difficulty.It's worth nothing that you if you are the kind of player that likes to go solo, get high on the leaderboards and have highest stats, either this game is not for you, or you'll find it as being a serious challenge.Bottom line: I personally found this game very enjoyable most of the times, the characters really funny and cool looking, the music is a treat, the gameplay really fast and addicting and besides the balance and matchmaking issues, all you need is a couple of friends to form a team and jump online and a few learning tutorials.Awesome Game! *thumbs up*

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 11, 2013
WHY DON'T I RECOMMEND IT?I do not recommend it based on its development over time and focus on competitive play: Community too focused on competitve play; Sudden change from a nice gaming experience that welcomes all to an overly competitve game that punishes freedom of choice in the loadouts and ways of playing; The game itself and its development are too focused on competitions and tournaments nowadays, making the game unwelcoming to new, casual players.IF I DID, WHY WOULD I RECOMMEND IT?I would recommend it based on its gameplay and style: Excellent controls; Fun platforming; Big roster of characters with great voice acting; Constant updates with content, fixes and tweaks; Colorful graphics.SHOULD YOU/OTHER PEOPLE BUY IT?It depends on your answer to the following questions: Are you a competitive player? Are you not affected by a foul community? Do you have friends to play it with? Do you like MOBAs? Do you like sidescrollers? Do you like 80s and 90s cartoons?If you answered YES to 4 or more questions above, I suggest you try it for yourself when it goes on sale. It does not happen that often, but you can be sure that at least at Summer and Winter sales it will go for pretty cheap. Otherwise, as it is, I'd suggest you give it a pass.Is it fun? Is it frustrating?My original review was positive. I've been following this game for almost three years now, since its release on xbox 360. The game was much different then, and posed as a fun, casual alternative to more hardcore games like DOTA 2 or League of Legends. The sidescrolling aspect, plus the cartoony characters made it very lighthearted, and the community was very supportive and fun.That is mainly due to the fact the community was very small still, so you'd mostly find people who really enjoyed the game in the public matches. Playing it with friends was a blast. I bought more than 30 copies of the game for friends just because I enjoyed playing it with others so much. I could not stop playing it. So whenever a friend wanted to stop playing, I'd go find another, buy them a copy and continue playing with them and so on until I passed out from exhaustion.As the game grew, so did the community, and you suddenly began seeing a sudden change in the pacing of the matches. Players were hateful, spamming the chat with swear words and offensive comments. The matches themselves became overly competitive, and you'd be shunned by your team mates for not playing in a specific, "optimized" way.What I am the saddest about is the fact that the game encouraged experimenting, getting custom loadouts and just trying whatever felt like fun at the moment. As it became more competitive, it seemed like you were being punished by trying to steer away from the known effective combinations of power ups. And other players, both in your team as well as the opponents, would make sure to point your "mistakes" out.The matchmaking is a mess too. Most of my friends who recently started playing the game complained they were thrown in matches with overpowered charaters, but thruth is the opponents already knew the most effective loadouts and stuck to it, so my frinds were decimated by them. It is extremely frustrating not being able to experiment and discover things by yourself as the online aspect of the game (which is its mais focus anyway) is filled with unfriendly, over competitve people who simply cuss at you should you dare mention the word "casual".Closing wordsI resent the path the game took towards more of an "eSports" kind of approach. I spent so many hours (close to a thousand) and so much money in it too, with the kickstarter, the extra copies, all the DLC, several DLC packs for friends... all because I believed this game had a great potential to be some sort of party game focused on a more casual style. I feel a bit betrayed, and that clouds my perception of what the product is today. If you like competitve games and MOBAs, this is a nice alternative, and definitely the best 2D one you can find, based on my own opinion and experience. But with the history I have with this game, I simply cannot recommend it anymore, as it not only shattered my expectations, but it has been a source of much disappointment and grief.Take it or leave it, the final choice is up to you.Go there, save the day!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
												This game is very fun and easy to get into. You control one of about 20 awesomenauts in a 3v3 match where you have to push through lanes by defeating droids and turrets, all the way to the opponents base. You have tanks, pushers, healers, harassers, and so on so every kind of player will find at least one character they will like.Essentially, it's a 2D MOBA (think Dota and League of Legends) with a heavy emphasis on casual play, as well as co-op.The game is far from dead and is reasonably active, but most of the people playing it now have been at it for quite some time. So if you're new and you're going to play this at an odd time (like the middle of the night), matchmaking could place you in a very one-sided game. Though that should change for at least a week or two after a sale, when there's an influx of new players to balance out matchmaking.If you see this on sale, BUY IT. I guarantee you'll have a blast, especially if you're playing with friends. I'm personally picking up the Starstorm when it's next on sale.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Pros:+ The level and character design are funny, excelent. The character voices and personalities are really unique and filled with easter eggs.+ It is not completely unbalanced.+ Excellent when playing locally with your friends.Cons:- The online mode sucks. The matchmaking just throws you inside an already existing match. Thus, you can logout and return instantly to the same match, changing the character. Besides, it is possible that you start in a match that is finishing, what means insta-lose.- It is not really well balanced.- Lacks characters.- This game was "re-sold" and we had to kinda re-buy it. Basically, they added new features, changed the name to "Awesomenauts: Starstorm" and every character released after that was Starstorm exclusive.Review:+ Yes. I still recommend it. It is really good LOCALLY.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												Gameplay 9/10Fast paced 2D MOBA, easy to understand, hard to master. Has some competitive potential and there are a few tournaments. The controls are great and the game rewards skill and teamwork. The game has some small balance issues, but they are constantly working on in it. Graphics 8/10The cartoon graphics are really nice. The effects are ok, but they are polishing them. They got much better over time.Sound 10/10The music, the nauts' theme songs/lines and the sound effects in general are awesome.Matchmaking 7/10Well, this is the main issue of the game, but I don't think there's much to be done if the playerbase doesn't grow. There aren't enough online players in each region for good matchmaking and lag free games. However, some small improvements could be done, like creating the teams after the six players needed for a match are found. This way the best players won't end up in the same team. Also, a pre-game lobby where players could talk and decide what nauts they pick would be great.MiscSome characters are quite original, the theme songs and lines are funny. The game is constantly updated and improved. They are adding new features, new skins, new characters and a new map is planned. The community is pretty great and they've done some great things, like websites where you can check the leaderboards, upload and download replays or where you can check, create and share naut builds. They are also organizing tournaments from time to time.Anyway, I strongly recommend this game, it's one of my all time favourites.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2D platformer and an MOBA, and does it with style.  I found myself enjoying characters that I wouldn't enjoy in other MOBA games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, I now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game. As for the audio, the voice acting is grin-worthy, with music and effects adding to the 80's cartoon vibe.

												I enjoy Awesomenauts a lot for its light-hearted MOBA attitude, fun and responsive gameplay, Saturday Morning aesthetic, and music I can't ever seem to get tired of. Doesn't even come close to having any semblance of balance between all the characters, or arrangements thereof: Some teams just don't work, and some teams can't be beaten.But even through it all, it's missing the toxic atmosphere that comes with playing League of Legends, and for that it's worth uite a lot to me.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
												This game is very fun and easy to get into. You control one of about 20 awesomenauts in a 3v3 match where you have to push through lanes by defeating droids and turrets, all the way to the opponents base. You have tanks, pushers, healers, harassers, and so on so every kind of player will find at least one character they will like.Essentially, it's a 2D MOBA (think Dota and League of Legends) with a heavy emphasis on casual play, as well as co-op.The game is far from dead and is reasonably active, but most of the people playing it now have been at it for quite some time. So if you're new and you're going to play this at an odd time (like the middle of the night), matchmaking could place you in a very one-sided game. Though that should change for at least a week or two after a sale, when there's an influx of new players to balance out matchmaking.If you see this on sale, BUY IT. I guarantee you'll have a blast, especially if you're playing with friends. I'm personally picking up the Starstorm when it's next on sale.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												Gameplay 9/10Fast paced 2D MOBA, easy to understand, hard to master. Has some competitive potential and there are a few tournaments. The controls are great and the game rewards skill and teamwork. The game has some small balance issues, but they are constantly working on in it. Graphics 8/10The cartoon graphics are really nice. The effects are ok, but they are polishing them. They got much better over time.Sound 10/10The music, the nauts' theme songs/lines and the sound effects in general are awesome.Matchmaking 7/10Well, this is the main issue of the game, but I don't think there's much to be done if the playerbase doesn't grow. There aren't enough online players in each region for good matchmaking and lag free games. However, some small improvements could be done, like creating the teams after the six players needed for a match are found. This way the best players won't end up in the same team. Also, a pre-game lobby where players could talk and decide what nauts they pick would be great.MiscSome characters are quite original, the theme songs and lines are funny. The game is constantly updated and improved. They are adding new features, new skins, new characters and a new map is planned. The community is pretty great and they've done some great things, like websites where you can check the leaderboards, upload and download replays or where you can check, create and share naut builds. They are also organizing tournaments from time to time.Anyway, I strongly recommend this game, it's one of my all time favourites.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
												You control a single “AwesomeNaut” online in a team of 3 against 3. The level is a side-scrolling platformer where you have to bust through enemy turrets and eventually destroy the base, taking out many minions and other AwesomeNauts along the way. As you play a single game your character levels up and you can upgrade their abilities. Each AwesomeNaut has a unique series of abilities and as you level up your profile, you unlock more AwesomeNauts, abilities and features. It was a fun experience, and I would definitely buy it on special if it weren’t for the single fact that I would forget about it after a week. Though if I had any friends (at all) to play with, I’m sure it would be more fun, especially when you devise particular winning strategies and combinations.Definitely worth a gander and if you're into DOTA, HONE or LOL. It's also worth the price.For full review, visit:http://icarusreviews.net/2012/11/18/bwbf-awesomenauts/

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
												MOBA? Yes, of a sort. Awesomenauts is one of a kind, where it sits just below that of the other titans of the MOBA scene, such as DOTA and LOL. The only reason for this is probably because of the cartoonish style of the game which it pulls off really well in a sort of Saturday-morning-cartoon-show. The gameplay feels polished and balanced, as I can say that only a very few times I swore at my screen and called it unbalanced, where I later realized that I had f***ed up on my own. So really down to the bones it's a more relazed MOBA game, so there isn't any pressure of HAVING to win, you just play the game, and then GG at the end. One of the major things that is putting me off is the DLC, which adds new characters and maps, and I feel like this is splitting the community down the middle. 8/10

												Nice little MOBA-style game; it is a side-scrolling 2D platforming action-type of a game (whew, what a mouthful), but it is definitely a lot of fun.Pros:- Large variety of characters, most which you unlock as you level up- Constantly updated (bug fixes, character tweaking, additional DLC)- Very fast matches (match average time is roughly 15-20 minutes)Cons:- DLC is quite expensive (however, the only one that is truly worth it IMHO is the Starborn one, because it adds a lot to the gameplay and more robust characters; everything else is quite unnecessary)- Getting money (or "solar" as the game puts it) can become quite tedious, as even killing an enemy doesn't give you a lot, and there are a LOT of upgrades to purchaseSo the pros outweigh the cons, but if you just wanna relax and play a game where it's a little more competitive than casual (no actual ranked mode, and no one talks during matches, outside of at the end), then this is the game for you.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												I gave a couple of hours to Awesomenauts. In short - it's a funny enjoyable 2D 3vs3 moba. I started playing out of curiosity and because the game was on top of my games list:) It is a moba with 20ish (or less) different characters with its unique abilities each. Each hero has 4 tier abilites - one passive, one for default weapon, one for first magic and one for second magic ability. Each ability has 6 or 7 upgrade; you start with only 4 and then lvl up to unlock the others but you can only use 3 upgrade out of them all per ability. At the beginning you have only 3 heroes and unlock the others through time; the better you play the faster you unlock them all - i unlocked them all by 3rd hour or something like that. Heroes are specific and cool, some harder to play than others but in general i would say they are quite balanced. It's the team composition that matters the most. Some people are deflected of the game by its cartoonish look but I dont mind that. The biggest feature for me was that even if you die more than the other, soon you will unlock all your abilities - because you use currency (solar) for unlocking abilities unlike other moba games where by less money you have less items or crappy items. Here by less money you just unlock all your tiers a few minutes slower which is not bad, so they balanced the game quite nice and fair. It's the skills and team composition that wins the game in the long run and that is amazing. I managed to overturn a few of the games completely even if i had all my towers/turrets down. My biggest remark goes to sometimes laggy performance and variable ping. All in all - a good decent game to try out for a few hours and get addicted:)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 11, 2013
WHY DON'T I RECOMMEND IT?I do not recommend it based on its development over time and focus on competitive play: Community too focused on competitve play; Sudden change from a nice gaming experience that welcomes all to an overly competitve game that punishes freedom of choice in the loadouts and ways of playing; The game itself and its development are too focused on competitions and tournaments nowadays, making the game unwelcoming to new, casual players.IF I DID, WHY WOULD I RECOMMEND IT?I would recommend it based on its gameplay and style: Excellent controls; Fun platforming; Big roster of characters with great voice acting; Constant updates with content, fixes and tweaks; Colorful graphics.SHOULD YOU/OTHER PEOPLE BUY IT?It depends on your answer to the following questions: Are you a competitive player? Are you not affected by a foul community? Do you have friends to play it with? Do you like MOBAs? Do you like sidescrollers? Do you like 80s and 90s cartoons?If you answered YES to 4 or more questions above, I suggest you try it for yourself when it goes on sale. It does not happen that often, but you can be sure that at least at Summer and Winter sales it will go for pretty cheap. Otherwise, as it is, I'd suggest you give it a pass.Is it fun? Is it frustrating?My original review was positive. I've been following this game for almost three years now, since its release on xbox 360. The game was much different then, and posed as a fun, casual alternative to more hardcore games like DOTA 2 or League of Legends. The sidescrolling aspect, plus the cartoony characters made it very lighthearted, and the community was very supportive and fun.That is mainly due to the fact the community was very small still, so you'd mostly find people who really enjoyed the game in the public matches. Playing it with friends was a blast. I bought more than 30 copies of the game for friends just because I enjoyed playing it with others so much. I could not stop playing it. So whenever a friend wanted to stop playing, I'd go find another, buy them a copy and continue playing with them and so on until I passed out from exhaustion.As the game grew, so did the community, and you suddenly began seeing a sudden change in the pacing of the matches. Players were hateful, spamming the chat with swear words and offensive comments. The matches themselves became overly competitive, and you'd be shunned by your team mates for not playing in a specific, "optimized" way.What I am the saddest about is the fact that the game encouraged experimenting, getting custom loadouts and just trying whatever felt like fun at the moment. As it became more competitive, it seemed like you were being punished by trying to steer away from the known effective combinations of power ups. And other players, both in your team as well as the opponents, would make sure to point your "mistakes" out.The matchmaking is a mess too. Most of my friends who recently started playing the game complained they were thrown in matches with overpowered charaters, but thruth is the opponents already knew the most effective loadouts and stuck to it, so my frinds were decimated by them. It is extremely frustrating not being able to experiment and discover things by yourself as the online aspect of the game (which is its mais focus anyway) is filled with unfriendly, over competitve people who simply cuss at you should you dare mention the word "casual".Closing wordsI resent the path the game took towards more of an "eSports" kind of approach. I spent so many hours (close to a thousand) and so much money in it too, with the kickstarter, the extra copies, all the DLC, several DLC packs for friends... all because I believed this game had a great potential to be some sort of party game focused on a more casual style. I feel a bit betrayed, and that clouds my perception of what the product is today. If you like competitve games and MOBAs, this is a nice alternative, and definitely the best 2D one you can find, based on my own opinion and experience. But with the history I have with this game, I simply cannot recommend it anymore, as it not only shattered my expectations, but it has been a source of much disappointment and grief.Take it or leave it, the final choice is up to you.Go there, save the day!

content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												The name says it all this game is really Awesome! :) Awesomenauts is a 3-on-3 side-scrolller battle game with a variety of different modes,chracters,maps,powers etc to choose from. The game mode i play most is the orginal one where both teams have a set of turrets and a base the aim of the game is to get into the other teams base whilst defending yours but to do that you will need to get rid of their turrets that are blocking the way. That is easier said then done with all the drones,bots and Awsomenauts in your path you are sure to have a action-packed,intense and amazing close game. The chracters are all unique in their own way but they are all different so a lot of chracters to explore and how you can use them to your advantage and dominate! the 2 chracters i use most is Sheriff Lonestar who can run and gun,throw dynamite (so with turrets you chuck them at that and run off which can work well), jet boots which can help to escape and a charging bull that pushes the other team back until they kill it. Skolideer is a robot who can also run and gun but with lasers,jets to fly to higher platforms,earthquake which is like a ground pound,and you can also throw enemies. The powers,chracter,weapons etc. everything can be upgraded in the store which is at your base but you need to collect solar during the match but it is also a healing station which is handy if you don,t want to go out and earn health in the middle of battle. The maps are really balanced and are suited to the game as the game is set in space so that fits with all the chracters. and there is so much more in this game and has so much replayability to the game as its always really fun and not endless.the DLCs are worth checking out as they give powers,coustumes and such to add to the chracter. Oh and 1 other thing chracters have different voice commands (they are same just say a differnt line) and taunts :) if you can you should deffenitely buy this game as it is so worth it as the matches are un-predictable ps the music to this game and i mean all the soundtracks are fantastic as it gives the game the cartoon feel which i really like as thats what the game is aiming to do oh and the graphics are fantastic! :).Very addictive weather your playing with friends or not.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 17, 2014
												Note the date of this review before reading it: March 17, 2014.A lot of people have complained about problems in this game, which primarily include matchmaking, lag, and balance issues.Matchmaking - Yes, matchmaking is an enormous problem. You could very easily be queued up against people that have logged 200+ hours your first game. You could also be thrown into a one-sided game where the enemy is already sitting in your base. Why this is, not a lot of people know. You are ranked leagues in this game, and matchmaking tries to find a game that has people in it that average out to be in a league that is the same as yours or adjacent to it. Now this seems ideal, but if you were league 6, and league 1 player could queue up with a league 9 player and you could face them in a match. This does happen sometimes, and the problem certainly needs to be addressed.Lag - Some hosts are very bad, and it makes competitive play obsolete in some cases. People overexaggerate this issue, however. All it normally does is result in an ability hitting you just barely outside of the range that it normally would.Balance - Patches, however infrequent, have made the whole balance issue a lot better. Some characters are a lot easier to master and are better on some maps than others, but it all really does come down to skill. I've seen some of the "worst characters" carry teams.These problems aside, I think the game is really fun. Excellent soundtrack, mostly a good community, and a neat gimmick to thrown into the MOBA genre. There aren't many characters yet, and none have been added in the 5 months I've been playing. If you get bored in MOBAs playing the same character, this game is NOT for you. However, if you want a relaxing little Saturday afternoon brawler MOBA to play with your friends, pick it up. It's addicting and fresh.

Posted: May 16, 2014
												Taking a turn from the usual MOBA being a side scroller I can only call this game one thing..... Fantasic. this game has a  wonderful balance between strategy and action.  It's Really fun to play alone, but it shines brightest when your playing with friends. Its pretty simple for a MOBA  but if anything it makes it even more fun not having to deal with a steep learning curve. Don't get me wrong there is a learning curve just not one that takes hours upon hours upon hours to master. I'm not a fan of MOBAs, but this game is the exception. It is simply awesome. 9.1

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												Gameplay 9/10Fast paced 2D MOBA, easy to understand, hard to master. Has some competitive potential and there are a few tournaments. The controls are great and the game rewards skill and teamwork. The game has some small balance issues, but they are constantly working on in it. Graphics 8/10The cartoon graphics are really nice. The effects are ok, but they are polishing them. They got much better over time.Sound 10/10The music, the nauts' theme songs/lines and the sound effects in general are awesome.Matchmaking 7/10Well, this is the main issue of the game, but I don't think there's much to be done if the playerbase doesn't grow. There aren't enough online players in each region for good matchmaking and lag free games. However, some small improvements could be done, like creating the teams after the six players needed for a match are found. This way the best players won't end up in the same team. Also, a pre-game lobby where players could talk and decide what nauts they pick would be great.MiscSome characters are quite original, the theme songs and lines are funny. The game is constantly updated and improved. They are adding new features, new skins, new characters and a new map is planned. The community is pretty great and they've done some great things, like websites where you can check the leaderboards, upload and download replays or where you can check, create and share naut builds. They are also organizing tournaments from time to time.Anyway, I strongly recommend this game, it's one of my all time favourites.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2015
												This game is amazing. Great graphics, amazing soundtrack, unique characters, full player input. I admit, the lag and matchmaking are a problem but you have to accept lag as it is since the playerbase is small and if you're losing badly just quit. Ragequiting isn't a shameful act. It's there for a reason. This game has fast paced action, loads of humour and has a lot of character. It also stands out from other mobas because it takes place in space so all the characters don't have to be mages, knights, archers and anthros. Extremly fun game with a great community. A must buy.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
												Awesomenauts is a MOBA. Like Smite, LoL, and others, but its much different. It uses a unique 2D perspective and fun gameplay with many characters (Aliens in this game). The price tag of 10 bucks is kinda a lot, since there isnt as much content as other MOBAs which are free2play. But the cartoon style and fast paced gameplay are a lot of fun, and keep the game from getting boring fast. Its fun to test out each Naut and see which ones abilities and items suit your own personal playstyle. Overall the gameplay is solid and fun and can be played on ANY computer even with low specs.7/10

												After a few more hundred hours of gameplay I feel the need to update this review a little so the previous review will be located at the bottom.Prepare to have to carry every game (If you play on your own)Around 90% of the games I've played have been against premades who I know for a fact I would beat if it weren't for teammates who are obviously inexperienced, and don't even get me started with the inferior matchmaking "Slapdash" doesn't even start to cover how bad the system is.The game is enjoyable when it's fair a good comparison to this is call of duty back in 2008-2012 each team would have 4 low - decent skilled players and 1-2 good players most of the time assuming it wasn't a premade in which even the premade would normally rage quit in the event they were versing at least on decent player.The main reason I enjoy this game so is the 5% where both teams are equal and are having fun and as of recent events the percentage is rapidly declining.Another review said I quote "Carry Simulator" That is also a fully completed review of this game.The game is self if fun but after playing for a while it is totally broken here is the reasons why.#1 The community is the typical trash talking 7 years old call of duty player.#2 As a brand new player you can get put against people who have been playing for over 1000 hours and are in a group so you and 2 randoms who have played around 3 hours all together can get put vs a  team whose hours accumulate to over 3000.#3 The peer to peer basis on this game is terrible just plain awful you can have a ping of 03 and because the opponent who has 400+ he will have an enormous advantage.#4 I have played the developers in the game and asked them these questions and they always come out this the excuse.(After thinking these changes over and we have alot of times, we always try and improve the community ...ect....)And then they always say we can't do anything that's up to the bosses.As much as this game is fun it is paired to be completely unbalanced in almost every aspect and completely unfair and will drive you mad but at the same time can be a great experience and be extremely fun i would rate the game.6/10 Great game but needs a total revamp.
