content:
Posted: April 16, 2016
												Awesomenauts is a 3v3, 2D MOBA with a cartoony style developed and published by Ronimo Games.Narrative:The Good - Awesomenauts is one of the most over the top and silly MOBAs in recent memory. The name alone really does give a good idea of how absurd and cheesy the game is. The main plot is about a war between robots with a team of elite mercenaries in the mix. A really unique aspect is that each character is given their own backstory and interesting dialogue for when they're taunting or just bragging throughout the matches. The dialogue is funny and stupid and the characters are just downright odd. You've got Leon, a French speaking chameleon that is wanted for having sex with a ruler's wife after playing a bowls championship. You've also got Ksenia, an assassin who was tricked by her father into wearing a headset that made her think she was a hair stylist when she was actually killing his competition and now she still wears the headset to watch soap operas. Need I go on?The Bad - Nothing.Score - 10/10Graphics:The Good - Awesomenauts looks fantastic. While LoL and DOTA don't look awful, Awesomenauts is downright spectacular in the visuals department. The artstyle is cartoony and really appealing with a huge color palette. It runs at 60 FPS without issues and is incredibly flashy. Each character looks distinctly different so you always know who you're going up against.The Bad - Nothing.Score - 10/10Sound:The Good - Awesomenauts has a wide array of music with some fantastic, upbeat and happy pieces for the arena battles. The shop music is just perfect and the characters have some of the funniest theme music you could imagine. My favourite being Leon's because it's romantic music with some guy saying random French words in a sexy voice.The Bad - Nothing.Score - 10/10Gameplay:The Good - Awesomenauts is incredibly fun. It's very simple to learn and incredibly hard to master. Each character has access to a regular weapons like a gun or fists or something and has two purchasable moves that help give them a considerable edge in battle. The characters themselves are all unique and have their own playstyles and base health. Leon can pull enemies in and go invisible but isn't very tanky. Froggy G. is also pretty fragile but is able to dash towards enemies and activate a special tornado that allows him to shred through his problems. Voltar is able to heal teammates and lay down AoE healing devices. There's also quite a few characters to choose from. The base game offers up 18 different characters, most of which being unlockable as you progress. Most of them are very well balanced. Speaking of progression, the game has a rewarding XP system which will let you unlock more power ups for purchase at the shop in the arenas, helping give a sense that you're actually getting somewhere. The shop itself is awesome (ha, see what I did there?). It allows you to purchase new moves and buff them, along with your primary weapon and character's physical aspects. The currency you use to purchase these upgrades will slowly build up overtime and is gained more quickly by farming off creatures and killing enemy Awesomenauts. I forgot to mention that there's also a freefall onto the battlefield at the beginning of spawning which allows you to gain more currency and keep the player from becoming bored. The Bad - Awesomenauts' biggest issue is balancing. While for the most part the game is fairly good about it, there are times when it does a♥♥♥♥♥♥job and it really shows. Remember when I said MOST characters are balanced? Well I said most because there are a few that are obnoxiusly overpowered. Ayla is incredibly annoying since she can activate an AoE effect that allows her to catch anyone and take less damage depending on the number of enemy Awesomenauts in the area. Rocco is able to diss out mass damage and send out a projectile that can kill you in your own base in areas the enemy can't reach. And Nibbs is able to tank damage like you wouldn't believe while punishing anyone he gets near. I hate fighting these characters due to their obscenely good setups. Matches are also not balanced incredibly well so steam rolling and getting rolled is inevitable. Finally, the levelling system. As you kill enemies, you gain XP in matches which levels up your team. This boosts them with extra health and damage, making them even harder to take down. It basically means that if your team dies in the early game, you're pretty much screwed. This is the one aspect I want completely removed.Score - 7/10Longevity and Replayability:The Good - Awesomenauts is incredibly addictive with matches not taking too long at about a 15-20 minute average. The personal levelling system helps keep you playing and there's a ton to unlock. The game is also just downright fun.The Bad - Nothing, it's fleshed out.Score - 10/10Final Score: Awesomnauts really is awesome (I did it again!). It's engaging, simple, funny, absurd, and charming. It is most definitely worth the price, so long as you're willing to deal with some balancing issues.9.4/10 = Spectacular

content:
Posted: June 19, 2013
												After having just under 500 hours gametime, I feel I have appropriate experience to quickly review this game.A quick run-down:Awesomenauts is a fast-paced, strategic, 3v3, MOBA-style game in the style of a 2D-platformer. Like League of Legends, this game consists of defending your base and attacking the enemy team's base. Each team's base is protected by at least 2 levels of turrets per map and teams must destroy enemy turrets in order to successfully reach the base and attack. However, unlike games such as League of Legends and Dota2, Awesomenauts allows the player to have full control of their chosen character using W,A,S,D keys for movement and mouse-buttons to attack. Players attack in real-time rather than time-based attacks. There is a fairly large array of characters to choose from (seeing it has only been out a few years) and the developers consistantly bring out more each year, which changes the flavour of the game and mixes up the current meta-play.My opinion on the game:Awsomenauts has to be one of the most competitive and fun games I have ever played to date. It's quirky, quick and comes jam-packed with great artwork and a terrific soundtrack. Sound effects and music are composed by partner company Sonnic Picnic, who I must say do an excellent job. The developers are constantly updating it, with extra effort put into balancing character abilities, so there is always fair game.If you are new to this game, then I must advise playing offline against the bots to get used to the feel of the game and the different abilites of the characters; online can be pretty intense, competitive and difficult, which may repell new players who are fed up of losing. However, once some momentum is gathered, it becomes quite easy to identify new and better ways of playing, which are moulded by the in-game variables such as enemy team characters and the chosen map.I enjoy this game thoroughly and love going on kill-streaks; I don't believe I have felt a feeling like this since getting kill streaks on Gears of War 3.With satisfaction and frustration compiled into one, this game offers everything a player is looking for in an online MOBA game. If you're bored of LoL and Dota2, have a blast at this, I guarantee you'll enjoy it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
												What is Awesomnauts? A 2D Platformer Shooter MOBA, where 2 teams of 3 compete to take down the other's drill, while pushing down towers and the drill with friendly drones.What can be said about it? It's gameplay is extremely solid, leaving a lot to good aim and skilled platforming to determine the better player, in addition to strategy.It also feels as though they looked at other MOBA's (that shall remain nameless to avoid wars) and thought "What flaws do these games have that can make the game boring, and how can we changes that?" What results is a bunch of simple changes that make the game more engaging, such as respawn times getting partly replaced with a minigame to earn "solar" (in game currency), replacing loading screens with fan-art and themes of the character you chose, a variety of maps (each with gimmicks, such as a giant worm that can pop out when a button is hit), and removing the concept of "items" (now you don't have 20 characters who all build the EXACT. SAME. THING.) and instead special upgrades for your different abilities/attacks (such as increase damage, or give it a stun, or allow multiple uses but less damage per use) but also restricts these upgrades (You can only choose 3 out of 6 possible upgrades per ability, meaning you need to plan ahead due to no selling mechanic).The music is also amazing, and does not seem to grow old no matter how much I hear it (helped by the fact there is a new song that plays each respawn, as well as if you go on a killing spree). I often find myself listening to it outside of the game itself.The characters all have a lot of charm to them as well. You have a Worm and Pufferfish partner's in crime going "We are going on a heist here, see?", a space viking out on a war path because he was called fat, and the greatest action hero that ever existed (though we will touch on him later). Simple phrases such as how they taunt and use voice commands to what they say while shopping really show off these characters.One more great thing about this game: Local Multiplayer. You can play locally with somebody split-screen, but you can team up with them online. Few games do this, and it's welcome to be able to invite a friend over to have them join me for a round or two without them needing to own the game itself.Finally, unlike most other MOBA type games, you aren't dedicated to a round. People can leave their game (though it DOES count as a loss) at will, and that space gets filled with a Bot player instead of unbalancing the teams (and to be fair, bots are pretty competant in this game, a rare occurance in a lot of games), and a player can eventually replace that bot as well. Most other MOBA type games force you to sit through a whole game, or cripple your team, but this system prevents both of those issues.So what is wrong with it? Well, it's not nice to new players. A LOT of upgrades have to be unlocked, and while this is nice at first as to prevent a player from being overwhelmed, some important upgrades (such as damage for assassin type Nauts) don't get unlocked until hours upon hours of gameplay. Also, new players have a good chance to be paired up with players who have a LOT of experience (a flaw in a lot of multiplayer games) simply due to the system, where it pairs you against people of a similar ranking.Also, there is no dedicated servers. While it's nice as this means the game is never full, since players host the games themselves, this can lead to lag and hits are based on the client of the attacker. This can lead to some cheap deaths just because somebody is lagging or the host does not have a computer suited to hosting.Then there is DLC. Now, I wouldn't mind paying the $5 more to get the whole game, but it feels like I have been ripped off when I buy the game just to find out I can't use 5 characters because I haven't dropped money into it (Such as the afformentioned Ted McPain, greatest action hero alive).Finally, and this is a nitpick, but there are a LOT of references. Now, I am a person who likes a small reference now and then, but this game feels like a lot of humor comes from simply getting those references (A lot of characters items are references... There's even an upgrade called "Skrogachu" with a picture of what is clearly supposed to be a Pikachu.Overall, great game, though network issues could be improved. It's worth the money, worth playing through it, but expect to get kicked in the teeth by seasoned players for a bit. Get past that, you'll appreciate the game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2014
												Awesomenauts is an excellent game that I highly recommend. It’s a MOBA game with a Saturday morning cartoon style and from a 2d view, yet works surprising well in gameplay. Visual wise the game is great. While playing I felt waves of nostalgia from the times I watched cartoon tapes on my VHS. In terms of audio the sound effects feel cheesy, but I personally think that adds to the charm. Each individual character has their own unique theme song and a bunch of witty one liners they shout during battle. Some characters are even voiced by famous youtubers like OMFGCATA, TotalBiscuit, PressHeartToContinue, Myndflame and HAWPofficial.	Gameplay is where the game really shines though. You, your two team mates and your three opponents pick a character. Afterward you get launched from a space ship in a drop pod which can be moved around to collect money as you fall towards your team’s base. At the base you will find the shop, which is vital. Your character has four rows total to buy from. The top rows are your abilities you must buy, and once you bought that ability its upgrade row is opened and you can use it in combat. Below them are your standard attack and utility which are unlocked from the start. Each row has six different upgrades that can be applied to the corresponding category, but you can only choose three of them. This adds depth to battle as you will have to sacrifice one thing to improve another and so on. The main goal of the game is to destroy the solar drill, which is stationed at your base. It is guarded by tough turrets, but if they are destroyed the drills open to attack. You and your team have to defend your turrets and destroy theirs, and I have to admit that it’s pretty fun! 	The major flaw is unbalance of newly released characters, but that’s solely because they just came out and get patched up pretty quickly. This game is very good, and I hope buyers will enjoy it as much as I do.

content:
Posted: August 17, 2012
												this is a fun game and is really the only kind of competitive 2d platformer game out there. It is a MOBA but its learning curve isnt as high as others. there are currently 27 champions, each with 3 attacks and a total of 24 upgrades per champion. The mechanics of each champion feel unique and has multiple viable builds. Honestly, this game has a relatively low skill floor but an extremely high skill ceiling. It's a very good game.the balance has a few issues but the developers directly talk to the playerbase regarding it and works together with the community to improve the balance. I've seen things the community came up with get implemented that basically everyone agrees was an improvement. the game has a surprisingly strong competitive scene. Keep in mind that on average this is a game with an average of ~500 congruent players. In this year we've seen one doubles tournament,  another 2 month long league style tournament, 2 different 1v1 tournaments each focused on different characters, another 2 month long league style tournament, 3 different bracket based tournaments, and a  2v2 TDM tournament. honestly this game is way better if you have friends to play with. the community is one of those where everyone who plays regularly knows each other so its not terribly hard to find people to play with. since on steam sales it goes on sale for like a dollar it is well worth a try. you really gotta stick with it though. if youre not willing to try and learn the mechanics (which again isnt as advanced as other MOBAs, but the tutorial is trash and youre going to fend for yourself learning them) then you wont have a good time. This is one of those games where you can easily spend 1000 hours on it if you motivate yourself to get past the crappy first 50.

Posted: November 27, 2013
												Very nice game, in short, it's a simplified, casual and 2D DOTA. Pros: Easier to start off with than DOTA/LoLEach character has their own music and items, so each 'naut has more depthQuick matchmaking and short matches mean fast paced gameplay Brilliant characters with awesome voice actors  (including TotalBiscuit, Jesse Cox and Myndflame)Cons: Online lag can detract from your experience, but it is not too rampant.Naut balancing can be iffy, but Ronimo are always improving the game in patches. So overall I really reccomend this game to anyone who enjoys MOBAs and strategy games.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
												Awesomenauts....Some say its an entirely unique game most...just say its kinda like LoL or Dota. It's a quirky humorous yet dark version of a spacey wacey timey wimey LoL. Unlike Dota where its more classes Each "class" Is a Character following along the lines of LoL. The backstories are a bit short and as far as I can tell not much has been added on by the fanbase but I'm getting off topic here. The gameplay itself is an interesting platforming type. It is a rather tactical game so most of you charge in guns a blazin fans probably won't do too well. I recommend this game because of the fact that eac character actually takes a specific mindset to truely master. I myself use voltar to his full exent but even then there are different ways the cahracters can be used. Anyone can take a character and if their items allow it make a build that they and very few others could master entirely. Not only that but with the recent expansion the random awesomenaut takes on a whole new use for Team Death Match. The game is just...its hard to describe especially for one like me.TL;DR Good game give them your money BUY ALL THE THINGS.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!This is a 2D sidescrolling moba game.Interface/Menu/SettingsThere are MANY resolution sizes available.Color blind mode.You can play this game fullscreen, windowed mode or borderless window.They will offer you a tutorial.Has some different languages.There is a master volume slidebar available with % based.There is a combat volume slidebar available with % based.There is a music volume slidebar available with % based.There is a character volume slidebar available with % based.There is an announcer volume slidebar available with % based.There is a mouse sensitivty bar. Yes with % based.You are able to change the controls on your keyboard and customise it.YOU ARE ABLE TO PLAY THIS SPLITSCREEN!About the game.Whenever you are respawing back, you will be crashed back to your spawn point. During the crash you are able to pick up some coins. You will walk over to your shop, where you are able to buy and upgrade abilities. Each character has their own role and playstyle. Advantages and disadvantages. You play 3 vs 3 with 2 lanes. Upper and bottom lane. Each lane has 2 towers on both sides and a core at the end. To win the game you have to destroy the core on the enemy side. You get money by destroying enemy heroes, towers, creeps and you can find it around. There are also Neutral enemies. There are small and bigger ones. If you are not able to kill the bigger ones or you are going away. They will get a massive Regeneration. After you have completed a game you will get some Experience. Having enough experience will grant you a level up. You are able to unlock some characters in this way.Characteres are able to level up.Neutral enemies drop xp and gold.You can play against other players or bots.Gold pieces are scattered around the map.Many characters with different playstyles.Buying and upgrading abilities and perks.3 vs 3, 2 lanes.Level system outside the game itself. Where you can unlock characters.Creeps take less damage from towers.There is a mini-story.Other things.THERE IS A FOX CHARACTER!! WOOOT!!-------------------I Give this game a 8/10

content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												When I first started playing the game and endured through the initial presentation/voice acting I thought to myself - This is going to be so bad... but what else could I expect for the price?Then I started playing the practice match... and it was fairly ok.... I then moved on to on-line gaming, and I played the first...... and the second,... and the third...until I had to stop because I was told I should prepare dinner otherwise we would starve.Basically, it is a sort of pvp 3vs3 tower defense game. You have to destroy the enemy core and bash some turrets along the way, while the other group is trying to do the same. The characters have very distinct characteristics and playing with a different one will force you to change your approach and strategy.What can I say , it is a very entertaining game and generates interesting battles, provided that you chose a character that suits your game style.It is a very enjoyable way to waste time. And I say "waste" in a good way, because if you get hooked, the time will fly and you will forget about some of your pressing obligations - such has eating

content:
Posted: October 10, 2014
												Now, im rewriting this review because of all the hate this game is getting in recent reviews, over the "xp system".First of all, the xp system isn't terrible, and doesn't ruin the game, but i can see why some may dislike it. Now to the review.Overview: simple platforming and 3 abilities to attack. Destroy turrets and the enemy drillcore to win. Colourful, bright colours and graphics. Addictive gameplay, easy to pick up and understand straight away.One of the only problems I can think of right now is the MATCHMAKING. Most people are complaining about this (as well as the xp system) but the matchmaking deserves the most attention. Being matched with someone who is A LOT better than you is not fun. And the skill range is rather large, so the matchmaking has to be at least a little better for the full experience.Still a great game, and an awesome multiplayer experience if you get some friends on it with you.

Posted: December 11, 2014
												Honestly, a good MOBA. It's not a F2P so that reduces players, also at times it is harder to pair to a match with real players. You usually start a match with bots. There is a lot of abilities and characters for each different playing style. A 3v3 and I love it, not a lot of players or anything like that. Basically a side-scrolling MOBA, so LoL or Dota 2. Only problem that I have with Awesomenauts is the servers. There is a problem with the connectivity and consistency. There is major lag at times and it gets annoying. I have very good internet 120 Mb/s Down 15 Mb/s Up. I have also heard other players have this problem as well. Other than that, it's a good time.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
												What is Awesomnauts? A 2D Platformer Shooter MOBA, where 2 teams of 3 compete to take down the other's drill, while pushing down towers and the drill with friendly drones.What can be said about it? It's gameplay is extremely solid, leaving a lot to good aim and skilled platforming to determine the better player, in addition to strategy.It also feels as though they looked at other MOBA's (that shall remain nameless to avoid wars) and thought "What flaws do these games have that can make the game boring, and how can we changes that?" What results is a bunch of simple changes that make the game more engaging, such as respawn times getting partly replaced with a minigame to earn "solar" (in game currency), replacing loading screens with fan-art and themes of the character you chose, a variety of maps (each with gimmicks, such as a giant worm that can pop out when a button is hit), and removing the concept of "items" (now you don't have 20 characters who all build the EXACT. SAME. THING.) and instead special upgrades for your different abilities/attacks (such as increase damage, or give it a stun, or allow multiple uses but less damage per use) but also restricts these upgrades (You can only choose 3 out of 6 possible upgrades per ability, meaning you need to plan ahead due to no selling mechanic).The music is also amazing, and does not seem to grow old no matter how much I hear it (helped by the fact there is a new song that plays each respawn, as well as if you go on a killing spree). I often find myself listening to it outside of the game itself.The characters all have a lot of charm to them as well. You have a Worm and Pufferfish partner's in crime going "We are going on a heist here, see?", a space viking out on a war path because he was called fat, and the greatest action hero that ever existed (though we will touch on him later). Simple phrases such as how they taunt and use voice commands to what they say while shopping really show off these characters.One more great thing about this game: Local Multiplayer. You can play locally with somebody split-screen, but you can team up with them online. Few games do this, and it's welcome to be able to invite a friend over to have them join me for a round or two without them needing to own the game itself.Finally, unlike most other MOBA type games, you aren't dedicated to a round. People can leave their game (though it DOES count as a loss) at will, and that space gets filled with a Bot player instead of unbalancing the teams (and to be fair, bots are pretty competant in this game, a rare occurance in a lot of games), and a player can eventually replace that bot as well. Most other MOBA type games force you to sit through a whole game, or cripple your team, but this system prevents both of those issues.So what is wrong with it? Well, it's not nice to new players. A LOT of upgrades have to be unlocked, and while this is nice at first as to prevent a player from being overwhelmed, some important upgrades (such as damage for assassin type Nauts) don't get unlocked until hours upon hours of gameplay. Also, new players have a good chance to be paired up with players who have a LOT of experience (a flaw in a lot of multiplayer games) simply due to the system, where it pairs you against people of a similar ranking.Also, there is no dedicated servers. While it's nice as this means the game is never full, since players host the games themselves, this can lead to lag and hits are based on the client of the attacker. This can lead to some cheap deaths just because somebody is lagging or the host does not have a computer suited to hosting.Then there is DLC. Now, I wouldn't mind paying the $5 more to get the whole game, but it feels like I have been ripped off when I buy the game just to find out I can't use 5 characters because I haven't dropped money into it (Such as the afformentioned Ted McPain, greatest action hero alive).Finally, and this is a nitpick, but there are a LOT of references. Now, I am a person who likes a small reference now and then, but this game feels like a lot of humor comes from simply getting those references (A lot of characters items are references... There's even an upgrade called "Skrogachu" with a picture of what is clearly supposed to be a Pikachu.Overall, great game, though network issues could be improved. It's worth the money, worth playing through it, but expect to get kicked in the teeth by seasoned players for a bit. Get past that, you'll appreciate the game.

												Awesomenauts is a fun moba that works in a 2D side-on perspective. It is very fun and, while simpler than other mobas it has a more casual air and a comedic style. There are 3 to 4 maps and currently 15 characters and with 4 more unlockable via dlc. Its 2D look means that it has platforming and verticality unique to itself.I would recomend this game to anyone who likes mobas or just wants a change as it is an easy to learn hard to master game that does support new players well. Its cheap price makes it very accessible to people who want to check it out.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
												A fun 2D MOBA game where you have to aim to shoot the enemies, and manage to use your skills in a new way, kinda different of how MOBA usually works. It can be a bit hard in the beginning, since you need to aim, and you'll need to get used to it, specially playing with bots, so you can understand how things works.The characters are fun and somehow unique, each one have their own feeling and gameplay elements, it is one of those games that you'll truly get used to a character, but will not manage to play with another because it doesn't have your style.This game plays like a platformer, yes, you need to go up and down the stage, to defend your towers, you'll need to jump and aim a lot, so you need to be into this kind of world.A good aspect is that it doesn't use too many buttons, so it does have some simple elements to it that makes the game accessible for beginners. Still, there are some things in the game that you'll only get with time (like, when to fight the neutral bosses in some stages).You'll probably have some fun, the aspect of 3v3 is perfect to play with friends, it is easy to reunite 6 friends so you can play it. Still, if you don't have friends playing it, you can still have some fun playing this game in a more competitive aspect, with other unknown people. Either way you play, you'll find something here to like.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												Oh my god a MOBA I actually enjoy. Don't get me wrong its still difficult to win against human players and probably require just as much stratergy and team work as others, but games aren't pain stakingly long and also only uses 3 players per team, meaning you have less people yelling at you for playing bad. Not only that but I actually like the characters even if there are less. It can lead to some matches having the exact same teams because meta games but its better for new players as you dont have to worry about lots of different heros you can't even remeber the name of. This is not an overly complicated MOBA, but it still invokes the same level of stratergy and team work as others yet still giveing a fun experience rather then a stupidly serious competative one. Its closer to TCGs and pokemon with its competativeness rather then poker or chess level competition, and that i enjoy.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												This game is really cool and funny :DIt's a 3v3 2D Dota/Lol type game, with 16 free nauts and 5 Starstorm dlc nauts.You start with the tutorial, it shows you basic stuff, there you learn how to use abillities. After you finish it, you get to experience a little crappy matchmaking system. It's like a skill based matchmaking system with ranks. The match is hosted by a person, and that person can be at the other side of the planet (you can choose in which region you play), when the host lags, game is on his side, he can really take advantage of it. When you join a room, there is no chat and the only thing you see is fan art and how many players need to join so the game can start OR wait till the timer goes to 0. While waiting, you can't chat or leave the room which is kind of a bummer because it really takes a lot of time sometimes. (You can chat while you play, but you can't while waiting for the game to start.) As i said, there are 16 free and 5 dlc nauts (it's just 1 dlc).Each is unique, in play style, upgrades and role.There are a few maps in the game, they really need to add more, and the map consists of a Solar drill (it's like your base that you have to protect). Each team has 3 or 4 turrets depending on the map and places where you can kill little critters for HP. There is also a shop, and a surface where you land, both are behind the drill.Upgrades:Every nauts has different upgradesEach naut can buy 3 items per abillity. There are upgrades for 2 abillities, 1 for the weapon you carry and body upgrades. (to be clear thats 4 upgrade types)Roles:Every character is unique because it has a role.You have heavy nauts which are like tanksYou have low hp nauts which are like supportAnd you also have those who heal you, put on the shields and help you in some ways.This game so far, isn't balanced well, but hopefully it will in the future.I will rate it somewhere around 6 maybe 7 out of 10.It's good, enjoyable. Recommended.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												Awesomenauts is a MOBA, where there are turrets, and hiding spots, bases, upgrades, etc. Except this is in a 2D perspective. Instead of most MOBA's being over-the-top 3D games, this is 2D. It's a 3-on-3 battle and the map isn't that big. You can get to the middle quickly enough to defend. There are quite the selection of character, going from Lonestar to Coco to Vinnie and Spike. They all have different abilities and advantages, weaknessess, things of the sort. It operates just like any MOBA's you can find around the web. Verdict 7/10 stars. If you're bored of the same looking MOBA all the time, then definitely pick this one up. It may not be free like most, but it might be worth it. And it usually is.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												Holy♥♥♥♥♥♥this game is way cool.So you're this mercenary hired to defend from other mercenaries in an ever lasting battle to the death.There are also like 1..2..3.. A BAJILLION CLASSES. Each of them function very differently and have different roles. Do you want to be the sniper who is really good at pushing? Or maybe you want to be the viking who is super fast and hits pretty well, but has like no range. Oh, or maybe you want to be the ninja chameleon? The diversity here is fantastic. Or maybe the sk8rgrl who says c ya l8r all the time.The maps are symmetric which helps with balancing things and there isn't too much of a gap between the characters in terms of usefulness. So, while there is likely a tier list I totally didn't look up or anything, the characters I played with didn't appear to be significantly better than any others. Anything that killed me was obviously overpowered, though.Team play is heavily encouraged for pushes against enemy turrets and the mechanics behind resources and respawning are great.My only gripe is that I didn't get to playing this game earlier.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 17, 2016
												Want a game that is satisfying to play against the A.I.? A game that is filled with humor and pop culture references?18 characters without buying any DLC, and every one I try feels amazingly worth while, like a distinctly different playstyle expeience. Some are so utterly different that they may also change your play style when you are playing alongside them, even a little when playing alongside the A.I.For instance, Coco is always uber agile on her hoverboard, while Clunk or the Space Viking are like moving walls that are a challenge to slow down. Meanwhile Gnaw can kinda lay down some area control. Fighting Raylewn will put you on your toes whenever her laser sight signals she is about to snipe. And all this feeling of variety is just when playing against bots :DThis has been a load of good times, got it for only $2.50 during a Steam weekend sale, so it feels completely free from that perspective.

However, this interpretation must be considered under my investigation. After much contemplation, I believe that a Naut can often be considered awesome. Nuts, one of the definitions of Naut, can be extremely daunting and often aggressive, causing many breakups and issues within families It has also come to my attention that I may be a ♥♥♥♥ing moron and that it is simply called 'Awesomenauts' because it sounds 'cool' to the kids of today. This fact can be used to show the sociopolitical state of our world, however I am not allowed to say such things as I am apparently a 'boring♥♥♥♥♥♥'As a final note, I would like to direct any readers to the previously mentioned Japanese furniture site as it is rather intriguing: http://www.naut.ne.jp/

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 14, 2013
												Introduction:If you already know what this game is about feel free to skip the introduction. If not read on! Awesomenaut is a 2D Action Rpgish game (Or in other words a 2D MOBA game which is based on strategy) that can statify a competitive or casual gamer with certain circumstances for competitive gamers. It mainly focuses on team based play and it is quite in depth in that respect. Now for the good things about the game.The Good:Awesomenauts is a fun game with a satisfying amount of characters each with their own role. They're colorful and have a very nice art style not used much anymore. The game has variety with several maps to play on and many builds to make your character fit your play style. In the introduction I mentioned teamwork, now let me expand upon that. The teamwork in this game is very intriquet with player's varying playstyles, characters, builds, and several other variables. It is very rewarding if difficult at times and I've won rounds with a disadvantage just because of teamwork. Overall a good experience, but not without some drawbacks.The Bad:At certain updates of the game it has been terribly unbalanced with characters clearly better than others and certain builds and team compositions dominating. Some characters did way too much burst damage or sometimes had too much healing power. Even now there are some character and build items not even used or barely ever seen. Also some characters are just bland and gimmiky, I don't end up playing a good lot of them because of that. Along with some wonky hit boxes certain updates can make the game super frustrating, but don't give up on this game just yet.Overall:Despite all the bad I personally think the good out weighs it, also the fact that there isn't another game I can think of quite like this one. I wouldn't hesitate on buying this game if you plan on playing with friends. Balance doesn't mean much if you have a laugh with your friends and use some teamwork. If you're not playing this game with your friends AND you want to play it competitively I'd strongly reccomend you wait for the game to go on sale so you can get a friend a copy. In the end a solid if off balance kind of game, but if you like the concept and balance isn't your top priority pick it up!

content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
												This game is an incredible take on the MOBA genre. Unlike games like DOTA and LoL, Awesomenauts is based on the premise of casual competition. It is designed to be fun. An interesting result of that is the lack of a real consequence when somebody quits your team. He is replaced by a bot that is often more competent than himself and continues to play in his stead. Another player can join mid-game to replace the bot at any time.Awesomenauts also has a great community (official forum, not Steam). It has a thriving fanart community, a modding one, a tactics one, etc.This game really opens itself up to modders. It allows creators to modify in-game bots and make their own using an AI editor. Modders can also create gamemodes using this tool. If Ronimo likes a bot, it can find its way into the official game. I have made two of the in-game bots, myself.Overall, I highly recommend Awesomenauts. It has a thriving community that you should not miss out on. The gameplay is very fun, if less competitive than its other MOBA counterparts. All that is lacking is you.

content:
Posted: November 29, 2016
												This review does focus on several community issues, as such this may appear biased. Let's start by saying Awesomenauts is not a bad game. I've enjoyed it a lot, in my meagre to some playtime (I'll come back to that), I should say however, most of my enjoyment came when playing within premades; not in solo queue. One major flaw is the matchmaking.Even after reworks matchmaking is still an issue, that's in small part to the small player base. For example, my first game after not playing for a few months I tried solo queueing, probably not my best idea. First I was matched against a coordinated premade and obviously lost, second game it appeared to be all solo-queuers but this time it was an easy victory. With such a huge variance of player skill in a single league, as a solo player, you're out of luck starting mid-season if you want to play with similar skill players. What's more, there is still no incentive to fight out tough no-win situations instead of simply leaving so I'll address the developers directly here. Ronimo a short no-queueing punishment does not stop leavers, they simply do something else whilst the duration of their punishment clears. I can say with great certainty that half the community is straight up toxic, especially certain elitists with either high league rankings or 1K+ hours. Many of which have a horrendous attitude to lower tiered and low time players, specifically those sub 200hrs, and that is absolutely atrocious. Now I'm not saying it's everyone who reaches high playtime but it's apparent there is enough of them to warrant commenting about. Both these players and those who create dead game threads and reviews also ward off new potential players and those who would be interested in returning which in turn perpetuates the dwindling player base, one need only look at steamcharts[steamcharts.com] to see. On a lighter note, Awesomenauts has a fantastic art style especially with characters being reworked like cluck to look even better. There is also the great variety of music within the game. Beyond that, they've done well to create a cohesive world that can still take itself less than seriously. Recommended if you have friends who already play and are still actively playing, if not the avoid until some issues are resolved.Starstorm Expansion - Overdrive Expansion - Offical Soundtrack

content:
Posted: May 12, 2015
												I thought I hated MOBA's, then I played Awesomenauts.The combat is amazing, the game flow is surprisingly balanced, the art style is wonderfully retro -- Saturday morning 80's cartoons, the video game. The community is nowhere near as toxic as what I've found with DOTA2, League or Strife... it certainly has some salt and bitterness the more leagues you climb, but all in all the community is much less aggressive than others I've found.There are known faults... the matchmaking is inadequate, and the server structure is entirely peer-to-peer which lends itself to inconsistent lag for all connected parties (both of which Ronimo has acknowledged and made the next major development priority). Spectator mode does not currently exist, but is roadmapped.That all said, its quite possibly the best $1 I've ever spent for a video game, in 30+ years as a gamer.10/10, would ragequit again.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
Awesomenauts:Awesomenauts is a new and fresh take on a MOBA like League of legends or Dota, although since these are in 3D awesomenauts is not. The game feels very original when you play it, as unlike the other MOBA titles, Awesomenauts feels more like a sidescroller/platformer like mario.Bots:Bot games is something I rarely do, but when I do them I ALMOST never think that I'm playing simple programmed bots. The bots AI's have been programmed in such a way that it almost seems as if you're playing real people unlike like most other games of this genre, although you do realize that you're playing bots when they sometimes get stuck somewhere and move from side to side until either you come near, unstuck or kill them.Characters: Personally I find that the characters are oddly balanced and that quite a few characters should be nerfed, For example: a tank is already though to get them down to 0hp, add a ton of dmg to the tank and it requires an entire team to do a 1persons task. Currently there aren't many characters to chose from, which is kinda good to get to know all of them I guess, each individual character has its "own" style of attacking. For example: there is a support which mainly heals the others of his team, then there is another more "stealth" approached character who works well to finish off an enemy character .I've grown a hate & love relation with Awesomenauts due to queue really, the Queue isn't as specific in selecting who you get partnered up against for example: Recently I had a lot of games against high prestige players while I haven't even prestiged myself, this makes the game really out of balance and as result you get roflestomped and won't enjoy the game if you are competative minded.I surely didn't mind buying the game as it gave me lots of hours to enjoy and play with friends, my advice for this game: BUY IT! it isn't a waste of money, you'll enjoy the game for sure if you love a MOBA and are interested on a new take on the genre!

AwesomeNauts is an awesome game, if you don't own it you're missing out on a lot. It's probably best to avoid the multiplayer community though.Awesomenauts is a unique, challenging, and addictively fun MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena) 2D Shooter game.Pros+ Requirements are low, can be run on most PCs.+ Players can either compete against bots or against other players.+ Plenty of Characters and Maps to Unlock.+ Plenty of Challenges.+ Includes 58 Steam Achievements & 14 Steam Trading Cards.Cons- Most game content needs to be unlocked or bought via the DLC.- There seems to be an abundance of annoying people within the community.- Announcer is terribly annoying and distracting.My Rating: 9/10 (Recommended)

Posted: September 21, 2014
												With a name like "Awesomenauts" what could go wrong!? Well, a lot of things. But dont hate the game hate the PLAYER. Mentioning player, did u know players can choose from a wide vareity of 20+ characters and still adding!!! This game has constant updates, so non-stop fun. But not too many updates like splatoon. It gives you time to adapt to the changes. Now I know what your asking. "Is my money worth this?" Short answer is yes, but ill expand! Once you have the game you get the ability to unlock the new characters released (besides the DLC ones) so you dont have to buy, buy, buy to actually have fun. There are skins but they dont really effect the actual gameplay. There are so many characters, if you dont find a character that suites you, your not playing the right game! The graphics are fantastic! The voice acting is great! The characters all have unique abilities that allow you to play the way you want to play (some players dont like the way you play) Theres so many words here its hurting my eyes so ill sum up. This game is going in a great direction, and its only getting better. Buy.....this.....game

content:
Posted: November 29, 2016
												This review does focus on several community issues, as such this may appear biased. Let's start by saying Awesomenauts is not a bad game. I've enjoyed it a lot, in my meagre to some playtime (I'll come back to that), I should say however, most of my enjoyment came when playing within premades; not in solo queue. One major flaw is the matchmaking.Even after reworks matchmaking is still an issue, that's in small part to the small player base. For example, my first game after not playing for a few months I tried solo queueing, probably not my best idea. First I was matched against a coordinated premade and obviously lost, second game it appeared to be all solo-queuers but this time it was an easy victory. With such a huge variance of player skill in a single league, as a solo player, you're out of luck starting mid-season if you want to play with similar skill players. What's more, there is still no incentive to fight out tough no-win situations instead of simply leaving so I'll address the developers directly here. Ronimo a short no-queueing punishment does not stop leavers, they simply do something else whilst the duration of their punishment clears. I can say with great certainty that half the community is straight up toxic, especially certain elitists with either high league rankings or 1K+ hours. Many of which have a horrendous attitude to lower tiered and low time players, specifically those sub 200hrs, and that is absolutely atrocious. Now I'm not saying it's everyone who reaches high playtime but it's apparent there is enough of them to warrant commenting about. Both these players and those who create dead game threads and reviews also ward off new potential players and those who would be interested in returning which in turn perpetuates the dwindling player base, one need only look at steamcharts[steamcharts.com] to see. On a lighter note, Awesomenauts has a fantastic art style especially with characters being reworked like cluck to look even better. There is also the great variety of music within the game. Beyond that, they've done well to create a cohesive world that can still take itself less than seriously. Recommended if you have friends who already play and are still actively playing, if not the avoid until some issues are resolved.Starstorm Expansion - Overdrive Expansion - Offical Soundtrack

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
												This game is an incredible take on the MOBA genre. Unlike games like DOTA and LoL, Awesomenauts is based on the premise of casual competition. It is designed to be fun. An interesting result of that is the lack of a real consequence when somebody quits your team. He is replaced by a bot that is often more competent than himself and continues to play in his stead. Another player can join mid-game to replace the bot at any time.Awesomenauts also has a great community (official forum, not Steam). It has a thriving fanart community, a modding one, a tactics one, etc.This game really opens itself up to modders. It allows creators to modify in-game bots and make their own using an AI editor. Modders can also create gamemodes using this tool. If Ronimo likes a bot, it can find its way into the official game. I have made two of the in-game bots, myself.Overall, I highly recommend Awesomenauts. It has a thriving community that you should not miss out on. The gameplay is very fun, if less competitive than its other MOBA counterparts. All that is lacking is you.

AWESOMENAUTSREVIEWExcellent game, a variant from LoL and DOTA, Awesomenatus offers a MOBA in 2D, with a galactic setting and a lot of unique characters with their own trait. The game has good support and a lot of additional content, including now a expansion. If you are a MOBA fan and wants something different from the traditional ones, Awesomenauts is your best choice. The graphics is not realistic but cartoon, a beautiful kind of art. Matchs are balanced, giving you lots of fun in an easy gameplay.+Not realistic graphics but beatiful+A lot of unique characters+Good online mode+Easy and good gameplay+Offline option with bots+Lots of fun-Few scenarios-A little repetitiveThe game is good and is constantly updated, a good option for MOBA fans  8/10

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 29, 2014
												A friend got this game in a Humble Bundle, gave it a try for a laugh.  A year and a half later, Awesomenauts is easily in my top 5 favorite games of all time and has yet to lose my interest.Though billed as a "casual MOBA", this game is extremely addictive and can be quite competitive in higher league play.  Simply put, it's a simple team-based, fast-paced platformer "multiplayer online battle arena" that doesn't take itself too seriously.The music is catchy, the graphics simple yet stylish, the voice acting excellent.  Best of all the game has a sense of humor and atmosphere that's missing from the major MOBAs.Unlike the communities for similar games, the vibe is relatively laid back for beginners.  You will, of course, encounter some toxic elements in higher league play, but what good is competition without a little salt?Pros: Relatively friendly community. continually evolving gameplay, hilariously fun(especially with friends)Cons: Latency issues can be severe in some situations(supposed fix in the works)Bottom line: Some of the most fun I've ever had in gaming, and in a genre that I normally wouldn't even consider playing.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												This game WAS fun. It used to have interesting characters to play with with really memorable songs, addicive gameplay, rewarding cooperation and their characters had amusing characteristics. However most of that is gone now.Don't take just my word for it, look at how the play rate of the game use has gone down and all the latest negative reviews.In an effort to pump out more characters they can charge money for, all attempts to be creative was thrown out the window. The new characters songs are both forgetable and have no actual lyrics (but that may be for the best). With the new leveling up system, there is no making a comeback, there is only snowballing as the team with a lower level gets steamrolled. The new characters are also very steriotypical. Now we have: a generic anime robot with kid in it, mechanic inventor and a spanish bandito. Compared to the older characters like: a sociopath girlscout, fish bankrobbers and an icecream knight. Overall it feels like the design team is more concerned with making more money and pumping out more content than their players having fun and the creative detail they used to have.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2015
												The biggest issue you'll hear anybody mention with this game is the matchmaking. I agree, it's pretty nonsensical at times. But even in League of Legends you still wind up with a Diamond in a match filled with Silver players sometimes. The lack of dedicated servers is also unfortunate, but servers cost money and it's possible that Ronimo just can't swing the bill right now. Awesomenauts has been growing in popularity lately, so lets hope they pony up the dough for some dedicated servers soon. These cons aside, the game is fun and filled with plenty of character. It often goes on sale for just $0.99, so jump on it then if you're unsure.

												With a name like "Awesomenauts" what could go wrong!? Well, a lot of things. But dont hate the game hate the PLAYER. Mentioning player, did u know players can choose from a wide vareity of 20+ characters and still adding!!! This game has constant updates, so non-stop fun. But not too many updates like splatoon. This game is going in a great direction, and its only getting better. Buy.....this.....game

AwesomeNauts is an awesome game, if you don't own it you're missing out on a lot. It's probably best to avoid the multiplayer community though.Awesomenauts is a unique, challenging, and addictively fun MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena) 2D Shooter game.Pros+ Requirements are low, can be run on most PCs.+ Players can either compete against bots or against other players.+ Plenty of Characters and Maps to Unlock.+ Plenty of Challenges.+ Includes 58 Steam Achievements & 14 Steam Trading Cards.Cons- Most game content needs to be unlocked or bought via the DLC.- There seems to be an abundance of annoying people within the community.- Announcer is terribly annoying and distracting.My Rating: 9/10 (Recommended)

AWESOMENAUTSREVIEWExcellent game, a variant from LoL and DOTA, Awesomenatus offers a MOBA in 2D, with a galactic setting and a lot of unique characters with their own trait. The game has good support and a lot of additional content, including now a expansion. If you are a MOBA fan and wants something different from the traditional ones, Awesomenauts is your best choice. The graphics is not realistic but cartoon, a beautiful kind of art. content:
Posted: November 29, 2016
												This review does focus on several community issues, as such this may appear biased. Let's start by saying Awesomenauts is not a bad game. I've enjoyed it a lot, in my meagre to some playtime (I'll come back to that), I should say however, most of my enjoyment came when playing within premades; not in solo queue. One major flaw is the matchmaking.Even after reworks matchmaking is still an issue, that's in small part to the small player base. For example, my first game after not playing for a few months I tried solo queueing, probably not my best idea. First I was matched against a coordinated premade and obviously lost, second game it appeared to be all solo-queuers but this time it was an easy victory. With such a huge variance of player skill in a single league, as a solo player, you're out of luck starting mid-season if you want to play with similar skill players. What's more, there is still no incentive to fight out tough no-win situations instead of simply leaving so I'll address the developers directly here. Ronimo a short no-queueing punishment does not stop leavers, they simply do something else whilst the duration of their punishment clears. I can say with great certainty that half the community is straight up toxic, especially certain elitists with either high league rankings or 1K+ hours. Many of which have a horrendous attitude to lower tiered and low time players, specifically those sub 200hrs, and that is absolutely atrocious. Now I'm not saying it's everyone who reaches high playtime but it's apparent there is enough of them to warrant commenting about. Both these players and those who create dead game threads and reviews also ward off new potential players and those who would be interested in returning which in turn perpetuates the dwindling player base, one need only look at steamcharts[steamcharts.com] to see. On a lighter note, Awesomenauts has a fantastic art style especially with characters being reworked like cluck to look even better. There is also the great variety of music within the game. Beyond that, they've done well to create a cohesive world that can still take itself less than seriously. Recommended if you have friends who already play and are still actively playing, if not the avoid until some issues are resolved.Starstorm Expansion - Overdrive Expansion - Offical Soundtrack

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I have spent a large amount of time in this game which implies that I enjoyed myself.  Thing is, I had for the first few hours, but over time, as I came back months after months later, the game was no longer the same.  While it is an addicting game in of itself, Awesomenauts doesn't have much going for it other than the music.Quite honestly, the music is the best part about this game.  Everything else is just not up to par.  Matchmaking is probably the worst offender.  While they do have a league set-up, the game tends to not even match you up within the same league.  If that's not enough, even if you turn the "find players worldwide" option off, you'll still be matched with players from Australia.  Coupling the bad matchmaking with the awful, unbalanced Awesomenauts, you'll find yourself irritated as you play longer and longer.The way that they balance their Awesomenauts is through a group of players known as the "Betanauts" who play and give suggestions on what to change.  While this may not seem too bad when you first think about it, you need to know that they alone decide the metagame.  Characters that are unbalanced are likely to stay that way as time goes on and other characters that don't need nerfs will get them to the point they're unusable.  Furthermore, the way the game is set up, it benefits whatever team does more burst damage, to the point where you can have a team that just can't challenge the other team at all because of the matchups.Of course, that wouldn't be a problem if you could see who the other team picked and what map you were playing on.  Which you can't, of course, nor can you even communicate with your team through a chat while picking characters.  Furthermore, out of the 4 maps, only 1 is even remotely good as the others are unbalanced and make the match drag on for far too long.  In my recommendation, you should honestly pass on this game.  While it is addicting, it's not very fun and you're more than likely to get irritated while playing.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
												Awesomenauts, a game dear and close to my heart. I've spent a fair bit of time with this game, perhaps making it the only MOBA I've put the most time into. I do have a good bit to say about the game so if you want to know my thoughs about it, then strap in.Awesomenauts is a fun fast paced, 2-D side scrolling MOBA. Different and original, it sticks out of the MOBA ooze that has pleagued the video game market as of late. How does it achieve it's orginialty and also be fun?Here are the pros:*Music is perhaps the best I've heard. I love all the seperate character theme songs and the alternate killing spree songs that just get you more pumped up!*Graphics are nice and so is animation. Bright, beautiful and sometimes vibrant, it's appealing to the eyes.*All the characters are memorable and have unique personalities and looks. They are all also voice acted and some by famous youtubers!*Gameplay is just the best. It's fun to jump around and fight in a group or one on one. It doesn't get boring.*Unlike other MOBAs, there is multiple maps and they help change up the background and playstyles so each game is a little fresh.*Item customization for skills isn't bad and has some good depth to it. You can make your own or watch how the pros set up characters!*There is a pretty nice community of gamers and even an all chat to help get into games together. They may be odd but they are good people.So with ALL these pros, what could POSSIBLY be the issue?Cons:*There is a fair share of connection issues at times with causes characters to freeze in place for either a free kill or just annoyance. *Low population of gamers means this game might not be alive for much longer. It also means you'll be most likely facing the same people over and over...and onto that...*Matchmaking is hell. If you're new or even alright, you'll be slapped around by higher leagued gamers. You may think it could help you learn how to play better but when a game that is supposed to last 20-30 minutes ends up 5-10 from a slaughter, you don't learn a damn thing. *There is no punishment for people that leave games early or who are pretty rude, which ends up creating trolls and ragers. More likely than not, you'll have someone on your team drop out from rage (I will admit I do it often because I rather not keep dying and trying in a useless effort.)*Comebacks. It's nearly impossible to make a comeback in this game. For some reason, when you die you loose 30 solar while all enemies gain 40, with the killer gaining 70. I'm sure this sounded great on paper but if you think about it, it makes for some horrible matches. If your teammates are being slaugthered or even just one person on your team dies 3 to 4 times early on, you've lost. That team will begin to steam roll your entire team, turrets, and base in no time flat. Resistance is futile. *The last thing I want to point out is how broken some characters are and team compositions. You'll learn fast that there is really one a few true nauts that people will play. Ayla, the AA-auto healer from hell. Gnaw, the weedling walking and poison apocolapse and Nibbs, whos fire and teleportation makes her a pain to catch and kill. More likely than not, you'll face one or more of these naughts in each game. Also, some nauts work SO well together, that it makes it impossble to counter their team unless either REALLY lucky or you and your allies are more badass than the other team. Which will most likely be pros due to low number of new players.So with all these cons, why still the recommendation? Sure it's a game riddled with issues and has the possibility of dropping off the face of the earth soon due to the community but its still a fun game in the end. Yeah, you'll rage and you'll hate the stupid things in it but you'll oddly enjoy yourself and find yourself playing it more. Thats how I am, I hate all the dumb things but I still play it because the pros of this game are so good, you can overlook the cons...somewhat. Anyways, do get this game when you can, you'll have fun with it. Get it now for its price? Little hard to say, unless you really want to help the devs and keep this boat alive, wait till a sale and buy some copies for friends.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												I'm going to start off this review by saying that I do really enjoy this game from an on-paper level, and that if you want to have fun with your friends for a bit? Go ahead, this will appeal to that type of gamer. However when it comes to balance, this game, especially for one that is in the MOBA genre (dota, LoL, smite, etc) This game has to be hands down one of the most unbalanced I've ever seen. Clear counters are not at all in place, snowballing is a massive problem, and even when the game is fairly even, some characters are incapable of proper use or play against certain other ones, and the game often comes down to character vs character if you're going to win the entire game or not. There is also a lack of communication options so expect to try and type a lot to play with strangers. I could go on about network and reconnecting issues but they are fairly tame honestly, at least for my experience. The real issue for me was the lack of reporting options, because people will often willingly feed (get themselves killed by the enemy team on purpose) also a lot of players if they're winning extremely hard, will refuse to end the game just  to drag it on and get kills. This also brings into play the lack of surrendering as an option for matchmade games, and with a game so extremely broken because of snowballing and balancing issues, you'd think surrendering would be an option. Do you want to play this game extremely casually with friends? be my guestDo you want a solid moba with proper balancing across all characters including dlc characters? (dont get me started)This will not be the game for you if that's what you want.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 23, 2014
												Have you ever wanted to get into games like Dota 2 or League of Legends, but didn't want to get your♥♥♥♥♥kicked for 100 hours before you came proficient in it? This game is for you. I love this game, and have quite a bit of time in it. I've heard it referred to as a "Entry Level MOBA", and I think that's a great explanation. It's 3v3 gameplay that still gives the feel of teamwork and intense focus, but also is relatively easy to get into and isn't as daunting as Dota 2 or LoL. Some people use the fact that each character has a very limited set of viable builds for competative play, and that's true. At the same time, that's also the beauty of this game. There's a few ways to play each character that works well, and that makes the game MUCH easier to get into and you'll feel skilled with a character much faster. If you need more than that, and want all of the complexity of games like Dota, then just go get Dota. This game is for the people who want to dip their toes into the metaphorical MOBA pool, having fun and enjoying a more simplistic version of the aforementioned games. And even with it's simplicity, you still feel immense satisfaction after that one good match.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												So, I'm going to write a real review: Awesomenauts is a fantastic game, even for those who do not like Mobas. It takes out all the clicking in one place, and replaces it with actual skill based mechanics (It's like 2D smite in that way) The characters are extremely colorful which is amazing. They all have a personality (occasionally one sided, but all unique) There are some gripes that I have though. Some of the DLC characters are slightly overpowered (i.e. one having the highest DPS in the game, excluding map hazards, available about every ten seconds) and the matchmaking system sucks. Leauge 9 players (the lowest leauge) often get paired up with players who are around leauge 2 or leauge 1. It's very rare to find a truly balanced match. TL;DR a wonderful game with some minor issues. 8.75/10

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												A fun sidescrolling MOBA style game, though incredibly broken balance-wise (as most MOBAs tend to be).It's playerbase is freakishly small so you'll run into absolutely horrid matchmaking.Matches are Drop in/ Drop out so you'll see people constantly quitting games that have been started and often times you'll end up joining matches that have already been in progress for 15+ minutes (A guaranteed loss, and yes this counts on your record even if you played for only 2% of the match). Another detail that makes this game much different than most MOBAs is that attacking players near their turret will not prompt the turret to attack you, it will only shoot down what is closest to it. A simple change like this makes DPS characters dominate this game entirely since they can stay in your face while being unable to retort if playing as any other type of character. Teams who have a lead early on WILL win, being in the lead grants you more XP, stats AND currency making it nearly impossible to turn matches around. Do not buy this game until they update it or fix some of the broken COD-like game mechanics.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
												  I put almost 1,000 hours into this game and those were from actually playing not from card farming. I bought this game for the full price almost 2 years ago and I have seen most of the changes the game has gone through. It did have problems with matchmaking as others have said but with the latest update, Galactron, I think those issues have been fixed.   So far all the games I have played since the update have been full and no one has rage quit. Also the connection is a lot better now. Before there were many issues with lag when some players had a high ping. But again, that has seemed to have been fixed with the Galactron update.   I say give the game a shot and don't let the recentish negative reviews put you off. I think that as time goes on more people like me will update their reviews to be positive due to the matchmaking fixes with the Galactron update.

												A fun sidescrolling MOBA style game, though incredibly broken balance-wise (as most MOBAs tend to be).It's playerbase is freakishly small so you'll run into absolutely horrid matchmaking.Matches are Drop in/ Drop out so you'll see people constantly quitting games that have been started and often times you'll end up joining matches that have already been in progress for 15+ minutes (A guaranteed loss, and yes this counts on your record even if you played for only 2% of the match). Another detail that makes this game much different than most MOBAs is that attacking players near their turret will not prompt the turret to attack you, it will only shoot down what is closest to it. A simple change like this makes DPS characters dominate this game entirely since they can stay in your face while being unable to retort if playing as any other type of character. Teams who have a lead early on WILL win, being in the lead grants you more XP, stats AND currency making it nearly impossible to turn matches around. Do not buy this game until they update it or fix some of the broken COD-like game mechanics.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												So, I'm going to write a real review: Awesomenauts is a fantastic game, even for those who do not like Mobas. It takes out all the clicking in one place, and replaces it with actual skill based mechanics (It's like 2D smite in that way) The characters are extremely colorful which is amazing. They all have a personality (occasionally one sided, but all unique) There are some gripes that I have though. Some of the DLC characters are slightly overpowered (i.e. one having the highest DPS in the game, excluding map hazards, available about every ten seconds) and the matchmaking system sucks. Leauge 9 players (the lowest leauge) often get paired up with players who are around leauge 2 or leauge 1. It's very rare to find a truly balanced match. TL;DR a wonderful game with some minor issues. 8.75/10

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2016
												Awesomenauts is a fun 2D MOBA game with a cool graphics style and a large cast of heroes to play as. To bad a lot of them are locked behind DLC pay walls. The game does suffer from some balance issues as well, where some heroes just seem to be a lot stronger than others and some are so weak they are unviable. You must level up to unlock most of the heroes although this does not take long at all, even playing against the bots can net you 2-3 levels per match. The online community is small but dedicated. Ive heard alot of people complain about the toxicity of the community although in my experiences I did not recieve any of this nor did I see it, probablly because I told people right from the beginning of the match that I was new and learning. The issue I do have with match making though, is that because the community is so small you will lots of the time be ranked up against people who are far beyond your rank and at a much higher skill level. The game supports local Co-op and you can take your local buddies and play online as well. Overall I enjoy the game and mainly play local multiplayer with my girlfriend and our friends and it has earned my recommendation just for that. If you are looking for online play, be aware that the skill curve of the community is going to be hard to over come, maybe try grabbing a couple of friends to group up with to make the experience better.Game Showcase-

content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												Sigh where to begin with this game? Awesomenauts is a 2d online moba, which has a roster with over 18 different heroes which are called awesomenauts. The game play  just like any otheer moba if not a little easier. Its upgrade system is pretty straight forward, on each of your 4 rows in the shop (utility, autoattack, character specific ablity 1, character specific ablity 2) you get to choose out 6 upgrades per row, however you can only pick 3 items per row so choose carefully! The game looks pretty great with it art like graphics, the sfx and music is great aswell. Every character has its own  theme, which can be listened to ingame when a player gets 3 kills without dying,6 kills and the last time  at 9 kills. The killing spree's are all pretty good aswell. You can either play this game offline vs bots and even splitscreen. There is also ofcourse online multiplayer. However, in online matches you will defintily notice how unbalanced and unfair this game can be. And not to forget the bad match making and a lot of lag, will turn off a lot of possible playeres. The community used to be good, however it has become quite toxic and some morons will make you want to ragequit and throw your pc out of the window. These problems may not sound like much compared to the pros, but unbalanced characters and bad mathcmaking make moba a lot worse and less enjoyable then you would expect.Do i reccomend this game? yes, if you can grab it during a sale and try to make certain you have friends to play it with. Fun for the first 30 hours but because the lack of ton of online modes makes it boring afterwards. 7/10

content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												This game is a lot of fun, especially for its price (even though it seems to go on sale quite a bit). While the MOBA genre has something of a reputation for steep learning curves, I noticed Awesomenauts was fairly straightforward to learn. This said, I also noticed that it does a really good balance of remaining accessable while still rewarding high skill (both through good decision making in game, and just generally gaining experience with characters). One way the game manages this balance is by unlocking new powers/items/characters based on experience so some degree of specialty can be developed.The freshness of the game's approach to a relatively new, though often imitated genre (MOBA) is usually indicated through the little touches. For instance, having a bit of a mini-game just before respawning is a good example of a thoughtful touch that keeps the game fun and engaging, even if you keep dying a lot.Overall, MOBA fans will find enough similarities to feel at home, but enough originality (especially through the platform shooter approach) to still feel like a beginner and experience the fun of learning from the start. Non-MOBA fans will find an engaging shooter with a fun multiplayer element that encourages teamwork and competitiveness without being as 'in your face' as its peers.It is one of my go-to recommendations for a friend looking to try something new.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												Awesomenauts is a MOBA game, but it differs from the mainstream titles in the genre. You see, it's also a 2D platformer. The control scheme does not take long to get used to, and the game is quite easy to learn. Of course, if you want to get really good, you need to invest a lot of time into it. You can play bot matches and online matches, though there's also the option to make a custom game with all kinds of settings for you to adjust. The developers are frequently releasing updates and bugfixes, which just adds to the fun! Some players may be a bit rude at times (especially if you're not doing so well), but it's possible to mute them if you so desire. All in all, Awesomenauts is...well, AWESOME! Naturally, not everyone will enjoy this game, but I think it deserves a positive review.
